texts.ru: Садуллоева Навдагул проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Навдагул имеет торговую точку на рынке, где более 3 лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном торгует одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Navdagul S. lives in Kulyab. She is 39, married, and has 5 children. Navdagul sells clothing at a local market. She requested this loan to increase the volume of goods sold and to use the extra income to repair her house.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en:
Shuhratjon is a very diligent and hardworking 24-year-old man. He uses his car to provides taxi services. For the last three years, his taxi business has been his family's main income, allowing Shuhratjon to improve his family's living conditions, including those of his wife and parents. As with any business, Shuhratjon's business also requires some investment from time to time. Currently, his car needs some thorough repairs. For this purpose, Shuhratjon is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for supporting him.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To pay for thorough repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Ngone

texts.fr:
Madame Ngone S. habite à Ouakam. Elle a 33 ans. Elle est marie et mère  d’un enfant .Madame  S.   était  quelques années avant enfant bénéficiaire du programme de développement  de l’enfant et de la famille  (PDEF) de Ouakam. Ses deux principales activités  sont le commerce et la couture. C’est par le biais de sa mère  qui faisait en mémé  temps le commerce et la teinture que Ngone  s’est créé une place dans le commerce après l’arrêt  des activités  de cette dernière. Ce  qui lui plait le plus c’est    le contact avec la clientèle, les voyages qu’elle effectue dans la sous région et les échanges d’expérience. Elle capitalise une expérience de 13 ans dans son activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des tissus, les coudre et les vendre. Pour elle le crédit lui permet de réalisera des Progrès et d’être indépendante financièrement. Grâce a ses bénéfices elle parvient à supporter ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de son fils.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique apprécié
texts.en:
Ms. Ngone S. lives in Ouakam.  She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of one child.  A few years before, she was a recipient parent of the Ouakam PDEF (programme de développement  de l’enfant et de la famille), a development program for children and families.  With funds from her mother, who at the time used to work in the cloth dyeing business, Ngone established a place in the business after her mother halted her work in it. What she likes the most is the customer contact, the trips she makes in the region, and trading experiences.  She capitalizes on thirteen years of experience in this business. Ngone is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs with the goal of buy some fabrics to sew and to sell.  In her case, loans allow her to make progress and to be financially independent.  Thanks to her profits, she is able to cover her personal needs, as well as her son's. Continuing in its aim of participating actively in the struggle against poverty, U-IMCEC is succeeding with positive backing from lenders to support the people in operating their profitable revenue-generating businesses, which facilitate valued socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Augmenting her working capital

loans.name: Sirojoddin

texts.ru: Сироджиддин Сабуров проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 37 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Сироджиддин имеет среднее образование. Он более 11 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Sirojoddin S. lives in Kulyab. He is 37, married, and has 6 children. Sirojoddin has high school education. He has been in farming for more than 11 years. Sirojoddin buys, raises, and then resells cattle. He asks for this loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en:
Tolibjon is 41 years old. He was a driver and, six years ago, he started to process and sell dried apricots at the market on the weekends. Gradually, he gained more and more customers and the demand for his products increased. So Tolibjon decided to dedicate himself full-time to his food business. Now Tolibjon is requesting a loan of $1500 USD to purchase dried apricots to continue improving his business. He wants to grow his business and you can help him. Your support is very important to Tolibjon.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots

loans.name: Khasanov

texts.en: Khasanov A. lives in Baku. He is 21 years old and single. A. has had a butcher's business for two years. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more meat in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Madame Mariama D. est une femme mariée, âgée de 45 ans, qui habite a Ouakam et évolué  dans le milieu du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle vit dans une famille  dans le village de   Ouakam dont la particularité est que tous les membres sont des pêcheurs. Par conséquent la procuration en poissons n’est pas chose difficile pour elle.
Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour renforcer son capital  .Ainsi elle pourra se procurer de bons poissons très recherchée  par la classe la plus favorisée  de la population. Son  financement lui permettra de progresser dans son activité  et d’accroitre ses revenus. Elle  est mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants. L’assistance de son mari ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les dépenses. Par conséquent   avec ses bénéfiques  elle va pouvoir gérer  les gouters  des enfants, leur habillement et certaines dépensés  extra.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique apprécié
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama D. is a 45 year-old married woman, who lives in Ouakam and has advanced in the commercial world for more than ten years. She lives in a family in the village of Ouakam, and the particularity of this family is that all its members are fishermen. Consequently it is not difficult for her to get fish. She is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs to strengthen her capital. She will thereby be able to get hold of good fish which are much sought-after by the most favoured class of the population. This funding will allow her to develop her business and increase her income. She is married and has six children. The participation from her husband does not allow her to cover all the expenses. Consequently, with her profits she will be able to afford the children's snacks, their clothing and certain other expenses. In its ongoing vision of participating actively to the battle against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the backing of its lenders, is successfully providing support to people to carry out lucrative income generating activities; this will in turn contribute to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Rahmatjon

texts.en:
S. Rahmatjon is a hardworking and determined 48-year-old man. He lives with his wife and only son. Rahmatjon has taught his son the value of work, the importance of education, and family values since his son was young. For the past ten years they have run a business processing and selling dried apricots. Rahmatjon’s success and business growth has come thanks to the support of his family.
Rahmatjon is now asking for a loan in order to purchase more dried apricots. The vacation surrounding New Year is coming and, as this is a good time for his business, he doesn’t want to lose the opportunity for sales. With a little more effort and dedication, Rahmatjon dreams of seeing his business become successful.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots

loans.name: Beena

texts.en:
Beena M. is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Ashok M., works at the public bank. Her eldest son is studying in grade 7 and her younger son is studying in grade 3.
Six years ago, Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop to improve her family's economic condition. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. With her first loan through Kiva, she purchased grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks, etc. Now she is requesting a loan of 30,000 NPR to increase her stock of products such as noodles, rice, biscuits, and other items. Mrs. M. will also use the loan to expand her shop. She wishes to use her profits to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery shop

loans.name: Onyebuchi

texts.en:
Onyebuchi has a pharmacy and a grocery store, where he sells medicine as well as such items as tomato paste, tinned milk, and tea. He has been in this business for four years and is doing well.

He wants to expand his business by buying more goods for sale. He hopes to receive a loan in the amount of N150, 000 loans in order to purchase goods in bulk. He is a focused, hard-working man who puts in long hours making every effort to keep his businesses sustainable. One of his greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction he is able to have with his customers.

Onyebuchi is 27 years old. He hails from the state of Ebonyi, and he lives and works in Lagos. He sends his thanks to Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and medicines for sale

loans.name: Rammaiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur. The majority of people living in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Ram Maiya M.'s family has five members including herself. She has two sons and one daughter. Both her sons are studying at the secondary level and her daughter is in pre-school.

Her husband's name is Dharma Lal M.. He is a carpenter, and opened his furniture shop four years ago. All the requirements of the family are fulfilled from the shop's income. Mrs. M. is seeking a loan in the amount of 15,000 NPR to buy lumber to use in building furniture. Her husband makes a variety of different furniture: beds, tables, chairs, wardrobes, and so on.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.en:
Yusufjon is a hard-working entrepreneur from Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married with two children. He has operated his own business of producing wooden doors and window frames for the past six years. Yusufjon has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. He works hard to earn a good income and support his family.

Yusufjon has requested a loan of $1100 to buy some tools that he needs for his business. Yusufjon appeals to your generosity so that he can improve his family's living conditions. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase tools for his manufacturing business.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatimata  C. est une brave dame de 55 ans qui  habite a Ouakam et  fait partie des membres fondateurs de l’U-IMCEC. Elle a adhéré  depuis l’installation du micro crédit dans le village de   Ouakam. Elle a déjà rembourse 9 prêts antérieurs. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus, comme  la voile, les  thioubs, les wax et les produits locaux saisonniers. Madame  C. faisait de la teinture, mais a cause de son âge  et les risques lies a cet activité  elle a cesse cet activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son stock de marchandise. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants particulièrement  des filles. Par conséquent  son objectif est d’aider ses enfants et de participer au bon fonctionnement de la maison. Et ceci elle parvient a le faire grâce a l’accroissement de ses bénéfices.
. Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié
texts.en:
Madame Fatimata C. is a nice 55 year-old lady who lives in Ouakam and is one of the founding members of U-IMCEC. She joined when micro finance was first introduced in Ouakam village, and has already repaid 9 previous loans. She is involved in the sale of fabric, such as veils, thioub cloth, wax "pagnes" (brightly coloured cloths) and local seasonal products. Madame C. used to dye the cloth herself, but owing to her age and the risks inherent in this practice, she no longer does this. She is seeking a 350 000 frs loan in order to replenish her stock. She is a married mother of 6 children, all girls, and consequently her aim is to support her children and play an active role in running her home. She is able to do this through increasing the profits from her business. As part of its ongoing view to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC uses lenders' support in order to help communities to run lucrative revenue-generating businesses; this contributes to socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en:
M. Mukarram is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Mukarram has a grocery store which she attends to herself, along with caring for her family and her home. She began her business ten years ago. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income, and the business has been growing gradually ever since. The business went well from the beginning. By the time Mukarram expanded her business, her grocery store was well known in her community.

In order to expand her business further, she is requesting a loan of $1500. Mukarram is planning to spend the loan for purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the variety of food she sells. She promises to repay her loan without any violations and thanks everyone who decides to support her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods in order to increase the variety of goods she sells

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita K. is a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Shiva Dev K., is an electrician. They have two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 9. Her older son is studying in grade 8 and her younger son is studying in grade 5.

Mrs. Sarita K. is a farmer. She owns a piece of land where she grows green vegetables. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening.

Sarita is requesting a 20,000 NPR loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ranjana

texts.en:
Mrs. Ranjana P. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Ranjana P. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Sanu Babu P., is a farmer. Her older son is studying in grade 7 and the younger son in grade 2.

Mrs. Ranjana is engaged in selling cow’s milk. She already owns two cows and sells the cow’s milk in her neighborhood. Nowadays, in that region, the demand for cow’s milk is increasing constantly. To meet the demands of her customers she needs another young milk-giving cow, so she is requesting a 10,000 NPR loan to buy a young milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola has two businesses: she sells both clothes and eggs. She has been running these business since 1995 and they are her primary source of income.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 in order to purchase more clothes and eggs to sell. With the combined businesses, she is able to provide for her family's basic needs to afford other necessities. With the loan, she plans to expand her businesses, which are now thriving. With this kind of business, she hopes to increase on her earnings in the long run and to be better able to provide for her children's education. She sends her thanks to all her lenders.

Bola lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are doing well in school.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and eggs for sale

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en:
Omolola, age 42, enjoys her clothes-selling trade. She lives in Lagos and has been in business for 10 years. She is married and has four children: the school-aged ones are enrolled in school. With the proceeds from her business, she is able to assist her husband in providing for the household expenses.

She hopes for a loan of N140,000 in order to purchase more clothes to sell. This will help her to increase her stock, and expects that an expanded inventory will also attract more customers.

She thanks you for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Mrs. Shova T., a 35-year-old lady, lives in Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single-family home with four members: herself, her husband, a daughter and a son. Her husband, Mr. Shiva T., works in a private office. Both her son and daughter are studying in grade 10.

Mrs. T. started selling cows’ milk a year ago. She already owns one cow and now she is requesting loan of Rs10,000 to buy another young cow to sell its milk in the local area. She lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal people love to drink cows’ milk so demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye S. est un homme très dynamique qui habite dans la localité de  Ouakam et qui évolue  dans le domaine de l’aviculture depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle a démarré  cet activité  grâce  au conseil d’un ami qui avait vu que c’était un domaine très  rentable. Ce  qui le passionne le plus dans son activité  c’est l’adaptation du local aux conditions de vie des sujets et le respect des normes sanitaires. Monsieur S. est marie et père  de 2 enfants. Il  sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destines a l’achat de poussins et d’aliment. Son  objectif est d’accroitre la production.
. Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye S. is a very dynamic man who lives in Ouakam and who has worked in aviculture (bird-raising) for over 10 years. He entered this field thanks to the advice of a friend who told him that it was a profitable area. The thing that inspires him the most about his work is the adaptation of the birds' habitat to the living conditions and hygiene standards that they require. Mr. S. is a married father of two. He is seeking a 500 000 frs credit in order to purchase chicks and food, with the aim of increasing his output. As part of its ongoing aim of actively engaging in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC utilises lenders' support in order to assist communities in lucrative, revenue-generating business ventures. This contributes to socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Mrs. Manju K. has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 3 and her son is just 4 months old. Her husband, Mr. Suresh K., is an electrician.

Manju already owns a cow and she has been selling milk in the area. In Nepal pure, fresh cows’ milk is highly valued for its nutrition. She lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells door-to-door daily in the morning and evening.

Because of the rising demand, Manju wants to buy another cow to increase her production, so she seeks an Rs 20,000 loan. She plans to purchase a Jersey cow which produces more milk than other breeds.

loans.use: To buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila S. is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives in a single-family home with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Min S., works in a hardware store and her son is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. S. opened a grocery shop five years ago and sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family.

Now, Mrs. S. is requesting Rs 15,000 to increase the necessary stock of food items in her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits (cookies) and other items. She wishes to use her income to provide a better education for her son.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Man Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Man Kumari N. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Sanepa. In her shop she sells different types of groceries such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks, etc. She opened her grocery store to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now, she is requesting an Rs 15,000 loan to buy more groceries for her store.

Mrs. N. lives with her husband and two children. Her Husband, Mr. Raj Kumar N., works in a private office. They have one son and one daughter, both of whom are studying in primary school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is 44 years old, is married, and has two children. He lives with his family in Baku city.

Vidadi has been in his café business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy necessary things for his café.

loans.use: To buy necessary things for his café

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a young Palestinian woman, 28 years old. She is married with two young daughters aged 1.5 years and 3 months. Tamam and her husband are both employees: Tamam is a nurse while her husband is a police officer.

A year ago they established a grocery store to increase their income. While they are at their jobs Tamam’s brother-in-law manages the shop. In the grocery shop they sell candy, canned food, stationery, etc. The shop is near the UNRWA clinic and UNRWA School.

The UNRWA is the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for the Palestinian refugees who left their houses in Haifa, Yafa and settled in refugee camps in the West Bank and Gaza while some settled in refugee camps in Jordan, Lebanon and Syria. This UN agency provide education and health service in addition to many other services.

Since the grocery shop is located near a very busy area there is a huge demand and a good profit is coming from it. Tamam requested 2,000 USD to buy a freezer for frozen food in addition to buying other goods.

Because of cultural issues, Tamam's husband appears in the picture instead of her.

Tamam husbend appears in the photo at thier store.

loans.use: To buy goods for the grocery store and a freezer

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana, age 46, is a very hard-working married woman who works hard to provide for her five children, four of whom are in school. She trades in cereals like maize and gari, which is prepared from milled cassava. She sells gari grains in bulk in the market. She acquires her stock from the nearby communities and distributes her wares during market days.

She has a large customer base, but her problem has to do with having adequate funds to buy enough stock. With this loan assistance, she believes she will have full resources in order to realize good profits.

loans.use: To buy cereals like gari and maize grains for sale

loans.name: Nike

texts.en:
Nike, age 40, is a clothes seller. She has been doing business for the past 10 years. She sells her clothing wares in a very busy area in Lagos State, Nigeria. Through the business, she is able to provide for her family's beeds. She is married and has three children, for whom she wants the best possible education. She puts in long hours making every effort to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

She needs a loan of N140,000 in order to purchase more clothes to sell. She sends you her thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
Grace, age 46, is a baker. She is the one standing in the middle of the group photograph, wearing the yellow top. She has been baking and selling bread in bulk for four years now and has been able to meet the demand of her customers despite having faced numerous challenges. She supplies her wares in the market center to her customers and also offers bulk delivery to customers who require it.

Her only problem now has to do with procuring adequate funds to buy raw materials now that prices are going up. She requests this loan in order to buy stock baking materials like margarine, sugar, firewood, and flour. She is eager to continue to increase profit through her business throughout the extended festive Christmas season.

With the loan, she can continue to provide for her children, especially in terms of ensuring their education. She is the divorced mother of five children, two of whom have graduated from the senior high school: the younger ones are still in school.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Promise.' Most of the members of this group are petty traders and foods vendors. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan, and they support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy owns a hairdressing business, offering hairstyling services in a location which is very favorable for most of her customers. She specializes in selling hair extensions. She has been in this business since 2008. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

She is 28 years old and is married with a small child. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N50,000 in order to purchase more hair extensions to sell.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Great God Of Wonders Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 40, is a seamstress. She is the one standing in the middle in the group photograph. She has been sewing dresses for 14 years now and specializes in making women's clothing. Her skills and designs are of a very high quality. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, producing such items as children's school uniforms, church attire, kaba-and-slit items, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes. 

She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, thread, and thimbles. She hopes to increase her output and efficiency. Her goal is to increase her savings in order to provide her children with a quality education. She is married and a mother of four children. All her children are in school. She is happy to report that her family is doing very well. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Great God of Wonders’. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and food vendors. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan. They would all be grateful for your assistance and support.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, and thimbles

loans.name: Thiane

texts.fr:
Madame Thiane  K. habite dans la localité de  Ouakam. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de  Ouakam à l’U-Imcec  depuis 2008 et a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt  antérieur.  C’est une femme mariée  avec 2 enfants. Elle a une activité diversifiée .Elle évolue  aussi bien dans le commerce d’articles divers que dans  l’aviculture. Elle a une expérience  de10 ans dans son activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destine a l’achat de jouets, draps, couches, chaussures, sacs, greffages et d’habits  qu’elle va vendre dans son magasin situe en face du marche de Ouakam. Ses marchandises sont souvent adaptées aux besoins des clients en fonction des événements. Ce qui la passionne  dans son activité  c’est le contact avec la clientèle  et le fait qu’elle parvienne à s’occuper. Ce crédit lui permet d’élargir sa gamme de produits à offrir à la clientèle  en vue de la satisfaction de son besoin. Par conséquent l’accroissement de ses bénéfices  lui permet de mieux investir dans le domaine de l’élevage.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié
texts.en:
Mrs Thiane K. lives in the village of Ouakam. She has been a member of the savings bank in Ouakam which belongs to the IMCEC mutual savings and credit union (U-IMCEC) since 2008 and has had one previous loan. She is a married woman with two children. She has a diversified activity. She is developing a commercial business selling various products as well a poultry farming business. She has ten years of experience in her activities. She is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs with which she intends to buy toys, sheets, nappies, shoes, bags, hair weaves ("greffages") and clothes that she will sell in her shop, which lies opposite the market in Ouakam. Her goods are often adapted to the needs of her clients depending on the occasion. What interests her most in her business is the contact with her customers and the fact that she gets to attend to them. This loan will allow her to expand the range of products she can offer to her customers with a view to satisfying their needs. The resulting increase in her profits will allow her to invest more in the poultry farming business. In line with its ongoing vision to participate actively in the battle against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the backing of its lenders, is successfully providing support for people to carry out lucrative income-generating activites; this in turn contributes to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is excited about taking out his first loan. He is 34 years old and is married with a child. He supports his family by making and selling furniture. He has been in business for the past seven years.

John is requesting a loan in the amount of N80,000. He will use this loan to invest in his business, specifically to buy furniture-making materials in bulk to get a better price. He hopes that this loan will help him build a business that will be profitable, particularly to provide for his child's future.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to build furniture

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, age 40, sells cosmetics. She has been in business for the past 20 years. She is a focused, hard-working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria, and she is married with two children.

She wishes to expand her business by increasing her stock as the demand for cosmetics is high. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,00, which she will use to purchase more cosmetics items to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Sulaba

texts.en:
Sulaba, 60 years old, is a widow with five children. She sells soft drinks and has been in her business for the past five years. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000, which she will use to invest in buying beverages in bulk to get a better price. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable, particularly to ensure a strong future for her children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages to sell

loans.name: Erlan

texts.es:
Erlan trabaja como albañil, es viudo y tiene tres hijos de siete, cinco y tres años de edad. Erlan vive con su madre quien le colabora con el cuidado de sus  hijos. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para compra mercadería; su difunta esposa le dejó un puesto de venta de chifleria (material de curanderos y sahumerios). Erlan reactivará la actividad mencionada, de esa forma podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus familia.
 
Es el primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por Erlan.
texts.en:
Erlan works as a bricklayer. He is a widower, and he has three children. They are seven, five, and three years old. Erlan lives with his mother, and she helps him take care of the children. He lives in his parents’ house, which is located in the Villa Esperanza area of the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy merchandise. His deceased wife left him a stand selling medicinal herbs (material used by folk healers and in traditional ceremonies). Erlan will restart this business. That way he will be able to improve his income to support his family. This is his first loan with Kiva. The completed evaluation grants Erlan access to the loan he has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural curative products to reactivate the business his wife had

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seasonal fruit

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel  vive en la zona Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en anticrítico; tiene tres hijos y su esposa se dedica a la venta de pescado en las ferias.

Fidel es minero cooperativista; extrae oro de concesiones que se le otorga en diferentes zonas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra una acción minera.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Fidel lives in the Los Andes area in the city of El Alto. He pays for his house with an anticrítico loan; he is married, has three children and sells fish at fair markets. Fidel is a cooperative miner; he extracts gold in several areas of concession he got permit for, around the city of La Paz. He will use the loan to buy mining stocks. This is his second loan with IMPRO; he received a positive evaluation in order to be granted another loan.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mining stocks to become a member of a mine cooperative.

loans.name: Abigirl

texts.en:
Abigirl, age 40, sells cream, drinks, and groceries to provide for the needs of her family. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is married and has four children, ages 11, 14, 17, and 20. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

To meet the demand of her customers, Abigirl is requesting a loan in the amount of N60,000 in order to purchase more cream and groceries to sell.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de leche la cual  comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive en la comunidad de Chijipina Chico  sector Achacachi de Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa y sus  cinco hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Alfonso raises cows and produces milk, which he sells to Pil Andina, an industrial milk plant. He lives in the community of Chijipina Chico in the Achacachi sector of Omasuyos province, in the departament of La Paz, which is located 4 hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and their five school-aged children. The loan will be used to purchase an improved breed of cattle, which will increase his milk production and as a result, increase his income. This is his second loan with IMPRO. Their evaluation qualified him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to increase his production of milk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 35, owns a hairdressing business, offering hairstyling services in a location which is very favorable for most of her customers. She also sells hair extensions and hair accessories. She puts in long hours in an effort to keep her business sustainable. She and her husband, who sells beef products, both contribute to the support of the family. They live in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria, and have three children, ages two, nine, and 12.

Mary is requesting a loan in the amount of N50,000 in order to purchase more hair extensions and hair accessories to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair accessories to sell

loans.name: Bertha Gumercinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Bertha Gumercinda H. O. de 46 años de edad vive en su casa propia con su hija de 17 años de edad en Calle Luren – Cercado de Ica.
Se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y otros productos de consumo masivo. Su negocio funciona en su domicilio. Tiene en el giro como 5 años y gracias a su trabajo esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado obtener sus bienes y darle una educación a su hija quien se encuentra preparándose para postular a la universidad. 
La Sra. goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes manifiestan que es bien trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella desea que le apoyemos para invertir mas en su negocio poder comprar panteones y otros por campaña navideña y así obtener un ingreso adicional que le permitirá apoyar a su hija en la inscripción para su postulación ya que su mayor sueño es que su hija sea profesional y pueda encontrar un trabajo que le ayude a seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Bertha Gumercinda H. O. is 46. She lives in her own house with her 17 year old daughter. They live on Luren – Cercado Street in Ica. She sells sweets, soft drinks, and other popular consumption products. Her business is in her home. She has been doing this for five years. Thanks to her work, effort, and dedication she has obtained her belongings and paid for her daughter’s education. Her daughter is preparing to apply to the university. She has good references from her neighbors who say she is enterprising and very hard-working. She wants us to help her invest more in her business. She wants to be able to buy “panteones” (Christmas cakes) and other things for the Christmas season. That way she will get an additional income that will allow her to help her daughter in her enrollment. Her greatest wish is that her daughter become a professional and be able to find work that will help her succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, vive en la calle Uruguay de la zona Urbanización Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos menores  con los cuales trabaja, en su propio domicilio.


Tiene una pequeña planta donde elabora frituras  (papitas fritas, postres fritos, en bolsitas), de manera artesanal, los cuales los distribuye en los varios kioskos que existen en la ciudad de El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos, papa, postre, etc. Al por mayor, y así mejorar sus ventas.

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Paulina lives on Uruguay Street in the Ubanización Mercurio area of the city of El Alto. She lives in her own home with her husband and their children, with whom she works. She has a small plant where she makes fried foods (fried potatoes, fried desserts in little bags) by hand. She distributes them to the various kiosks that exist in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy supplies, potatoes, and desserts, etc. wholesale. That way she will improve her sales. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes and desserts (bananas) to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Eduardo Estewal

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 2 hijos. Manuel vive en casa de sus padres, El adquirió su vehiculo propio con ahorros obtenidos de las utilidades. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda, en la actualidad brinda servicio de transporte escolar, teniendo un ingreso adicional. Eduardo sueña con tener  más de una unidad y así formar su propia empresa de vehículos las cuales brindarían el servicio en la ciudad de Ica. Eduardo destina todos los ingresos para la educación de sus hijos, el cual se encuentra estudiando la universidad. Eduardo desea que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación y así sentirá que todo su esfuerzo valió la pena. El solicita el crédito para realizarle mantenimiento a su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Eduardo is forty-three, single, and has two children. Manuel lives in his parents' house. He saved up his money to buy his own vehicle. He currently runs a school transportation service, with which he has quite a bit of experience and earns extra income. He dreams of having more than one vehicle so he can start up his own transportation company to serve the city of Ica. Eduardo spends all of his income to educate his children, who are at the university. He wants them to have a good education so he can feel like all his effort was worth it. He plans to use his loan to do maintenance on his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Soliita cédito para mantenimiento de vehículo

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de leche que comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Ticuyo  sector Laja de Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a sus padres y hermanos menores a quien colabora económicamente para sus estudios.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de ganado y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana raises cows and produces milk that she sells to Pil Andina, an industrial milk plant. She lives in the community of Ticuyo in the Laja sector of Los Andes province in the department of La Paz, located 4 hours from the city of La Paz. She lives with her parents and her younger brothers, and she helps out with their educational expenses. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow and in this way increase her production of milk as well as her income. This is her second loan with IMPRO, and their evaluation qualified her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to increase her production of milk

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, vive en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en su casita propia, junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como albañil  y sus hijos menores  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. 

Tiene un pequeño kiosco en el cual, se dedica a la venta de comida. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de insumos, papa, carne, postre, verduras, etc.,  al por mayor, y así rebajar sus costos y mejorar sus ventas.

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband in her own home. He works as a bricklayer, and their minor children go to school. She has a small kiosk where she sells food. This loan will be used to buy supplies wholesale such as potatoes, meat, desserts, vegetables, etc., in order to lower her costs and improve her sales. This is her first loan with IMPRO, and their evaluation qualified her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food-selling business

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda  de 24 años es una joven muy alegre, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su madre Juana de 52 años, y su pequeña hija, esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para darles una buena  calidad de vida.La tienda de ropa de Clorinda esta ubicada en el centro de su ciudad, ahí ofrece a sus clientes novedosos vestidos, los cuales son muy solicitados por las jovencitas, sobre todo para asistir a sus bailes de promociones. Los vestidos que vende los confecciona ella misma, motivo por el cual los diseños que tiene en venta son originales .Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes que vienen a comprar vestidos, siempre les dice cual les queda mejor o cual combina con su color de piel, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer mucho tiempo en su tienda sin poder salir. Para el futuro, espera aperturar  una tienda más amplia  donde no solo venda vestidos, si no también ropa casual.Es el primer préstamo de Clorinda con  MFP y a su corta edad sabe que tiene que pagarlo y no fallar en las  cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que es la mas joven y alegre.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos materiales para elaborar más vestidos y así ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Clorinda is twenty-four and is a very happy young woman. She lives in a rented room with her mother, Juana, 52, and her little daughter. She is willing to work very hard to provide them with a good quality of life. She sells original dresses to her clients at her clothing store in the center of the city. Her dresses are in high demand by the young ladies, especially for their proms. Clorinda sews the dresses herself because she wants to sell original designs. What she likes best about her work is advising her clients; she always tells them which dress looks best on them or which color works best with their skin tone. She's been doing this for three years, and the hardest part for her is having to remain at the store for long periods of time without being able to leave. In the future she'd like to open a more diversified store where she can sell casual clothing as well as dresses. This will be Clorinda's first loan with MFP, and even at her young age she knows she has to pay it back without missing any payments. She is well-loved at her village bank because she is the youngest and most cheerful. She plans to use the thousand soles she is requesting to buy new materials to make more dresses so she can offer her clientele more variety.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to sew more dresses

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y a la producción de leche  que comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Sullcataca Baja de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposo, el cual colabora en los trabajos y cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Modesta raises cattle and sells the milk to Pil Andina, the leading milk supplier in Bolivia. She lives in Sullcataca Baja, in the Los Andes province, located three hours from the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who helps with the cattle. She will use this loan to purchase a better type of dairy cow and increase her milk production, thus increasing her income. This is her first loan with Impro; her evaluation indicates she qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Al

texts.en:
Al P. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  He is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Al owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Al has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Al joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Al has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Al is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Al from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for sale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y a la producción de leche  que comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive en la comunidad de Tipampa  sector Achacachi de Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa y su hijo menor el cual esta en últimos años en edad escolar  quien también colabora  en los trabajos del cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Victor earns his living raising cows and producing milk that he sells to Pil Andina, an industrialized milk plant. He lives in the community of Tipampa in the Achacachi sector of the Omasuyos province, part of the La Paz region of Bolivia, four hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and his youngest son, who is still school age and helps his father take care of the livestock. Victor will use the loan to buy livestock of higher quality breeding, as a way to increase his milk production and as a result, his earnings. This is Victor's second loan with Impro. A credit evaluation qualified him for a second loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow in order to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Trinidad tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. La socia Trinidad es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje. 

La socia desde muy temprano del día hace sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su esposo y sus hijos. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a atender su negocio de venta de carne. Nuestra socia nos cuenta que ella compra ganado como res, cordero, chancho y alpaca y después lo vende como carne. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más chancho pues en esta época del año es donde se vende más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 46, married, and has four children. Trinidad is from the city of Urcos in the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. She belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. The city of Urcos is 45 kilometers from the city of Cusco, which is a trip of approximately 45 minutes. She starts her household chores very early in the day. For example, she prepares breakfast for her husband and children. After she does her household chores, she has to go to tend her business of selling meat. She tells us that she buys livestock like cows, sheep, pigs, and alpaca. She later sells it as meat. She has been in this business for 15 years. It has gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business. She wants to buy more pigs. This time of year they sell more. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea  vive en la avenida 1   en la zona Puerto Mejillones de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como transportista en el interior del país, su hijo de 7 años y su bebe recién nacida.
 
Se dedica a la confección de mantas para señoras de manera artesanal,  solo a solicitud expresa.


El crédito lo destinará a la compra de lana y otros insumos para la realización de su trabajo
 
Es el  primer crédito en Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Andrea lives on Avenue 1 in the Puerto Mejillones zone of the city of El Alto.

She lives with her husband, who works in the transport industry in the interior of the country, and with her 7 year-old son and newborn daughter.

She makes handmade ladies’ shawls, by request only.

She plans to use this loan to purchase wool and other products that will enable her to continue with her work.

This is her first loan with Impro; her evaluation indicates she qualifies for this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and other weaving materials

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She has a business centre where she types and photocopies documents for customers. She would like to have a bigger business centre in the future and wants to sell stationary as well. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her husband is a printer and they both contribute to support the family. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000. With this, she will invest the loan in the business by buying material and stationery in bulk to get a better price. She say 'thank you' to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more material and stationary.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maruja tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos: Cristhian tiene 08 años, Jhon tiene 06 años y Yashira tiene 03 años. La socia Maruja es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia desde muy temprano del día hace sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su esposo y sus hijos, limpiar la casa y cocinar para el almuerzo. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir atender su negocio de venta de pollo y pescado. Nuestra socia nos cuenta que ella compra los productos de los mayoristas de la ciudad del Cusco y después lo vende en el “Mercado Unidos de Urcos”. Ya son 12 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su carro pues es el medio de transporte para traer sus productos de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje.
texts.en:
Maruja is 30, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Cristhian is 8, Jhon is 6, and Yashira is 3. Maruja is from the city of Urcos in the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. She belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She starts her household activities very early in the day. For example, she makes breakfast for her husband and children, cleans the house, and cooks for lunch. After doing these household chores, she has to go tend to her business of selling chicken and fish. She buys the products wholesale in the city of Cusco. Then, she sells them in the Mercado Unidos of Urcos. She has been in this business for 12 years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to be able to perform maintenance on her car. This is her form of transportation to bring her products from the city of Cusco. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time. The city of Urcos is 45 kilometers from the city of Cusco, which is approximately a 45 minute trip.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perform maintenance on her car

loans.name: Apeke

texts.en: Apeke is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. She is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She sells plantains, which she buys from the nearby village market to sell in retail and wholesale. She lives in Ibadan Oyo state Nigeria. She assists her husband in supporting the family. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more plantains to sell, as the demand is high.  She enjoys the business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She says a big 'thank you' to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia de 24 años vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su hijo Joe de 1 año y lo que más desea es darle una buena calidad de vida.El persistente trabajo de Delia poco a poco va dando resultados, el restaurante que con tanto esfuerzo aperturó cada día tiene mayor cantidad de  clientes. Y es que su negocio, es uno de los lugares más concurridos, debido a la gran atención que brinda, pero sobre todo a la deliciosa sazón que tienen sus comidas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, ya que es la administradora del restaurante, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es satisfacer a sus clientes y brindarles un buen servicio, ya que las personas son muy exigentes, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Con el tiempo, espera que su restaurante crezca y se convierta en uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad.Es el primer préstamo de Delia con  MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas sillas y mesas para mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante, y así atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Delia is 24. She lives in a rented room with her one year old son, Joe. What she wants most is to give him a good quality of life. Delia’s persistent work is, little by little, giving results. Her restaurant, which she opened with such effort, is getting more customers everyday. Her restaurant is one of the most popular places because of the good service she offers, and, above all, the delicious seasoning she gives her food. What she likes most about her work is running the restaurant. She has been in this business for three years. The most difficult part is satisfying her customers and giving them good service. Some people are very demanding. Even so, she knows that this is her work, and she has to do it. In time, she hopes her restaurants grows and becomes one of the most well known in the city. This is Delia’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it on time because she does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy new tables and chairs to improve the atmosphere in her restaurant. That way she will attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equip her restaurant with new furniture

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Juan Carlos tiene 32 años, es conviviente, El socio Juan Carlos es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa.

El socio hace servicio de transportes en la ciudad de Urcos. Ya son varios años con el servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para implementar y hacer mantenimiento del carro y desea comprar accesorios nuevos como radio, llantas.         
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Juan Carlos is 32 years old and is living with someone. He is a native of the city of Urcos, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco, and he belongs to the “Qori Orcco” Cummunal Bank pf the Arariwa Association.

Juan Carlos provides transportation services in the city of Urcos. He has done this for several years and it has gone well, thanks to all the effort he puts into his work. He is a hard-working and enterprising father who advances his family. Juan Carlos needs this loan to perform maintenance on his car, and he wants to buy new accessories such as a radio and tires.

He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this medium and also, he is committed to compliance with the payments outlined in the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PERFORM MAINTENANCE ON HIS TAXI AND BUY ACCESSORIES FOR IT

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She sells garri (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava/manioc) and has been in the business for the past 15 years. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her husband is also a salesman. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000. With the loan, she plans to expand her garri business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and to be able to better provide for her children's education. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell.

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna B. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Bnac Villageois de KA FALL depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour l’avoir contracté à fois de suite. Elle développe une activité de commerce d’arachide et fait de l'embouche bovine. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sokhna B. is a 47 year-old woman who is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the KA FALL village bank for three and a half years. She has a good experience with loans having taken out several consecutively. She is building up a business selling peanuts and also has a beef fattening activity. Her profits will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra F. est mariée, elle est âgée de 42 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KA FALL depuis 3 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 7 prêts qu’elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait de l’embouche bovine et ovine. Avec les profits générés par son activité elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Diarra F. is married, 42 years old, and the mother of two children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de KA FALL for 3½ years and has benefited from it in the form of seven loans, which she always managed well and repaid. Diarra fattens cattle and sheep. With the profits generated from her business, she supports her husband in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her business fattening livestock

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en: Waheed is 51 years old and married with 4 children who are all doing well in school. He sells medicine. "I love my business because I love seeing people healthy", says Waheed. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife is a nurse and they both contribute to supporting the family. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He believes that having an assortment of medicine that is of good quality will increase his sales. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria C. integrante del grupo  El Sol que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, indica que es parte de este grupo hace 4 años aproximadamente, ingreso un poco insegura, temerosa de que no pudiera cumplir con la deuda, pero como necesitaba dinero se arriesgó, ella vende dulces y helados en una cancha fabril y le va bien, ya que con esos ingresos ha podido sacar adelante sola a su familia, ya que ella es viuda, su hija también se encuentra en el grupo. Ahora necesita el préstamo para hacer reparar su máquina heladera. Las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de ropa, peluches, helados, masitas, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de tarjetas y atención de Internet.
Todas necesitan el préstamo, una vez más, para seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios y crecer día a día.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria C. is a member of the El Sol group which is itself a member of the Centro Focal Panamericana. She reports she has been a part of this group for approximately 4 years. When she joined she was a little uncertain and afraid that she wouldn't be able to pay off the debt, but since she needed money she took the risk. She sells candy and ice cream at a sports field and it's going well for her. With that income she has been able to get her family ahead by herself, since she is a widow. Her daughter is also in the group. Right now she needs the loan to be able to repair her ice cream machine. The other members of the group also have their own businesses such as the sale of clothes, stuffed animals, ice cream, baked goods, sewing clothing, and the sale of cards and internet service. They all need the loan, once again, to continue investing in their businesses and to grow day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: THE PURCHASE OF MERCHANDISE AND TO REPAIR FIXED ASSETS

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo sells groceries. She is 32 years old, married with 2 children aged 13 and 9. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She assists her husband with meeting the family's basic needs. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo tiene 58 años, y junto a él vive su pareja y su hijo de tres años en su casa propia. Es así que para ganarse la vida y mantener a su familia se dedica desde 20 años a su taller de mecánica de motos y motocarros, ubicado en una parte de su terreno que tiene ya que no hay mejor lugar para trabajar tranquilamente. Paralelo a ello, Adolfo tuvo la oportunidad de comprarse una moto en el que parte de sus ratos libres se dedica al transportes de pasajeros al mismo tiempo ofrece arrendar su moto para que otros personas lo trabajen. Es de esta manera como se gana la vida, siendo su mayor motivación el trabajo de mecánica ya que se relaciona con muchas personas además que le resulta más rentable por tener clientes fijos. Con el tiempo espera construir un local más adecuado para su taller. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y esta dispuesto a ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. El espera invertir con el préstamo que solicita en su taller de mecánica, implementándolo con nuevas herramientas y darle mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 58 years old and lives in a home he shares with his common-law wife and their three-year-old son. They are his inpiration to gain a better life. For the past 20 years, Adolfo has operated a mechanic's shop for motorcycles and moto-cars. His shop is located on a portion of his land because there isn't a better place available for him to work quietly. In addition to his workshop, Adolfo had the opportunity to purchase a moto-taxi for himself, and during his free time he either transports passengers with it or rents it to other taxi drivers who are without access to a moto-taxi. When he rents his moto-taxi, his earnings also increase at the mechanic's shop because he has more time to simply interact with his clients and thus create permanent clients who return to him time after time. Currently, he is hoping to find a different plot of land where he can build his workshop, in order to have it in a more convenient location. This is Adolfo's fourth loan with Micro-Finanzas Prisma, and he is very reliable when it comes to his loan repayments.
