Gloria del Carmen is 22 years old and has a modest family shop which began with shoe making and has expanded to create a line of leather goods such as bags, wallets, belts, caps, hats and briefcases among other products. Her husband and two helpers share the work at the shop. Her children are also learning the craft during their vacation.

José Humberto is 29 years old and makes leather crafts along with his brother. He will invest the loan in the purchas of leather.

Gloria Venicia, on the other hand, is 48 years old and has a completely different business. She sell fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Señor Fernando es un cliente  que esta en su segunda secuencia hasta el momento se ha visto que es un hombre responsable y dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia, durante este corto tiempo que ha 
trabajado con la institucion el Sr. Fernando no ha tenido ningun problemas con sus pagos.  El vive en un departamento en anticretico con su Esposa, sus dos pequeños Hijos y su Mama la cual es una persona de edad avanzada, ella se encuentra bajo el cuidado de su hijo quien se dedica a ayudarla en todo lo que puede.  El cliente destinara el credito en la compra de una radio de comunicaciones para su movilidad la cual le fue extrahida de la misma movilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando is a client in his second loan cycle. He has proven to be a responsible man, and is dedicated to his work and his family. During the short time he has worked with this institution, Fernando has had no problems with his payments. He lives in a rented apartment with his wife, their two small children, and his mother, who is elderly. She is under the care of her son, who helps her any way he can.

He will use the loan to buy a communications radio for his taxi, since his was taken from his car.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a radio for communication

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
El banco comunal Narancay Bajo esta formado por un grupo de socia(o)s que siempre han tendido como meta salir adelante ante cualquier obstáculo y brindar a sus familias lo mejor de si y un poco de comodidad de lo que no tuvieron en su vida, viven al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad que tiene muchos encantos tradiciones y festividades su gente es calida y amables todos los que visitan a Cuenca se van enamorados y siempre con la promesa de volver.

La Sra. Rosa S. es socia del Banco Comunal Narancay Bajo, vive en las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca, a unos 15 minutos al sur de la ciudad, en el sector del mismo nombre, tiene 32 años de edad, se encuentra casada, fruto de su unión conyugal han procreado 3 hijos que se encuentran de 11, 8, 2 años de edad, sus dos hijos estudian en la escuela Nicolás Sojos, su esposo es ayudante de albañilería, la casa en la que habitan es de su mamá, pero viven de manera independiente.

Rosa es costurera pero no ejerce su profesión por su hija pequeña, pero los días miércoles y sábados sale a vender frutas recorriendo la Feria Libre (mercado de Cuenca), de 9 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del bankito ya que viven por el mismo sector todos  los prestamos que le han entregado le a beneficiado para comprar la fruta y fue su mamá quien inició en el bankito incentivándole a que forme parte del mismo, con el nuevo préstamo que la fundación le hace entrega lo va a invertir en comprar más productos para su negocio como es frutilla, mangos y todo clase de frutas que se encuentra de temporada, su gran sueño es llegar a tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Narancay Bajo” is formed by a group of members who always have a goal of becoming successful despite encountering obstacles. They strive to provide their families with the best and any little bit of comfort that life has to offer. The members live south of Cuenca, a city known its charming traditions and festivities. The people are warm and friendly to all who visit the city. In return, everyone who visits Cuenca falls in love and always promises to return someday. Sra. Rosa S. is a member of the Communal Bank “Narancay Bajo”. She lives just outside of Cuenca, about 15 minutes to the south of the city in the district that is also named Cuenca. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children (ages 11, 8, and 2). Two of her children are students at the Nicolás Sojos School. Her husband works as a masonry assistant. Rosa and her family reside at her mother’s house, but they live independently. Rosa is a seamstress but has not engaged in this profession since she was a young girl. On Wednesdays and Saturdays, she sells fruit as a traveling vendor through “La Feria Libre” (the open-air market in Cuenca). Rosa works from 9am until 3pm. She has established great friendships with the other members of her Communal Bank, who are all in the same line of business and have used their loans to purchase fruit. Rosa’s mother is the founder of this Communal Bank and invited all the members to join. With her new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, Rosa plans to purchase more products for her business such as strawberries, mangos, and other seasonal fruits. Her greatest dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
El banco comunal Narancay Bajo esta formado por un grupo de socia(o)s que siempre an tendido como meta salir adelante ante cualquier obstáculo y brindar a sus familias lo mejor de si y un poco de comodidad de lo que no tuvieron en su vida, viven al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad que tiene muchos encantos tradiciones y festividades su gente es calida y amables todos los que visitan a Cuenca se van enamorados y siempre con la promesa de volver.

La Sra. Rosa P. es socia del Banco Comunal Narancay Bajo, vive a unos 15 minutos en las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca, en el sector de Narancay Bajo, se lleva bien con todas sus amigas de la banca comunal, tiene 27 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal ha procreado 3 hijos que se encuentran de 12, 7, 6 años de edad, todos sus hijos están estudiando en la escuela Agustín Cuesta Vintimilla, su esposo es albañil, profesión que le permite aportar económicamente al hogar, gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrifico la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad. 

Rosa vende granos y frutas recorriendo la Feria Libre (mercado de Cuenca), tiene 15 años trabajando en este negocio y le va bien como también tiene días malos, su horario de trabajo es de 7 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m., se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo que trabaja con los préstamos que la fundación les hace entrega y les ha ayudado para seguir comprando productos para su negocio, nos comenta que fue una amiga la que la incentivo para ser socia del bankito, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de más grano como es fréjol, choclo tierno, arveja, etc., y frutas como naranjas, piñas y toda clase de fruta que se encuentra en temporada,  para así seguir creciendo en su negocio siendo este su mayor sueño en la vida tener un local grande de frutas y granos.
texts.en:
The Narancay Bajo Communal Bank is formed by a group of members whose goal has always been to succeed in front of any obstacle, to give their families the best of themselves, and to give their families a little of the comforts they never had in their lives. They live to the south of the city of Cuenca. It is a city that has a lot of enchanting traditions and celebrations. The people are warm and kind. Everyone who visits Cuenca falls in love with it, and they always promise to return. Rosa P. is a member of the Narancay Bajo Communal Bank. She lives about 15 minutes outside the city of Cuenca in the Narancay Bajo region. She gets along well with all of her friends in the communal bank. She is 27, married, and has three children. They are 12, 7, and 6 years old. They all go to the Agustín Cuesta Vintimilla School. Her husband is a bricklayer, a profession that allows him to support the household. Thanks to his efforts and sacrifice, the house where they live is their own. Rosa sells grains and fruit at the Feria Libre (market in Cuenca). She has been working in this business for 15 years. It is going well for her, but she also has her bad days. Her work schedule is from 7 a.m. until 3 p.m. This is her fourth cycle of working with loans that the foundation has given her. They have helped her to continue buying products for her business. She comments that it was a friend who motivated her to become a member of her bank. She will use the new loan from the Espoir Foundation to buy more grains like kidney beans, ears of corn, and peas, etc. She will also buy fruits like oranges, pineapples, and all types of seasonal fruit. She will do this to keep growing in her business. Her greatest dream in life is to have a large fruit and grain establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kidney beans, ears of corn, peas, pineapples, and oranges

loans.name: Jose Jacinto

texts.es:
El banco comunal Narancay Bajo esta formado por un grupo de socia(o)s que siempre an tendido como meta salir adelante ante cualquier obstáculo y brindar a sus familias lo mejor de si y un poco de comodidad de lo que no tuvieron en su vida, viven al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad que tiene muchos encantos tradiciones y festividades su gente es calida y amables todos los que visitan a Cuenca se van enamorados y siempre con la promesa de volver.

El  Sr. José S. es socio del Banco Comunal Narancay Bajo, vive en las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca, a unos 15 minutos en el sector de Narancay Bajo, tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y en su unión conyugal ha procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran de 17, 13, 11, 7, 3 años de edad, su hijo de 17 años estudia en el Colegio Benigno Malo, su hija de 13 años estudia en el Colegio Garaicoa, su hijo de 11 años estudia en la escuela Nicolás Sojos, y su hijo de 7 años estudia en la escuela Leoncio Cordero, su esposa es comerciante, compra  y vende ropa, gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio conyugal ha logrado construir su casa propia.

José trabaja como taxista desde hace 20 años, trabaja 14 horas diarias y tiene una buena amistad con sus amigas de la banca comunal, es su segundo ciclo en la fundación y fue su mamá quien lo incentivó para que fuera socio del bankito y los prestamos que ha realizado los ha invertido en el negocio de su esposa, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en el negocio de venta de ropa como son pantalones, blusas, etc., de su esposa, su gran sueño es tener salud y vida para poder seguirles dando todo lo que necesitan a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Narancay Bajo Communal Bank is formed by a group of members whose goal has always been to succeed in front of any obstacle, to give their families the best of themselves, and to give their families a little of the comforts they never had in their lives. They live to the south of the city of Cuenca. It is a city that has a lot of enchanting traditions and celebrations. The people are warm and kind. Everyone who visits Cuenca falls in love with it, and they always promise to return. José S. is a member of the Narancay Bajo Communal Bank. He lives about 15 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca in the Narancay Bajo region. He is 41, married, and has five children. They are 17, 13, 11, 7, and 3 years old. His 17 year old son goes to the Benigno Malo School. His 13 year old daughter goes to the Garaicoa School. His 11 year old son goes to the Nicolás Sojos School, and his 7 year old son goes to the Leonicio Cordero School. His wife is a merchant; she buys and sells clothes. Thanks to their marital effort and sacrifice they have built their own home. José has worked as a taxi driver for 20 years. He works 14 hours daily. He has a good friendship with his friends in the communal bank. This is his second cycle with the foundation. It was his mother who motivated him to become a member of the bank. He used the loans he has received to invest in his wife’s business. He will use the new loan from the Espoir Foundation to invest in his wife’s business of selling clothes like pants, and blouses, etc. His big dream is to have health and life to be able to continue giving his children everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, and clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO

Alcancía Comunal conformada por 02 hombres y 08 mujeres que demuestran que para progresar se necesita esfuerzo y dedicación, por ello se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios que le permiten mantener a sus familias aun con la situación difícil en estos últimos años.
Y es así como el  Sr Víctor empezó su negocio de la venta de aves en el mercado central de Lima hace varios años, negocio que en un momento fue ilegal y le trajo muchos problemas; como cabeza de familia esta situación era muy preocupante, entonces pensó en hacer jaulas para las aves y así pudo trasladar el negocio a su casa; al principio invirtió algo de dinero para la compra de materiales que necesitaba para este trabajo, gracias a Dios tuvo mucha demanda,  esto le permitió cancelar algunas deudas que tenia y lo más importante la mantención de su familia. Ahora está muy contento ya que tiene pedidos y empezara otro tipo de actividades.
La presidenta Vicki es una mujer muy emprendedora y gracias a su esfuerzo logro comprar una mototaxi  que le permite brindarle lo necesario y lo más preciado que tiene, son sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en algunos arreglos en la mototaxi y así poder obtener mejores ganancias.
Con los préstamos otorgados los socios han podido y podrán  invertir en productos para obtener mejores ganancias,  pero como en todo negocio las ganancias tienen sus altibajos.
texts.en:
"Caminando Hacia El Futuro" (Walking Toward the Future) is a community bank formed by 2 men and 8 women who have shown that dedication and effort are necessary to move ahead. They are involved in different kinds of businesses that allow them to support their families, even with the difficult situation these past few years.

That is why Mr. Victor started his business selling birds in the central market in Lima several years ago, which was illegal at the time and brought him many problems. As the head of his family, this worried him, so he thought of making cages for the birds, and he was able to move the business to his home. At the beginning, he invested some money to buy materials that he needed for this, and thanks to God there was a lot of demand. This allowed him to cancel some debts that he had, and most importantly, to support his family. Now he is very content since he has orders and will be able to start other types of businesses.

The President, Vicki, is an entrepreneurial woman, and thanks to her hard work, obtained a motorcycle taxi, which allows her to give her precious children what they need. She will invest this loan in repairs for her mototaxi so she can have a better income.

With these loans, the members have been able to and will continue to invest in products to earn a better income, but in all businesses there are ups and downs.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Señoras De Taguan Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sras. De Taguan se encuentra en la comunidad de Taguan perteneciente al canto del Sigsig, este cantón se caracteriza por la belleza que entrega en su viaje, también tienen su sitio arqueológico de Chobshi-Shabalula que está localizado en la margen izquierda del Río Santa Bárbara, su población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y en su mayor parte se dedican a tejer los sombreros de paja toquilla (fibra vegetal).

La Sra. Hilda Villaguari es socia del banco comunal Sras. De Taguan, vive en la comunidad de Taguan, a unos 45 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca perteneciente al canto el Sigsig, tiene 39 años de edad, es viuda desde hace 5 años, su esposo falleció realizando su trabajo de albañilería y con quien procrearon 6 hijos que se encuentran de 20, 17, 15, 13, 10, 5 años de edad, su hijo de 20 años es casado pero viven en la misma casa compartiendo los gastos de su hogar, su hijo de 17 años trabaja y le ayuda un poco económicamente, sus hijos de 15 y 13 años se encuentran estudiando en el colegio, sus hijo de 10 años estudia en la escuela de la comunidad y su hijo de 5 años se encuentra  en el jardín, siendo el fruto de muchos años de sacrificio el poder habitar en su casa propia.

Hilda trabaja en el Bar de un Colegio, lleva 4 años trabajando en este negocio, nos comenta que si le va bien, el local en el trabaja es arrendado, trabajando de lunes a viernes de 7 a.m. a 1:30 p.m., es su primer crédito en la fundación y fue incentivada a formar parte de la fundación por los promotores de crédito que fueron hacia su pueblo para enseñarles los beneficios de la fundación, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le hace entrega lo va a invertir en su negocio en la compra de mas productos para su bar como son chupetes, papas en funda, gaseosas, aguas, etc., su meta es salir en adelante  y seguir engrandeciéndole a su negocio.

La Sra. Rosa S. vive en la comunidad de Taguan, tiene 39 años de edad, se encuentra actualmente separada pues su esposo vive en la costa con otra mujer desde hace 7 años, en su relación conyugal procrearon 8 hijos que se encuentran de 22, 19, 17, 14, 12, 9, 8, 5 años de edad, su hijo de primer hijo vive independiente de su hogar,  su segundo, tercero y cuarto hijo trabajan de vez en cuando o cuando algún conocido les da trabajo y sus últimos cuatro hijos se encuentran estudiando en la escuelita de la comunidad, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad fruto del sacrificio que ha realizado por varios años.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva sus tierras pero también en su mayor parte cultiva las tierras de otras personas, es su primer crédito en la fundación y se encuentra con la esperanza de seguir creciendo y salir en adelante con su familia, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de comida para sus hijos, su gran sueños se ver a sus hijos salir en adelante.
texts.en:
The "Sras. De Taguan" (Women of Taguan) communal bank is located in the community of Taguan, which is part of Sigsig canton. This canton is characterized by the beauty of its landscape; it also contains the archeological site of Chobshi-Shabalula, which lies on the left bank of the Santa Bárbara River. The local population works in agriculture, ranching, and most of all, weaving hats from paja toquilla (a plant fiber). Hilda Villaguari is a member of the Sras. De Taguan communal bank; she lives in Taguan, some 45 minutes outside the city of Cuenca in Sigsig canton. She is 39 years old and has been a widow for 5 years; her husband died while carrying out his work as a mason. The couple had 6 children together, who are now aged 20, 17, 15, 13, 10 and 5. Her 20-year-old son is married, but the couple still lives in the family home, sharing the household expenses. Her 17-year-old son works and helps her a little bit economically; her 15- and 13-year-old children are in secondary school; her 10-year-old is at the community elementary school, and her 5-year-old attends preschool. The fact that the family is able to live in their own home is the fruit of many years of sacrifice. Hilda works in a school snack bar. She has been working in this business for 4 years, and she reports that it is going well for her. The shop where she works is rented, and she works from Monday through Friday from 7 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. This is her first loan with the Foundation; she was inspired to join by the loan promoters who came to her village to teach people about the Foundation's benefits. With the loan she receives from the ESPOIR Foundation, she will invest in her business by purchasing additional products for her snack bar, such as lollipops, bags of chips, soft drinks, bottled water, etc. Her goal is to get ahead and to continue to expand her business. Rosa S. lives in the community of Taguan and is 39 years old. Currently, she is separated from her husband, because he has been living with another woman on the coast for the past 7 years. During their marriage, they have had 8 children, who are currently 22, 19, 17, 14, 12, 9, 8 and 5 years old. Her oldest child lives independently; her second, third and fourth work from time to time or when someone they know offers them work; and her four youngest children are studying in the community's small school. The house in which they live is their own property, the fruit of sacrifices which they have made over several years. Rosa works in agriculture; she cultivates her own fields, but she spends most of her time cultivating fields belonging to other people. This is her first loan with the Foundation, and she hopes to continue expanding her work and helping her family get ahead. With the loan provided to her by the ESPOIR Foundation, she will invest in food for her children. Her great dream is to see her children succeed in life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks, chips and candy, and also for personal expenses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pablo Artemio

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa propia tiene 3 hijos. Pablo se 
dedica a atender el kiosko en un colegio particular de la ciudad. El inició su negocio 
hace 2 años, con un capital pequeño producto de sus ahorros y poco a poco ha ido 
incrementando su negocio, Pablo con los ingresos que obtiene ha costeado los estudios 
de sus hijos, de los cuales la ultima recientemente ha ingresado a la Universidad. El 
atiende el kiosko de manera muy calida y amable ya que se encuentra en contacto con 
niños, su menor hija le ayuda a la atención del kiosko, ahorra al máximo el dinero que 
obtiene de las ventas del kiosko el cual lo vuelve a invertir. El sueño a futuro de 
Pablo es poder tener mayores ingresos y así poderle brindar una buena educación a su 
menor hija. Solicita el crédito para la mejora de su vivienda la cual fue afectada por 
el terremoto.
texts.en:
Pablo is 61 years old, single, and lives in his own home. He has three children. Pablo attends to a kiosk in a private school in the city. He started this business 2 years ago with a small amount of his own savings, and little by little the business has grown. With the income it generates, Pablo has funded the education of his children, the last of whom recently entered the university. He attends to the kiosk in a warm and friendly manner, since his main contact is with children. His younger daughter helps him attend to the kiosk. He saves the maximum amount of money that he can from the sales of the kiosk in order to reinvest in the business. Pablo's dream for the future is to have a better income, and in this way be able to provide a good education for his youngest daughter. He requests this loan in order to make improvements to his home, which was affected by the earthquake.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: housing improvements

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María  Elena D. forma parte del banco comunal Esperanza para Superar, estas socias se reúnen en el balneario San Jacinto en la zona norte de Manabí.

María está  casada tiene una hija de 13 años, a más de ser ama de casa tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de helados caseros  que ella prepara,  también tiene un kiosco donde vende cosas de picar  como pan de yuca, empanadas y tortillas solo los fines de semana, sus labores empiezan  muy temprano porque debe tener listos los helados para las once de la mañana para lo cual se compró un congelador grande donde caben 300 helados aproximadamente.

La hija de María es de gran ayuda en el negocio  de venta de  helados mientras que ella sale a comprar los productos necesarios para prepararlos,  los préstamos recibidos  de la Fundación son destinados  para sus negocios y con  el nuevo  crédito solicitado va a comprar  leche, azúcar, esencias, canela y frutas para elaborar sus deliciosos helados.
texts.en:
María Elena D. is a member of the communal bank "Esperanza para Superar." The members meet in the San Jacinto resort in the area north of Manabí. Maria is married and has a 13 year-old daughter. In addition to being a housewife she has a small business selling homemade ice cream that she prepares; she also has a kiosk where she sells things to eat like cassava bread, empanadas and tortillas on the weekends. She begins her work very early in the morning because she has to have the ice cream ready by 11 in the morning. She purchased a large freezer where she can fit approximately 300 ice creams. Maria's daughter helps in the business selling the ice creams while she leaves to buy the products necessary to prepare them. The funds borrowed from the foundation are intended for her business. The new loan sought will be used to buy milk, sugar, extracts, cinnamon and fruit to make delicious ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, extracts, cinnamon and fruit

loans.name: Marlene Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Marlene C. forma parte del Banco Comunal Esperanza para Superar que se reúnen en San Jacinto un bello balneario localizado al norte de la provincia de Manabí.

Marlene está casada tiene tres niños, el esposo se dedica a la venta de mariscos, y ella  a la confección y venta  de edredones, cojines, almohadas, toldos, manteles que los trabaja en diferentes telas, utiliza encajes y cintas con detalles tejidos a mano lleva tres años  dedicada a esta labor que la realiza  desde muy temprano, recorrer  en el mismo lugar donde vive y  también tiene clientes de Portoviejo y Manta.

Marlene empezó con cien dólares para invertir en los materiales y le ha ido muy bien tanto así que sus ventas han aumentado, este oficio lo aprendió en diferentes cursos de manualidades y artesanías.

Lleva dos ciclos  trabajando con su banco comunal y  ha salido  adelante con el apoyo de la Fundación, con este nuevo préstamo solicitado   invertirá en  la compra de  materiales como telas, hilos, encajes  y accesorios decorativos para la confección   de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Marlene C. belongs to the communal bank "Esperanza para Superar," that meets in a beautiful resort in San Jacinto, located in the northern part of Manabí province. Marlene is married with 3 children. Her husband sells seafood and she makes and sells comforters, cushions, pillows, awnings and tablecloths in various fabrics. She uses lace and ribbons with hand-sewn detail. She has been engaged in this business for 3 years; she carries out the work starting very early in the morning, traveling in the same area where she lives. She also has customers in Portoviejo and Manta. Marlene started with 100 dollars to invest in materials, and the business has gone very well as her sales have increased. She learned this trade by taking different classes in sewing and handicrafts. She has been with her communal bank for 2 loan cycles, and she has managed to advance her business with the support of the Foundation. With the new loan that is requested she will invest in the purchase of materials such as fabrics, thread, lace and decorative accessories to use in the production of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, lace and decorative accessories to use in the production of her products.

loans.name: Karina Jahaira

texts.es:
El banco comunal Esperanza para superarse se reúne en el balneario San Jacinto en la costa norte en la Provincia de Manabí, la señora Karina tiene 4 ciclos formando parte del banco comunal.

El hogar de Karina esta formado por dos hijos y en espera del tercero, tiene 27 años está casada desde hace ocho, ella   se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos y para el cuidado personal hace seis meses lo hace visitando puerta a puerta a sus clientes que  son del  mismo sector donde vive, como sus ventas son por medio de catálogo  ella toma el pedido y cuando le llegan los productos entrega a sus clientes que le cancelan la mitad del valor de su compra y la diferencia a ocho  días plazo.

Con este nuevo préstamo va a comprar perfumes, labiales, cremas, maquillajes para damas y caballeros  que más se venden  ya que esta época  existen  buenas promociones y de esta manera pueden acceder a mejores facilidades de pago para satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes y  captar nuevos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Esperanza para Superarse” (Hope to Overcome) meets in the resort town of San Jacinto, which is located on the northern coast in the Province of Manabí. Sra. Karina has participated in four loan cycles as a member of this Communal Bank.

Karina’s family consists of two children with another one on the way. She is 27 years old and has been married for eight years. For the past six months, she has been selling cosmetics and personal care products. She goes door to door offering her products to customers who live in her same neighborhood. Her sales are made through a catalog. When she delivers the products to her customers, they must pay for half of the value of their order and then she collects the balance in eight days.

With this new loan, Karina will buy perfumes, lipsticks, crèmes, and makeup for women and men. She sells more around this time of the year because there are good promotions that exist during this season. Since she has access to better payment options, she can meet the demands of her existing customers and attract new ones.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Clara Mercedes

texts.es:
Clara es socia del Banco Comunal Esperanza para Superar en el bello balneario de San Jacinto en la provincia de Manabí, este es un sitio muy concurrido por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, sus habitantes vive mucho de la pesca, artesanía, y de la gastronomía.

Ella es oriunda de la ciudad de Guayaquil y se radicó en San Jacinto hace ya  nueve años, se caso tiene dos hijos y su esposo trabaja dando mantenimiento a un hotel de la zona, nos manifiesta que decidió vivir aquí  porque sus padres también viven en esta localidad  hace algún tiempo.

Clara  es  comerciante  desde hace un año   motivada por el esposo,   él fue quien contacto a su cuñada  para que le facilite la mercadería, desde entonces ella comercializa edredones, sabanas, toldos ,  cortinas,   y todo en sección hogar,  su mercadería la adquiere en Santo Domingo  para lo cual  envía el dinero y el listado del pedido a su   cuñada para  que compre y le envié a su localidad,   una vez que tiene la mercadería visita   a sus clientes  puerta a puerta en el misma zona donde vive dejando  a crédito o  hasta en dos pagos mensuales,  nuestra socia nos comenta que vende bastante y  tiene pedidos todas la semanas.

Por créditos obtenidos  de la Fundación le han permitido incrementar su negocio y con el  nuevo préstamo invertirá en sabanas y unos pocos edredones para la temporada navideña para cumplir con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes. 

El sueño de Clara es tener un gimnasio,  ha pensado ponerlo en su casa por eso está ahorrando para comprarse maquinas de ejercicios, ya tiene el espacio físico y poco a  poco lo está arreglando espera poder inaugurarlo para febrero.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the Esperanza para Superar (Hope to Overcome) Village Bank in the beautiful seaside resort town of San Jacinto in Manabí Province. This area is very popular with local and international tourists. The residents make their living mainly from fishing, handicrafts, and gastronomy. Clara is a native of the city of Guayaquil and settled in San Jacinto nine years ago. She’s married and has two children. Her husband is a maintenance worker in a local hotel. She tells us that she decided to live here because her parents have also lived in this area for a while. Clara became vendor a year ago, motivated by her husband, who contacted their sister-in-law to help out with merchandise. Since then Clara has sold quilts, sheets, canopies, curtains, and everything for the home. She gets her merchandise in Santo Domingo, sending money and a list of items to her sister-in-law to buy and send her. Once she has the merchandise she goes door-to-door in her area, visiting clients and selling on credit or even in two monthly payments. She tells us that she is selling enough and has orders every week. The loans from Fundación have allowed Clara to grow her business. She’ll use her latest loan to buy sheets and a few Christmas quilts to fill orders for her demanding clients. Clara’s dream is to have a gym, which she has decided to put in her house so she’s saving to buy exercise equipment. She has the space, and little by little she’s fixing it up in hope of having the gym ready to go by February.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets and quilts.

loans.name: Doris Susana

texts.es:
La señora Doris  R. es socia del  banco comunal Sucre del cantón Montecristi, ella se dedica al comercio informal vende  ropa para niños desde hace cinco años, la mercadería la compra en Guayaquil a los distribuidores  por docenas según el pedido de sus clientes, se maneja con   para dar facilidad de pago  y cobra  por semana. Doris comparte su tiempo entre las ventas  y dar clases porque es maestra en una escuelita de su comunidad.

Su mayor sueño es poder  incrementar su negocio con otras líneas de ropa, este negocio le gusta lo que hace,  le va bastante bien, y le deja buena rentabilidad.

Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá todo en ropa para los niños menores de diez años como pantalones, camisas, y blusas y más.
texts.en:
Ms. Doris R. is a member of the Sucre del Canton Montecristi Communal Bank. She's been selling clothes for children over the past 5 years. She buys merchandise in Guayaquil by the dozen according to her clients orders, and manages payments charging on a weekly basis. She divides her time between her business and her job as a teacher in a school in her community. Her biggest dream is to improve her business and offer other types of clothes. She loves what she does and the business is going well, generating her some profit. With this new loan she will buy new clothes for children under 10 like pants, shirts, t-shirts, and more, in order to resell.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Children's Clothes

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal Sucre se reúne en Montecristi en este sitio podemos encontrar los más finos y elegantes sombreros de paja toquilla de la zona, los artesanos también son expertos en elaborar muebles y adornos para el hogar en toquilla. 


Maria Fernanda es nacida de Montecristi,  vive con su esposo  de profesión chofer y su hijo, su casa es propia. Nuestra socia es comerciante ambulante desde hace 8 años vende sabanas, cortinas, edredones, toldos y ropa en general, anteriormente   vendía joyas y algunos clientes le quedaron mal  por eso decidió empezar con el negocio de ropa,  para abastecerse ella  viaja a Guayaquil a comprar su mercadería, se inició con 400 dólares pero poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio gracias a los créditos recibidos de la Fundación.

Con este nuevo préstamo va a adquirir  sabanas para cumplir con varios  pedidos pendientes de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Sucre Community Bank meets in the town of Montecristi, where we can find the most elegant and carefully made Panama hats in the area. The craftsmen are also experts in making furniture and home decor out of this straw. Maria Fernanda was born in Montecristi, where she lives with her husband (a driver) and her son in her own house. She has been a traveling sales woman for 8 years, selling sheets, curtains, comforters, canopies, and clothing. She previously sold jewelry, but some customers cheated her, so she decided to establish her clothing business. For merchandise she travels to Guayaquil. She started her business with $400 but has gradually grown it thanks to loans from the Foundation. With this next loan, she will buy sheets, to fulfill pending customer orders.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets

loans.name: Bancomunal Nacer Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nacer inicia su quinto ciclo con  17 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comidas, abarrotes, ropa, cosméticos, joyas, carne, medicina y también brindan servicios D. cosmetología.

Como es el caso D. la señora Transito que es casada, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Transito viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donD. venD. abarrotes, cosméticos, medicinas, y diferentes productos dependiendo D. la demanda, además Transito tiene un recreo llamado La Tranquera en donD. venD. comida típica y bebidas.

Mientras que Justina es viuda, tiene 46 años y 6 hijos, Justina venD. ropa a pedido que ofrece a sus compañeros D. trabajo D. la Universidad Nacional, sus ventas son al crédito.


Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 13,350 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. bebidas, arroz, azúcar, pantalones, polos, cosméticos, tintes, animales.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Nacer Communal Bank is starting its fifth cycle, and has 17 members. They run various types of businesses, such as sale of food, groceries, clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, meat, medicines, and beauty services. Transito, for example, is 58 years old, married, and has 6 children. She travels to the rural area around Ayacucho, where she sells groceries, cosmetics, medicines, and other products when there is demand. Transito also has a site (La Tranquera) where she sells drinks and food typical of the region. Justina is a 46-year-old widow who has 6 children. She sells clothing on credit, ordered by her co-workers at the National University. The members need varying amounts, such as 300, 450, 600, and 900 soles, for a total of 13,350 soles. These loans will be used to purchase drinks, rice, sugar, pants, polo shirts, cosmetics, dyes, and animals. The dream of these members is for their children to work as professionals, and to grow their businesses, and have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The 17 members of this Bank request a loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Gloria tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. La socia Gloria es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y almuerzo para sus hijos. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a las 7 de la mañana al “Mercado Central de Urubamba” a tender su pequeño negocio de venta de comestibles. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, leche, fideos, aceites y más productos pues en esta época de fin de año es donde se vende más.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra a 78 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a una hora y media de viaje. La ciudad de Urubamba se halla en el corazón del Valle Sagrado. En la época prehispánica fue un centro agrícola muy importante.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old, married, and she has five children. She is a native of Urubamba (Department of Cuzco) and is a member of the José Carlos Mariátegui Communal Bank (Arariwa Association). A hard-working enterprising woman, Gloria gets up early to do household chores, such as making breakfast and lunch for her children. At 7 a.m., she then goes to the Urubamba Central Market to run her small business (food sales). She needs a loan to buy more food, such as rice, milk, pasta, oils, and other commodities. This is the time of the year when sales are greatest. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means, and commits to repay the loan on schedule. In the heart of Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley), Urubamba is 78 km. from Cuzco, about one and a half hours travel. In pre-Hispanic times, it was a large agricultural center.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan to buy more food, such as rice, mild, pasta, oils, and other products.

loans.name: Bancomunal Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Gotitas D. Amor inicia su cuarto ciclo con  16 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, celulares, abarrotes en general, ropa, cosméticos, golosinas, también brindan servicios D. renovadora D. calzados e Internet.

Como es el caso D. la señora Irma es casada, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Irma viaja a las diferentes ferias en donD. venD. abarrotes y D. las ferias compra cereales, queso, que venD. D. casa en casa.

Mientras que Maria es casada,  tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Maria venD. ropa D. segunda que compra en la ciudad D. Lima, sus ventas los realiza en el distrito D. Tambo, y D. allá compra cereales que venD. en el mercado D. abastos.  

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. trigo, cebada, quinua, ropa D. segunda, cosméticos, quesos, celulares.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos se superen y sean profesionales, tener ahorros para su vejez y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Gotitas D. Amor Communal Bank starts its fourth cycle with 16 members. The members have different businesses like selling grains, cell phones, general groceries, clothes, cosmetics, and sweets. Some also proviD. shoe repair and Internet services. Like the case of Irma. She is 50, married, and has three children. She travels to different fairs where they sell groceries. She buys grains and cheese, which she sells door to door. Maria is 45, married and has three children. Maria sells second hand clothes that she buys in the city of Lima. She sells in the Tambo district, where she buys grains to sell in the Abastos Market. The members need loans of different amounts like 300 PEN, 450 PEN, 600 PEN, and 900 PEN. The total for the loan to the communal bank is 9,600 PEN. The loans will be used to buy wheat, barley, quinoa, second hand clothes, cosmetics, cheese, and cell phones. The members’ dreams are to improve their businesses, that their children succeed and become professionals, to have savings for their old age, and to have their own houses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat, barley, quinoa, second hand clothes, cosmetics, cheese, and cell phones

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Rosa tiene 64 años, es casada y tiene seis hijos. La socia Rosa es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades en la casa como por ejemplo alimentar a sus animales, limpiar las jaulas y preparar su chicha de jora. La socia después de hacer sus actividades de la casa tiene que atender su pequeño negocio de venta de cerveza. La socia nos cuenta que alimenta a los animales y después los vende a los restaurantes o sus caseros. Ya son 10 a 11 años que de dedica s sus negocios y le ha ido buen bien gracias al empeño que pone en sus negocios. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más alimento para los animales menores y desea comprar más cerveza pues en esta época de fin de año es donde se vende más cerveza.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra a 78 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a una hora y media de viaje. La ciudad de Urubamba se halla en el corazón del Valle Sagrado. En la época prehispánica fue un centro agrícola muy importante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 64, married, and has six children. Rosa is from the city of Urubamba in the Cusco department. She belongs to the José Carlos Mariategui Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. She gets up very early to do her household chores like feeding the animals, cleaning the cages, and preparing her “chica de jora” (a drink typical of the region made from a corn base). After doing these household activities, she has to tend to her small business of selling beer. She says that she feeds the animals and later sells them to restaurants or her customers. She has been in this business for 10 or 11 years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business. She needs a loan to buy more food for her small animals. She wants to buy more beer because the end of the year is when she sells more beer. She is thankful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time. The city of Urubamba is 78 kilometers from the city of Cusco, which is approximately an hour and a half trip. The city of Urubamba is in the heart of the Sacred Valley. In the Prehispanic age it was a very important agricultural center.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for her small animals, and beer for the end of the year sales

loans.name: Eusebio Maximo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Eusebio tiene 58 años, es casado y tiene una hija pero es independiente. El socio educa a su nieta que tiene 20 años pues ella esta estudiando en un Institución privada. El socio trabaja como albañil. El socio Eusebio es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio tenia una pequeña chacra la cual la traspaso a su hija pero actualmente su hija necesita ayuda de su papá para construir pozos de irrigación. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para construir los pozos de irrigación para su chacra.         
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 58, married, and has one daughter who is independent. He is educating his 20 year old granddaughter. She goes to a private institution. He works as a bricklayer. He is from the city of Urubamba in the Cusco department. He belongs to the José Carlos Mariategui Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. He had a small farm, which he passed on to his daughter. His daughter currently needs his help to build wells for irrigation. He is an enterprising and hard-working father who gets his family ahead. He needs the loan to buy materials to build the wells for irrigation on his farm. He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build irrigation wells for his farm

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Carmen

texts.en:
Cleotilde del Carmen sells fruit from a stall in the Mayoreo market in Managua. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. She wants to buy papayas and passion fruit. She has been selling fruit for ten years now. She initially started her business using personal savings.

Cleotilde and her partner have five children in their care. One of the children is school aged. She has been working with CEPRODEL for three years and in that time loans have helped her maintain her working capital and continue working.

loans.use: To buy passion fruit and papaya

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. She is married and blessed with two adult children. She plants and harvests rice for sale. She nets 3,000 Philippine pesos monthly from the said business. She has been engaged in her business for more than 18 years. In 2004, Virginia joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for her rice production. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for rice production

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby C. is from the village of Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Ruby is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Ruby makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Ruby is just starting this business. In 2005, Ruby joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Ruby from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marleny Rocio

texts.es: Marleny tiene 40 años de edad, es casada vive en casa propia tiene 1 hijos. Marleni se dedica a atender el puesto de ventas de huevos, el cual queda en un mercado la ciudad de Ica. Ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años, con un capital pequeño producto de sus ahorros y de créditos y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, Marleny atiende el puesto de manera muy calida y amable y por este motivo es que sus clientes regresan a su puesto de ventas, ahorra al máximo el dinero que obtiene de las ventas ene. Puesto, el cual lo vuelve a invertir y así poder seguir creciendo. El sueño a futuro de Marleny es poder tener mayores ingresos y así poderle brindar una buena educación a su menor hijo. Solicita el crédito para la mejora de su vivienda la cual fue afectada por el terremoto.
texts.en:
Marleny is 40 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her only child. She manages a vending post at a market in Ica where she sells eggs. Marleny started this business two years ago with a small amount of capital that consisted of savings and loans. Over time her business has grown. Her customers always return to conduct repeat business because they are treated in a warm and friendly manner. Marleny now tries to save as much of her earnings as possible so that she can reinvest into her business and keep it growing. In the future, she dreams of earning better income so that she can provide a good education for her young child. The loan she is requesting will be used to make improvements to her home which was affected by the earthquake.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Mrs. Eneria M. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Eneria is married and blessed with 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture, in the agriculture sector, planting and harvesting bananas to sell. She earned 2,000 PHP monthly net from her business. She has been engaged on this business for more than 15 years. In 2003, she joined PMPC to gain access the programs and services of this Co-op. She has successfully repaid her previous loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP. Eneria is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers and chemicals for her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Eneria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English by Kiva.  Given that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Maricile

texts.en: Maricile Q., a resident of Pisaan, Bonifacio, is 26 and married to Arnel, a driver who is pictured with their daughter. The couple is blessed with three children, all of whom are still minors. Maricile knows that she needs to help her husband support the family. Upon hearing the good news about it, she joined Paglaum MPC. She wanted to access capital. As a new Paglaum member, she was given a 4,000 Philippine pesos loan to finance her business. She deeply hopes that someday she can give a better future to all her children and also hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store

loans.name: Julio Agustin

texts.es: Julio tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente hace 6 años, tiene un solo hijo. Julio vive en casa de un familiar, El adquirió la mototaxi con ahorros obtenidos de los años dedicados a esta actividad. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda, ya que hace 1 año adquirió una mototaxi nueva. Julio y su cónyuge sueñan con tener su casa propia y así mejorar la calidad vida de su familias. Julio destina todos los ingresos para la educación de su hijo, el cual se encuentra en edad escolar. Julio desea tener mayores ingresos y así brindarle seguridad y bienestar a su hijo, solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Julio is 33 years old and has been in a common law marriage for the past six years. He has one son and lives at the home of a relative. With his savings, Julio acquired a motorcycle taxi and has been dedicated to providing transportation services. He now has extensive experience since it has been a year since he bought his new vehicle.

Julio and his common law wife dream of owning a home and improving the quality of life for their family. All of his earnings will go toward his son’s education, since he is currently enrolled in school. Julio hopes to improve his income and provide for the security and welfare of his son. He is requesting a loan to pay for maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty S. is from the village of Palilan Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. She is 40 years old, separated from spouse and the mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, Betty runs a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community.  Betty has been in business for over 14 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Betty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.  Betty is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be Betty's ninth from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 
----------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Ismael

texts.es: Manuel tiene 28 años de edad, es casado vive con su esposa y su hijo. Manuel vive en casa de sus padres, El adquirió su vehiculo con ahorros obtenidos de varios años trabajando como obrero de campo,junto a su esposa. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda. Manuel sueña con tener con tener su casa propia y así brindarle bienestar a su familia. Manuel destina todos los ingresos que obtiene brindando el servicio a la educación de su hijo, el cual se encuentra en edad escolar. Manuel desea que su hijo pueda tener una buena educación. El solicita el crédito para realizarle mantenimiento a su vehículo ( mototaxi, para si poder tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 28 years old. He lives with his wife and son in the home of his parents. Manuel acquired a vehicle with the savings he accumulated while working several years with his wife as a farm laborer. He now has extensive experience providing transportation services. Manuel has dreams of owning a home and providing for the welfare of his family. All of his earnings will go toward his son’s schooling since he desires for him to have a good education. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi so that he can continue to generate a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie A. is from the village of Becor, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish to people in her local community. Elsie has been in business for over 12 years and earns about 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2005, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional fish to sell.  She is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the living conditions of her family. 
--------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn R. is from the village of Becor, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Merlyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing net. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her fishing net

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine B. is from Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is 56 years old, married and has one adult child. She manages a little carenderia (restaurant), where she earns a meager income of 7,000 Philippine pesos a month. Josephine applied for another loan from Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner. This will be her second loan funded by Kiva, as she successfully repaid the capital she borrowed for her carenderia business. Now she is requesting a loan to finance her boarding-house venture. She asked for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP. She deeply wishes that their life will be better and hopes to save a little of their earnings for their old age.

loans.use: To finance her boarding-house venture

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en: Bernardita S. is from the village of Sebac, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Bernardita owns and operates a business providing house-rental services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month. In 2008, Bernardita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating her business. Bernardita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Satelital Group

texts.es:
La señora Brizza es profesora estudio psicología pedagoga no ejerce su carrera por motivo q sus dos hijos aun son pequeños  es por eso que se dedica a la consultaría D. una marca D. cosméticos  con este trabajo ella tiene la facilidad D. programar su tiempo y eso le permite no descuidar su familia, aparte  que obtiene ganancias mayores al que tendría como profesora ,además que le gusta su trabajo por que pueD. dirigir a muchas jóvenes como ella le falta un mes para graduarse como directora lo cual le generara mayores ingresos para ella no ha sido fácil llegar a este punto pues tuvo que pasar muchos desafíos con sus ganancias ha logrado la estabilidad económica en su familia .
Su meta próxima es seguir creciendo dentro D. su empresa para lograr surgir y obtener el cargo mas alto y formarse como empresaria.
La señora siempre ha trabajado con prestamos comunales por que le ha servido para formarse un capital es por una tía que conoce EDAPROSPO y deciden formar su grupo del cual ella es presidenta   este es  su primer préstamo y piensa usarlo para gestionar sus tramites para abrir su negocio en el futuro quiere comprarse una casa para allí poner su negocio relacionado a lo q ella desempeña q es belleza.



*la Sra. Brizza es la tercera D. pie
texts.en:
Mrs. Brizza is a teacher. She studied educational psychology, but she is not active in her career because her two children are still young. For that reason, she is working as a consultant for a cosmetics brand, because she is able to easily set her own schedule so she is able to take care of her family. In addition, she is able to earn more money than she would as a teacher. Plus, she likes her job because she can work with young women like herself. She has one month left until she graduates as a director, which will get her an even better income.

For her, it has not been easy to reach this point because she has had to overcome many difficulties. With her income, she has achieved economic stability for her family. Her next goal is to continue expanding her business to move up into a higher position and establish herself as an entrepreneur.

She has always worked with community loans, because they have helped her obtain capital. Her aunt knows EDAPROSPO, and they decided to form a group, of which Brizza is the president. This is their first loan, and she plans to use it to arrange paperwork to open her business. In the future she wants to buy a house to use to carry out her beauty business.

*Brizza is the third person standing

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Arrange paperwork for her business

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
K. Zuhro fights daily to help increase the family income so her children may have all that is necessary to have a good life. Her perseverance has given her family the assurance that she does everything possible to make their lives pleasant. Thanks to the hard work she invested in agriculture, she was able to purchase a small plot of land that she is farming together with her husband. However, the produce has decreased and the family expenses are using up the little capital they have. Zuhro, her husband and her daughter (pictured) have decided to purchase potato and onion seeds, as this crop is needed by the community year round. The situation that Zuhro finds herself in has made her ask for a loan of 3,500 Somoni. She hopes that she will find sensitive collaborators to help her get through these hard times. Your support will really help her.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Vohidjon

texts.en:
N. Vohidjon is 35 years old. He is married and has five children. Vohidjon has been working in agriculture for years, since he was young. Vohidjon works hard to cultivate his products such as potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables. He works from early morning until late at night hoping to have a rich harvest. Vohidjon sells his products in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and increase his business. For this reason Vohidjon has applied to IMON for a loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer for sowing more vegetables. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
For Adolat, the most important thing is the well-being of her family. Through her work, she tries to cover their expenses and give them peace. She dedicates herself to producing vegetables, especially potatoes. Although her work is very hard and tiring because of the strong sun, Adolat knows that she is being rewarded with the love and smiles of her children. Without a doubt, her labor makes her feel useful as she helps her husband sustain their family. They both make an effort to succeed and do their best at their jobs. The difficulties that they face now come from a lack of money to acquire the necessary fertilizer for their cultivated lands. For this reason, she requests this loan. They want to better themselves and increase their production. A quality fertilizer will produce quality vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Tavakal

texts.en: T. Tavakal is an older man with lots of experience. He is married with four children. He is uneducated and he works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 11 years, working with his family during this time. He is a professional farmer and, from back when he started his business, he has always wanted to improve his business. In the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask IMON to help with their problems. Therefore, today Tavakal is applying to Kiva hoping for your help. He is requesting a loan of 3,500 somoni to buy some seeds and fertilizer for his land. He is grateful for this loan process. loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at K., 51, and her husband, Mr. Sophai Orn, 52, have been married since 1975 and have five daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home. Two other daughters weave silk at home, while the youngest studies in the local school. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband is fisherman.

In the village, Sam-at sells the fish that her husband catches. She has asked for a Kiva loan from Maxima once already. She now is asking for another loan as capital for her daughters to buy silk fabric for resale and to buy raw materials (raw silk) to continue their business.

loans.use: To buy silk fabric for resale and to buy raw materials (raw silk) for her daughters' business

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mr. Yon K., 62, and his wife, Mrs. Yoeun Soun (both pictured), 61, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1978 and have seven children: five sons and two daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, one daughter helps her parents in the business and the other one attends school. Although the couple is old, they are still strong enough to work.

Yon and his wife have been farming for forty-two years. He is asking for his first loan of US$1,200 in order to purchase oxen to assist his farm.

loans.use: To purchase oxen to assist his farm

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn N. (pictured here), age 67, is a widow with three sons. All of them are married; two live outside the family home. She is living in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vorn has been selling groceries and rice for twenty-five years. She buys them from Takhmao market for resale in front of her house in the village. She is requesting her first loan of US$1,000 to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy grocery items and rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and rice for resale

loans.name: Riny

texts.en:
Mrs. Riny R., 33, and her husband, Mr. Bunnean Kim, 38, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1996 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are attending the local school.

Riny has been a silk weaver for more than ten years. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Mr. Bunnean Kim has been a motor taxi driver for four years.

Riny is requesting her first loan of US$650 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun V., age 37, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter.  Her husband passed away recently. 

Silk weaving is her main business for supporting her family. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea U., 45, is a widow with one son and three daughters. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. The other three live under her custody. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kunthea is a farmer. She grows jasmine flowers and bananas on the farm near her home. In addition, she also buys jasmine flowers from farmers in the village for resale in Phnom Penh market.  

She has a loan from Kiva through Maxima. Now she is asking for another loan in the amount of US $1,000 to purchase jasmine flowers on contract for resale. She also will use part of her loan to dig a well for family to use.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers and dig a well.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhom R. (pictured here), 40 and his wife, Mrs. Sothea Morn, 41, live on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1990 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. 
 
Sokhom has been a builder for five years. His wife is a farmer. He hopes to supplement another business raising pigs and producing rice wine. He will be able to earn more income to support his family. When he is free, he also assists his wife in her farming business.

Sokhom is asking for a loan of $1,000 to use for his pig-raising and wine-producing businesses.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and buy materials to  produce rice wine.

loans.name: Sokchamroeun

texts.en:
Miss SokChamroeun P., 20, is single and lives with her widowed mother and brother on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother has been selling groceries in front of her house since 1982.  

SokChamroeun is a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her aunt. She is asking for her first loan of $200 to purchase additional grocery items for her mother to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for her mother to sell

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget C. lives in Royak village in Takeo province. She is employed in a garment factory. She is also a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Nget C. is 45 years old. She lives with her mother and two brothers and sisters. She is requesting a loan to buy a cow to breed. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Roem

texts.en:
Mrs. Roem N. lives in Royak village in Takeo province. She is a is 61 years old widow with a child who is employed.

Mrs. Roem N. is farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets, pig food, and she would use the rest of money to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more piglets, pig food, and to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch K., 37 and her husband, Mr. Kosal Oem, 41, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of them help their aunt sell food in Phnom Penh. Three attend school and the youngest stays at home. 


Mrs. Touch K. has been a silk weaver since she was 17 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a security guard. In the past he used to be a mason. Touch has previously asked for a loan from Kiva through Maxima. She now is requesting her second loan in the amount of $250 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily A. A. is 26 years old and has a two-year old baby girl. Her business is located at Nyamlori in Kisumu, the town with the biggest lake in Kenya. Her business is situated by the roadside, making it easy for her to tap into a big market. She opened a beauty shop three years ago, where she has been selling such products as hand and body lotions, sanitary towels and shampoo to the local people. Her major challenge is that there are so many people in the area with the same kind of business. She works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business grows. She is using her loan to buy more beauty products and hopes that one day she will be a wholesaler. In the future, she dreams of building a nice house and giving an education to her child. She is a hardworking and ambitious lady.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to sell
