loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi K. is a 37-year-old single mother. She is a mother to Kelvin, a 12-years-old boy. She was introduced to Kadet by a friend. Naomi is in the business of selling shoes in Mombasa Town near Digo Road.

Her  business is situated at a  strategic place where she has many customers from every corner of Mombasa town. She has been in the business for last 10 years. This is her first loan with Kadet and she has never borrowed from any MFI before. Naomi plans to use the loan  to increase her stock of shoes.

Naomi hopes to import shoes from Dubai and China hence being able to meet all her clients needs and being ahead of her competitors.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mrs. Khom S. lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ky Yoeun, is a duck breeder. Now Mrs. Khom S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, ducklings, and duck food. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan.  Mrs. Khom S. is 27 years old and the mother of three children. One of her children attends the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, ducklings, and duck food.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon H. is a villager in Bam village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Bet Ry, is a pig middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Phon H. decided to ask for a loan to buy five more pigs to resell to earn more income. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children. One of her children is a construction worker and the other attends the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy five more pigs

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia K. G. is 26 years old, married and has a two-year-old baby boy. Her husband is a casual laborer and they hope to give their child a good education some day. Her business is located at Kiganjo in Thika, a growing town where she engages in tailoring and embroidery. She serves the local people and she manages debtors who are not willing to pay for the services. She is using her loan to buy more materials and embroidery threads to enable her to make clothes and sell them at wholesale. She is a hardworking, intelligent, courageous, and patient worker.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey T. lives in Tuol Svay Prey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ky Korn, is a duck breeder. Mrs. Srey T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pig food. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children. Three of her children attend the local school and one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pig food.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane H. is a 36 year old lady married to Antony Jibo and they are blessed with two children. Jane is in the business of selling clothes in Bamburi area. She has been in this business for the past three years. Jane was introduced to Kadet by an existing client.

She intends to utilize the loan to increase her stock of childrens wear, male trousers, skirts and blouses for the ladies. Jane has a good credit history for she had borrowed from another MFI and she serviced her loan well.
       
Jane is a hard working lady, and her desire is to go wholesale.

loans.use: Add stock of childrens, men's and ladies' wear.

loans.name: Rimah

texts.en:
Rimah is a Palestinian man, aged 32, who is married with three children: two boys, 7 and 1.5 years old, and one girl, 5 years old.

Rimah, as with most Palestinians, has two jobs: one as a police officer with the Palestinian National Authority and another as the owner of a bookstore and a mobile phone shop. He started his business two years ago to increase his income. His shop is located in a very good location surrounded by three schools which increase the demand for his business.

In his shop, Rimah sells all types of school stationary: books, copybooks, pens, pencils and stickers as well as children’s gifts and accessories. In addition to this he sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories plus offers a service to locals providing international calls from his office at a certain cost.

Rimah requested 1,000 USD from FATEN to buy new goods for his shop, especially since the schools’ second semester will start mid-January.

Rimah appears in the photo at his shop.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his shop

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Mrs. Orn C. (pictured here), age 56 and her husband, Mr. Lam Chhum, age 56, live about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1971 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. Seven of the children are married and live outside the family home. Orn and her husband are farmers. They grow bananas, corn and cauliflower on their farmland far from their house. Orn has asked for a Kiva loan three times already. She hopes to continue increasing the productivity of her corn, cucumbers and cauliflower because her family depends on farming as their main source of income. Hence, she is requesting another loan in the amount of $700 to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for growing corn, cucumbers and cauliflower and to pay the fee for plowing.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed, and pesticides and pay for plowing

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. is 30 years old, single, and has one child. He is a barber by profession but he also owns a motorbike which he uses as a taxi.

This is Stephen’s first loan and he intends to open another barber shop. Stephen’s shop is at Kero-port were his clients are the residents and area commuters.  He has been in this business for six years.  Stephen plans to venture into the transport business in full force and even own a van one day.  He seems determined so we wish him success in all his endeavors.

loans.use: To establish another barber shop.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mr. Sokha Pok (pictured in the photo), 49, and his wife, Mrs. Mom Rong, 38, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have three sons, all of whom study in the local school. 

Sokha and his wife have been growing cauliflower and green beans on their farm for more than three years. In addition, Sokha wants to supplement his income with another business: raising pigs. He will be able to get extra income from the new business. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy piglets to raise. He also will use part of the loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.use: To buy piglets, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis B. O. is 39 years old, married and has two children. Both his children are boys, aged four and two years. His wife is a business lady and they hope to purchase a plot and build rental houses some day. His business is located at Lake market in Kisumu, a very beautiful town that has the biggest Kenyan lake. The business is situated in the Central Business District, which puts him at a great advantage to serve so many local people. He engages in selling compact disks, computer accessories and also does computer services. He has the challenge of many people doing the same business as his. He is using his loan to purchase a printer to grow his business and in the future, he dreams of opening a cyber cafe. He is a hardworking and ambitious man.

loans.use: To purchase a printer

loans.name: Muny

texts.en:
Miss Muny H. (pictured here), is single and lives with her parents, brothers and sisters in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother sells vegetables in Phnom Penh market and her father is a wooden house builder.  

Muny has been a silk weaver for four years. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market.  She is applying for her first loan of $350 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk S. (pictured here), 55, is a widow with six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home, two of them work in Phnom Penh City and the other attends a local school. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
 
Thouk has been a silk weaver for four years.  She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market.  She is asking for her first loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Thy Prum, 36, live in a small village in the suburbs of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2001 and have no children yet.  

Ny has been in the oyster business for more than two years and her husband is a motor taxi driver. She hopes to supplement her income with another business: raising chickens. She will be able to earn extra income from the business.  

Hence, Ny is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim O. (pictured with her grandson), age 55, is a widow with seven children: four sons and three daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home; one is a garment factory worker. She lives in a small village along national road number four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kim sells food in front of the garment factory. She doesn’t have her own transportation and she spends a lot of money for transportation. So she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle to use for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sinet

texts.en:
Miss Sinet R. (pictured here), 20, is single and lives with her sisters, brothers and widowed mother on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
 
Sinet has been a silk weaver for two years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market.  She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She also will use a part of her loan to purchase construction materials for her brother’s business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and construction materials for her brother’s business.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou M. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de LYNDIANE depuis mai 2007 et a eu de performances remarquables avec le crédit. Elle vend des friperies et des rafraîchissements. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Bintou M., aged 34, is married and the mother of six children, who all attend school. She has been a member of the village bank of Lyndiane since May 2007 and has an outstanding credit history. She sells secondhand clothes and cold drinks. Bintou participates in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Arafat

texts.en:
Arafat is a young Palestinian man, 23 years old, who is married with one child.

Arafat owns a grocery store in addition to working as a cook in a restaurant that caters for big events like weddings and when some one has passed away. At such big events, the family provide food for all those who come to pay their respects or to join the family celebration. Gathering around the lunch table is very important in Palestinian tradition for such big events.

Arafat requested 2,000 USD to expand his grocery store and to buy new goods for the shop.

Sometimes, while Arafat is working in the restaurant, his brother stays in the shop. Arafat appears in the photo at his store.

loans.use: To purchase goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie BASSENE est âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants scolarisés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de LYNDIANE depuis le 19 mai 2007 et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle participe au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Marie B., aged 46, is married and the mother of five children who attend school. She has been a member of the village bank of Lyndiane since May 19, 2007 and was granted five loans which she managed well and repaid on schedule. Marie participates in the payment of school fees for her children and supports her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Aïta

texts.fr:
Madame Aita D.  habite dans la localité de Ouakam depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années. Elle a connu l’U-IMCEC par l’intermédiaire du programme de développement  de l’enfance et de la famille de la zone de Ouakam ou elle était parente bénéficiaire. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 3 crédits au sein de l’institution. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 7 enfant .C’est une dame qui participe très  activement dans l’’entretien de sa famille car son mari dispose de revenus très insuffisants. Le seul moyen d’assurer la subsistance de ses enfants était de se doter d’une activité  génératrice  de revenus pour venir en aide à sa famille qui ne pouvait compter que sur elle. Ainsi elle a opte pour la commercialisation de poissons fumes et séchés, de fruits de mer et de certains produits locaux comme par exemple le citron liquide. Ce qui l’intéresse surtout dans son activité c’est la rapidité de la vente des produits..Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour augmenter son fond et renforcer son stock de produits. Ce crédit l’aidera a atteindre une indépendance financière et satisfaire ses besoins personnels en toute discrétion.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïta D. has been living in the village of Ouakam for over ten years. She got to know the microfinance institution U-IMCEC through the Development Program for Children and Families in the area of Ouakam and became a beneficiary of this program. Moreover, she was granted three loans by our institution.

Aïta is married and the mother of seven children. She very actively participates in the family expenses, since her husband's income is definitely insufficient. Her only way to provide for her children was to get a lucrative activity, because her family relied on her. She decided to launch a fish store, in which she sells smoked and dried fish, seafood and a few local products, such as lemon juice. Her main interest in her business is a fast turnover rate.

Aïta applies now for a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to increase her working capital and bolster her inventory. This loan will help her to get financial independence and to simply meet her own needs.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting the population in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Kateryna

texts.en:
Kateryna is married with three adult children. She sells children's clothing at the central market in Ivano-Frankovsk city. Kateryna started this business twelve years ago when she was dismissed from a radio factory that downsized. Today she has three locations where she and two of her employees sell the clothes. Their large assortment and low prices have attracted many repeat customers.

Kateryna would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and receive additional income.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a married man with four children: three boys and one girl, all of whom are attending school.

Ismail has a shop where he sells fruits, vegetables, frozen meat and chicken. His shop is located in a very good location where it is the only shop in that area that sells such products. Isamil appears in the photo at his shop where he is slicing some goat meat.

Isamil requested 3,000 USD from FATEN to pay some debts he owes to the merchants who provide him with the goods for his shop. In addition to that, he will use some of the loan to pay for new goods.

loans.use: To pay some debts to merchants and to buy new goods

loans.name: Taï

texts.fr: Taï D. est une femme de 47 ans elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 19 février 2001. Elle a eu 17 expériences avec le crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle développe un commerce de jus de citron et d'huile de palme. Avec ses bénéfice elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Taï D. is a married 47-year-old woman with 9 kids. She has been a member of the COLOBANE FASS Banc Villageois since February 19, 2001. She has had 17 loans and has never had a problem repaying them. She is developing a business selling lemon juice and palm oil. She will use her profits to help pay her family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 37-year-old man who is married with three children who are still at school.

Naser works as a police officer in the Palestinian National Authority. In addition to his work, since his salary is not enough, he fixes ovens (cooking gas) for the public and buys old ovens to fix and renovate and then sells them.

Naser requested a loan of 3,000 USD since there is a good quantity of used ovens available. He will buy them all and do the renovations and sell them. Since Gaza has been under restriction for a long time such equipment is not accessible and so the market for his products is huge.

Naser appears in the photo fixing one of the ovens at his workshop.

loans.use: To buy used ovens of good quantity

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama C. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 17 fois successivement. Elle vend des habits (boubous) en tissus teintés. Avec les bénéfices elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Adama C. is a married 41-year-old mother of 9 kids. She is very experienced with taking loans, having benefitted from 17 consecutive loans. She sells clothes (boubous) made from dyed fabrics. She will use her profits to help her husband support her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her clothes-selling business

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou C. est âgée de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont elle partage les charges avec son mari. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 19 février 2001 et a 16 expériences avec le crédit. Elle vend de l'huile de palme, du "nététou" (produit alimentaire local), du miel et de jus de citron. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'alimentation, la scolarité et santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou C. is a married 58-year-old mother of 6 kids, who she supports alongside her husband. She has been a member of the COLOBANE FASS Banc Villageois since February 19, 2001 and has had 16 loans. She sells palm oil, "nététou" (a local food), honey, and lemon juice. Her profits allow her to pay for food, schooling, and the health of her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FAtou D. est âgée de 58 ans, elle est divorcée et mère de 06 enfants dont elle a l'entière charge. Elle est membre de Banc Village depuis le 25 août 2001. Elle fait du commerce de poisson frais; elle achète son produit en gros et revend au détail dans son village. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge la nourriture, la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 58-year-old divorced mother of six children of which she is the sole caregiver. She has been a member of the Banc Village since August 25, 2001. She sells fresh fish; she buys her product wholesale and then retails them in her village. Her earnings allow her to pay for the food, education and healthcare of her children.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her fish-selling business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia M. vive en la Av. Cuba de la zona Miraflores en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
La señora vive junto a su hijo y trabaja vendiendo joyas de plata.

Con este crédito solicitado pretende hacer efectivo el pago del semestre de la universidad en la que su hijo estudia.

Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas; con este crédito su hijo tendrá la oportunidad de continuar los estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia M. lives on Cuba Avenue in the Miraflores area of La Paz city. She lives with her son and works selling silver jewelry. With this loan she will pay the semester tuition at the university where her son studies. This is her third loan with Impro, her credit history qualifies her as a good client with regard to her payment history; with this loan her son will have the opportunity to continue his education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay university tuition for her son

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria V. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de San Pedro, de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos.
La señora Maria trabaja decoradora en domicilios particulares, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los muros de su vivienda ya que por filtraciones en las cubiertas se deterioraron los muros y pisos en tres habitaciones.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria V. lives with her parents, in the San Pedro area of La Paz city with her two sons. Maria works as a decorator in private homes and with that income she supports her family. She seeks a loan to renovate the walls of her home because due to leaks the walls and floors in three rooms have deteriorated. This is the second time she is seeking a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies her favorably to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the walls and floors of three rooms in her home

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia vive, en la calle Integracion de la zona Franz Tamayo, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo en el terreno que, con sacrificio adquirieron  mediante un plan de pagos los cuales están cancelando mensualmente.

Ella se dedica a la costura de cubrecamas en calidad de mano de obra, trabajo que realiza en su domicilio; su esposo trabaja también como costurero  en la fábrica ubicada en la misma zona. 


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción (piedra, cemento, ladrillos) para realizar la ampliación de su vivienda. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Leticia lives in Integracion street in Franz Tamayo, in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and her little son in a lot they bought with a great deal of effort thanks to a payment plan that they are repaying every month. She’s a seamstress devoted exclusively to mend and tailor comforters at home. Her husband is also a seamstress, but he works in a factory near their home. The loan will be used to purchase construction material (stone, cement, brick) to expand her home. Although this is her first loan with Impro, her evaluation qualified her to get it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand her home

loans.name: Nelly Gladys

texts.es: Nelly tiene 56 años de edad, es casada vive en casa propia. Nelly se dedica a atender su bodega la cual queda en su domicilio. Ella inició su negocio hace 4 años, con un capital pequeño producto de sus ahorros y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, Nelly atiende su bodega de manera muy cálida y amable y esto hace que sus clientes regresan a su bodega. Ella las ganancias las vuelve a invertir y así poder seguir creciendo. El sueño a futuro de Nelly es poder tener reconstruir su vivienda la cual fue afectada por el terremoto. Solicíta el crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Nelly is 56 years old and lives in her own home. Nelly has a small store located in her home. She began her business 4 years ago, with a small number of items purchased with her savings and little by little has grown her business. Nelly is very warm and friendly with her customers, which makes them return to her store. She reinvests her earnings so she can continue growing her business. Nelly’s dream for the future is to be able to rebuild her home which was affected by the earthquake. She seeks a loan to invest in buying merchandise for the Christmas holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva vive en la Mzno. E, patio 1de la  Zona Rió Seco, viviendas de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes.

La señora se dedica a la fabricación “suerte sin blanca” que son tickets elaborados en cartulina, que en su interior muestran el nombre del premio que el posible cliente gana al comprar un ticket. Estos productos los vende en tiendas, ferias y barrios.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de más mercadería (cartulina y tintas) para preparar sus productos. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con IMPRO;  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Elva lives in Mzno. E, hall 1, in Rio Seco, in the city of El Alto. She lives in her own home with her husband and their three children who are all independent. She makes color card tickets for a game called “Suerte sin Blanca” (Raffle in which everybody wins a price). The tickets show the name of the price on the inside that the customers may win when they buy them. She sells them in stores, fairs and around the neighborhood. The loan will be used to purchase stationary material (colored cards and ink) to make her products. This is her second loan with Impro. Her successful evaluation qualified her to get it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase color cards and ink to make tickets

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson  vive en la calle  No 5 de la zona  Rosas Pampa de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en alquiler, tiene un  hijo el cual cuida su esposa. 

 Tiene una tienda donde repara celulares de toda marca  y además vende artículos relacionados con celulares y celulares. 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de repuestos de teléfonos celulares.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Wilson lives in #5 Street, in Rosas Pampa, in the city of El Alto. He rents a home with his son who takes care of his wife. He owns a store where he repairs and sells cell phones and related items of all brands. The loan will be used to cell phone spare parts. This is his first loan with IMPRO. His successful evaluation qualified him to get it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cell phone spare parts

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  vive en la calle  Muñecas de la zona Pazanqueri de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa de sus padres, tiene tres hijos los cuales cuida su esposa. 

Es chofer propietario de un automóvil y trabaja en el grupo de trufis 88 del sindicato Eduardo Abaroa de la ciudad de La Paz. 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción (estuco, pintura, etc.,) y esto le servirá para la refacción de su  vivienda.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in Muñecas Street, in Pazanqueri, in the city of El Alto. He lives with his parents and his wife who’s in charge of taking care of their three children. He’s a driver and he owns his vehicle. He works for the Trufis 88 group (taxi cab) that belongs to the Eduardo Abaroa Union, in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase construction material (stucco, paint, etc) to make home improvements. This is his first loan with IMPRO. His successful evaluation qualified him to get it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (stucco, paint, etc) to make home improvements

loans.name: Martha Dels Socorro

texts.es: Doña Martha Del Socorro tiene 53 años, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. La señora se dedica al negocio de la compra-venta de mercadería en general. Vende ropa, cosméticos, lo cual distribuye de manera ambulante, Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. La señora dio inicio a este negocio hace  bastante tiempo, sin embargo ha luchado mucho en su vida por tratar de proporcionarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario en la vida. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de productos varios, ya que actualmente tiene bastante pedidos, ya que esta entregándoles mercancías a otras personas. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Martha Del Socorro is 53 and has three grown children. She buys and sells general merchandise. She is a street vendor, and she sells clothes and cosmetics. She has been doing this for ten years. She started her business some time ago. Nevertheless, she has fought a lot in her life to try to give her children all of life’s necessities. The loan is to buy various products. Right now she has a lot of orders because she is delivering merchandise to other people. Her dream has always been to have better economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou D.  est   une retraite de l’hôtellerie depuis plus de 5 ans. Depuis lors il s’est converti en agriculteur qui fait de la culture maraichère. Aussi en même  temps il pratique l’élevage de poulets de chairs qu’il vend surtout à l’ occasion des fêtes  de pâques  et de fin d’années. Il fait partie d’un GIE pour le développement   de la culture maraichère  dans la région  des Niayes, une localité  très fertile qui se situe à plusieurs kilomètres  de Dakar. Il est marie et père de famille. Son activité  très rentable lui permet de gagner en moyenne 200 000 frs par mois. Ces revenus, en plus de l’envoie qu’il reçoit  périodiquement  de son fils immigre qui vit actuellement en France lui permettent d’entretenir sa   famille, de payer les scolarités de ses enfants et de subvenir a ses besoins personnels. Il sollicite un premier crédit de 350 000 frs pour augmenter le stock de ses aliments et faire face aux besoins urgents de son élevage.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécie.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou D. has been a retiree from the hotel business for more than 5 years. Since then, he’s been in agriculture growing produce. He also raises plump chickens, which he sells during Easter and New Year’s. He is part of an Economic Interest Group for the development of crops in the Niayes region, a very fertile region several kilometers from Dakar. He is a married father. His very profitable business allows him to earn on average 200,000 francs per month. His earnings, combined with what he periodically gets from his son who currently lives in France, allow him to support his family, to pay for his children’s schooling, and to meet his personal needs. He is seeking a first loan of 350,000 francs to increase his stock of food and to meet the urgent needs of farm. Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Claudia Lissette

texts.es: Claudia tiene 29 años, La actividad económica de ella es la venta de cosméticos. No es la primera vez que realiza un financiamiento por lo que fue una muy buena experiencia.  Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella decidió escoger este tipo de trabajo por ser uno de las fuentes de ingresos más accesibles además le gusta mucho este tipo de trabajo.  Ya que además continua trabajando como agente de ventas y con ambos trabajos trata de mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo destinado para materia prima. El deseo de Claudia es vender todos sus productos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia is 29 years old. She sells cosmetics for a living. She's been in this business for more than 11 years and decided on this particular business because it's one of the easiest accessible sources of income and besides, she loves this kind of work. Claudia also continues to work as a sales agent in order to improve her income and that of her family. This isn't the first time she is requesting a loan, since it was such a great experience last time. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase raw materials for her business. Her desire is to sell all her products and improve her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo. (to use as working capital for her business)

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr: Monsieur Jean Pierre N.  est un père de famille ,marie ,habitant dans le quartier de Dalifort .Il fait de la culture maraichère  depuis qu’il a pris sa retraite, cela  fait maintenant plus de 5 ans. Il exerce aussi l’élevage de poulets de chair qu’il vend a l’occasion des fêtes de pâques et de fin d’années. En plus du soutien financier de son fils qui vit en France il gagne en moyenne 200 000 frs mensuellement et parvient a entretenir convenablement sa famille .Monsieur N.  est expérimenté en matière de prêt a LU-IMCEC car ce n’est pas son premier crédit. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs pour augmenter son stock d’aliment de poulets de chair et faire face aux besoins urgents  de ses volailles Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mr. Jean Pierre N. is a married father who lives in the Dalifort neighborhood. He has been selling his goods at the farmers’ market since retiring over five years ago. He also raises poultry that he sells during Easter and New Year’s. In addition to the financial support from his son who lives in France, he earns on average 200,000 francs monthly and succeeds in comfortably supporting his family. Mr. N. has experience in the loaning practices at LU-IMCEC for this is not his first loan. He is seeking a loan of 400,000 francs to add to his feed stock for the poultry and to address the urgent needs of his animals. Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to reinforce working capital

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es: Adelayda tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y junto a su pareja tienen 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de ella es una pulpería Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Todo inicio porque ella decidió establecer una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda y ofrecer los granos básicos a sus vecinos y demás clientes, pero necesitaba más financiamiento por lo que acudió a Fundación León 2000 y fue así como logro salir adelante con su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la inversión de productos en su pulpería. Ella sueña con incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Adelayda is 38 years old, is married and she and her husband have two children they support. For more than 15 years now, she's been running a grocery store. This grocery store is run out of her home and she sells basic grains and products to her neighbors and other customers. Recently, she needed additional funding and reached out to the Leon Foundation with the idea that this loan would help in the success of her business. Adelayda dreams of growing her business and improving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo (working capital for her business)

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndiaga D. évolue  dans la culture maraichère  depuis sa retraite. Il fait aussi de l’élevage  de poulets de chairs et de moutons Il exploite un champ hérité de son père qui était très intéressé  a l’agriculture.IL fait partie d’un groupe qui travaille dans le domaine de l’agriculture. Cela fait plus de 30 ans qu’il évolue  dans le      secteur. En plus de sa pension ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille .Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour renforcer ses activités. C’est son premier prêt a l’U-IMCEC.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécie.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndiaga D. has been selling in farmers markets since his retirement. He also raises poultry and lambs. He uses a field inherited from his father who was very involved in agriculture. He is part of a group who works in the field of agriculture. He has been developing for over thirty years in this sector. In addition to his pension, his earnings allow him to support his family. He is asking for a loan of 150,000 francs to strengthen his business. It’s his first loan with U-IMCEC. Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Cajina Group

texts.es:
En las mañanas se empieza a expandir un olor peculiar por las calles a le dañas al centro de salud  Edgar Lan. Sus pobladores se levantan atraídos por el aroma y acuden al origen de este a la Panadería de la joven Sofía Inés A. C.. 

Está joven perteneciente al grupo C. trabaja arduamente desde muy tempranas horas hasta el a anochecer. Por las mañanas y las tardes hornea pan, donas y reposterías las cuales distribuye  y en las noches hace fresco, hilo y helados. La meta de ella es tener un carrito de hog dog para incursionar en otros rubros.

Sus compañeras Blanca Azucena A. C. venden esquimos en su casa y comenzara a vender hot dog y María Lydia M. Dávila hace chocobananos y helados.Ellas este año nuevo esperan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Each morning a peculiar smell begins to spread through the streets around the Edgar Lan Health Center. The residents rise, attracted by the aroma and gather at its origin – the bakery of the young Sofía Inés A. C..

This young woman belongs to the C. Group and works arduously from the earliest hours until it begins to become dark. Mornings and afternoons she bakes bread, donuts and pastries which she distributes, and at night she makes pine-apple juice, popsicles and ice cream. Her goal is to have a hot dog cart that can take her into other areas.

Among her companions, Blanca Azucena A. C. sells eskimo pies from her house and plans to begin selling hot dogs, while María Lydia M. Dávila makes chocolate-covered bananas and ice cream. They hope this New Year to better their condition of life and continue advancing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY WHEAT FLOUR, YEAST, SUGAR, EGGS, MILK, AND BAKING POWDER FOR BAKING

loans.name: Cesar Adolfo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Cesar tiene 38 años, es casado y tiene un hijo llamado Cesar Gabriel que tiene 2 años. El socio Cesar vive en la ciudad de Pisaq departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Las reuniones de los socios se hace en la ciudad de Calca.  

El socio tenía se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanías. El socio nos cuenta que compra la artesanía en la ciudad de Pisaq de los artesanos como bisutería y collares de cerámica y después una vez al mes lleva la artesanía personalmente al país de Brasil específicamente a la ciudad de Sao Paulo donde ahí lo distribuye a las tiendas brasileñas y peruanas. Ya son 5 a 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más artesanías y para los gastos del viaje. 
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cesar is 38 years old, married, and has a two year old son named Cesar Gabriel. He lives in the city of Pisaq in the Department of Cusco and is a member of the Communal Bank “Mamacha Asunta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. The members conduct their Communal Bank meetings in the city of Calca.

Cesar buys and sells handicrafts. He says that he buys crafts from artisans in the city of Pisaq such as handmade jewelry and ceramic beads. Once a month he travels to Brazil, specifically the city of Sao Paulo, to distribute the merchandise to Brazilian and Peruvian stores in the area. He has been in this business approximately 5-6 years and has done very well because of the effort he puts into his work. Cesar is a working father and entrepreneur who wants to succeed on behalf of his family. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more handicrafts and pay for his traveling expenses.

Cesar is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts & pay for traveling expenses

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es: La señora Maximina está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en su negocio que es comercialización de verduras, ella vende los productos en la Paz Centro, León y  Managua  de lunes a viernes, por lo que de alguna u otra forma busca la manera de proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día para ella y su familia. Por lo que siempre ha luchado para mejorar sus ingresos ya que no es fácil mantener este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionar estabilidad a su familia y mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Maximina is seeking a new loan to invest in her business, which is selling vegetables. She sells these products in central La Paz, León, and Managua from Monday to Friday. Through these sales, in one way or another, she seeks a way to provide daily sustenance for herself and her family. She has always struggled to increase her income, since it is not easy to maintain this business. The financing that she is asking for is working capital for the purchase of basic goods. Her goal is to provide stability for her family and keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sanou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sanou D. habite dans la localité de Dalifort. Sa spécialité est la fabrication de briques, colistras et dalles qu’il revend a des clients opérant dans le domaine du bâtiment. Sa clientèle est spécifiquement  composée de maçons  et de propriétaires de maisons. Il a une expérience de plus de dix ans dans le secteur. Il a un chiffre d’affaire journalier de 200 000 frs. Il sollicite un premier prêt de 500 000 frs dans l’institution. Son objectif est d’augmenter son stock et renforcer ses activités pour faire face a la forte demande.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécie.


.
texts.en:
Mr Sanou D. lives in the city of Dalifort. He specialized in manufacturing bricks, colistra tiles and slabs which he sells to customers operating in the construction sector. His clientele is mainly composed of bricklayers and house owners. He has more than 10 years experience in the sector. His daily turnover amounts to 200,000 CFA francs.

Sanou came to our institution and applied for his first loan of 500,000 CFA francs. He will use it to expand his inventory and bolster his activity, so that he can meet the strong demand.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting the population in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Pedro tiene 47 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos que dependen de él: Pedro Antonio tiene 24 años, José Francis y Adrian tiene 9 años. El socio Pedro vive en la ciudad de Pisaq departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Las reuniones de los socios se hace en la ciudad de Calca.  

El socio se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artesanías. El socio nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño taller de fabricación de artesanía y también tiene un puesto de venta en la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad de Pisaq. El socio vende artesanía a personas que exportan los productos a los países como Chile, Argentina y Brasil. Ya son 5 a 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales para la fabricación de artesanía como pintura, arcilla blanca y pigmentos y para el acabado, barniz, tintes, mates y laca. 
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Community bank member Pedro is 47 years old and is married with three sons who depend on him; Pedro Antonio is 24 years old, and José Francis and Adrian are 9 years old. Pedro lives in the city of Pisaq in the Cusco region and belongs to the community bank "MAMACHA ASUNTA" of the Arariwa association. The meetings of the bank members are held in the city of Calca.

Pedro makes and sells handicrafts. He tells us that he has a small workshop for the fabrication of handicrafts and he also has a stall on the Plaza de Armas in the city of Pisaq. He sells handicrafts to people who export these products to countries such as Chile, Argentina, and Brazil. He has already worked at this business for 5 to 6 years and it has gone very well for him, thanks to all the determination that he puts into his work. He is a hard-working and enterprising father who is advancing his family. He needs the loan to buy more materials for the production of handicrafts, such as paint, white clay and pigments, and for the finishing, varnish, dyes, matte finishes, and lacquer.

Pedro is thankful for the opportunity offered through this means and likewise promises to fulfill the corresponding payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Octavio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Octavio tiene  50 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos todavía menores de edad. El señor tiene un taller de carpintería ubicado en su casa de habitación en el cual elabora puertas, sillas, comedores, etc. Don Octavio dio inicio a su negocio hace 28 años, cabe señalarse el señor se dedicaba a esta actividad desde su niñez ya que su padre fue carpintero y de su padre fue que aprendió el oficio. Cuando dio inicio el señor solamente tenía una cierra circular y un torno, y fue con el tiempo que empezó a hacerse de  su capital para comprar tanto madera como sus artículos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima para cumplir compromisos de pedidos que actualmente tienen pendientes. El sueño es llegar a establecer un taller más grande y poner productos a la exhibición a la venta, sin necesidad de producir solamente por pedidos.
texts.en:
Señor Octavio is 50 years old and is married, with two children who are still minors. He has a carpentry workshop located in his house, where he makes doors, chairs, dining room sets, etc. Don Octavio began his business 28 years ago. It is worth noting that he has worked at this activity since his childhood, since his father was a carpenter and it was from his father that he learned the trade. When he began, he had only a circular saw and a lathe, and with time he began to amass his capital to buy wood as well as his other items. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials to fill promised orders that are now waiting. His dream is to establish a larger workshop and exhibit articles for sale, without needing to produce only for orders.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es: La señora Rosa esta solicito un crédito  dice que los préstamos han influido favorablemente en su vida, ya que le ha ayudado a generar ganancias que le ayudan a suplir las necesidades familiares. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para su negocio. Lo que la señora hace es que da crédito a los buenos clientes y siempre vive ofertando nuevas prendas y modernas, que le ayudan a mantener la atención de la clientela. La señora aduce, que gracias a Dios su negocio ha estado muy rentable, por lo que su único problema han sido las enfermedades que han atacado a su familia y a ella ultimadamente. Actualmente, su sueño más anhelado es tener una tienda ampliada con nuevos productos como es la ropa nueva y que sea de muy buena calidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is soliciting a loan. She says that her past loans have favorably influenced her life, having helped her generate earnings that enable her to supply family necessities. For that reason, she now requests financing for purchasing prime materials for her clothing business.

She provides credit to her good customers and always offers new and modern garments which attract the attention of her clientèle. Rosa believes that, thanks to God, her business has been profitable, and her only problems have been illnesses that have attacked her family and, lately, her.

At present, her most cherished dream is to have a store with new, more extensive products, including new clothes of very good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast and firewood

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Pedro tiene 68 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, uno de los hijos depende de él: Luís Alberto que tiene 26 años que estudia en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco la carrera profesional de Educación Física. El socio Pedro vive en la ciudad de Pisaq departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio tenía se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanías. El socio nos cuenta que compra la artesanía en la ciudad de Pisaq de los artesanos como bisutería y collares de cerámica y después una vez al mes con su hijo Cesar llevan la artesanía personalmente al país de Brasil específicamente a la ciudad de Sao Paulo donde ahí lo distribuye a las tiendas brasileñas y peruanas. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más artesanías y para los gastos del viaje. 
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our client Pedro is 68 years old and married with 4 children, one of whom is still dependent on him (his son Luis Alberto, 26, who is studying Physical Education at the Universidad San Antionio Abad del Cusco). Pedro lives in the city of Pisaq, in Cusco department, and is a member of the "Mamacha Asunta" Communal Bank at Asociación Arariwa. Pedro buys and sells crafts for a living. He tells us that he buys the crafts (like jewelery and ceramic necklaces) in Pisaq from artisans, and once a month he and his son Cesar take the crafts to Sao Paolo, Brazil and distribute them to Brazilian and Peruvian stores. He has been in this line of work for the past 6 years, and it has gone very well for him, thanks to his dedication to his work. He is a hard-working, entrepreneurial father who is trying to help his family get ahead in life. He needs this loan to buy more crafts and pay for his travel costs. Pedro is grateful for the opportunity he has been offered, and is committed to repaying his loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: l socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más artesanías y para los gastos del viaje.

loans.name: G.s. Lourdes Yovanis Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Lourdes Yovanis está compuesto por la señora Bernarda y Elsa. Ella aduce que este negocio le ha ayudado a tener buenos ingresos, lo que le ha permitido seguir manteniendo a sus dos hijos menores de edad. Algo que agradece a Fundación León 2000 es que con este préstamo ella incremento su inventario, aumento sus ventas y por ende logro mejorar las condiciones de vida que ella poseía, y hasta ha realizado algunas mejoras a su vivienda. Ella sueña en el futuro es que desea establecer una pulpería en su domicilio y sobre todo desea que sus hijos se puedan preparar en la universidad. En cambio Elsa se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y tortillas, además de esto vende frijoles y también vende leña desde su casa de habitación. Por lo que ambas solicitan financiamientos para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group Lourdes Yovanis is made up of Bernarda and Elsa. Bernarda claims that this business has helped her to have a good income, and it has allowed her to continue to support her two minor children. She is thankful to the Foundation León 2000, since through their loan she increased her inventory, increased her sales and in the end improved her living conditions; she was even able to carry out some improvements to her home. She dreams that in the future she can set up a small grocery store in her home, and above all she hopes that her children can study at the university. Elsa sells nactatamales, tortillas and beans; in addition she sells firewood from her home. Both women are requesting financing to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mana está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y muy competentes que desde muy tempranas horas están realizando sus labores. Ellas son Karla B. Flores quien comenzó vendiendo refresco y luego se introdujo a comercializar  productos de la marca Avon y zapatos, Susana María A. vende tortillas y frijoles, Nelly Socorro Palacio B. tiene una pulpería  y Estela Z. S. comercializa jocotes y pinolillo.

Ellas esperan el próximo año seguir trabajando y progresar para ello invertirán este presta y su dedicación a sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Mana" is formed by 4 hardworking and competent women who rise early to begin their work. They are: Karla B. Flores, who sells drinks and markets Avon brand products and shoes; Susana Maria A., who sells tortillas and beans; Nelly Socorro Palacio B., who has a small grocery store; and Estela Z. Sanchez, who sells plums and pinolillo (a typical Nicaraguan drink made of roasted corn flour and cocoa.) They expect that next year they will continue to work and progress, to accomplish this they will invest this loan and dedicate themselves to their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Sebastian Antonio

texts.es: El señor Sebastián tiene 51 años de edad, es soltero y tiene solamente un hijo menor de edad. Su negocio es muy peculiar como es prestar servicio de música y anuncios en la calle, además que realiza reparaciones a domicilio de parlantes en general, el señor es poseedor de una disco móvil, la que además sirve para realizar perifoneo. El señor inicio este negocio hace 5 años, tiempo en el cual, con una pequeña liquidación de su trabajo anterior logro comprar dos parlante y una consola con la que empezó a ofertar sus servicios de sonido. Actualmente posee dos poderes de sonido, una consola de ecualización y cuatro parlantes. El señor está solicitando este crédito para realizar la compra de un poder más potente que los que actualmente tiene, para tener más sonido y ser atractivo para el público. Su mayor sueño siempre ha sido tener mejores equipos y más actualizados que y que lógicamente brinden mayores ganancias que compartir con su hijo menor de edad.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 51 years old, single, and has only one son who is minor in age. His business is very unusual as it is a service to provide music and announcements in the street. In addition, he performs repairs on speakers in his home. He owns a mobile disco, which also serves to make broadcasts. He started this business 5 years ago, a time in which he found himself with a small severance from his previous work. He managed to buy 2 speakers and a console, so that he could begin to offer his sound services. Currently he has 2 amplifiers, a sound equalizer console and 4 speakers. He is requesting this loan to purchase an amplifier that is more powerful than the ones he currently has, to be able to produce more sound and be appealing to the public. His main dream has always been to have better and more up-to-date equipment so that he can generate better earnings that he can share with his minor son.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy an amplifier

loans.name: Aurea Maribel

texts.es:
Aurea es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos y su padre en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace un año instaló en su vivienda una pequeña bodega donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas. La idea de ese negocio nació a raíz de la necesidad de ayudar a sostener la economía familiar, ya que lo que su esposo percibía como trabajador agrícola no le bastaba para sacarlos adelante.

El negocio goza de buena acogida entre sus clientes ya que la zona en donde viven queda alejada del mercado del distrito y el establecimiento ofrece muchos productos de consumo diario. Aurea desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de bebidas por lo que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir haciendo crecer su negocio para bridarle a sus hijos una mejor educación. Este es su segundo crédito con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable y puntual al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Aurea is a 37-year-old mother that lives with her husband, their two children and her father in the district of Paiján, province of Ascope, in the La Libertad region, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. A year ago she installed a small convenience store in her dwelling where she offers her clients basic foods(rice, sugar, oil), groceries, delicacies and beverages. The idea for the business came about because of the need to help maintain the family finances, since what her husband received as an agricultural worker did not suffice to get ahead. The business is well recieved among its clients since the zone where they live is far away from the market of the district and the establishment offers many daily consumer goods. Aurea desires to expand her business with the purchase of beverages, for which she applied to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 Soles. Her greater wish is to continue growing her business in order to give her children a better education. This is her second loan with our Institution and she has shown to be a punctual and responsible client in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages to grow her business.

loans.name: Xiomara De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Xiomara de los Ángeles J. desde muy joven para ayudar en los gastos del hogar empezó a vender ropa usada. Ella inicio con la cooperación de su compañero de vida el cual le a servido de apoyo y con ello ha sabido salir adelante.
texts.en:
From an early age, Xiomara de los Ángeles J. has helped with the expenses of the home. She began to sell used clothes. She started with the cooperation of her life companion, who helped to support them, and with this business she has been known to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packs of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: La señora Maria Del Transito tiene 61 años de edad, es casada con 3 hijos mayores de edad. Maria tiene un negocio de ferretería. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, debido a que ella no tenia los suficientes ingresos en los últimos días la señora ha tenido unos pequeños problemas en cuanto a la oferta, es decir que hay mas ofertas de productos que lo que demanda la gente, sin embargo con una buena técnica de mercadeo ha logrado quedarse en el mercado. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  herramientas necesarias para su negocio. Su meta es crecer de una manera abundante para que así su negocio pueda ampliarse.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Del Transito is 61 years of age. She is married with 3 children of legal age. Maria has a hardware business. She started this business 10 years ago, due to the fact that she did not have sufficient income. In the last several days the lady has had some small problems with regard to her merchandise; that is to say that the people demand more products than she has available. Nevertheless with a good marketing technique she has managed to remain in business. The loan will be invested in the purchase of necessary tools for her business. Her goal is to grow in an abundant way so that her business can be expanded.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and merchandise for her hardware business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Insculas, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, a dos horas y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Durante más de 20 años se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral. Su actividad consiste en comprar y criar animales para venderlos a los ocasionales compradores que visitan su caserío así como también en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo (mercado mayorista de la ciudad). Este negocio ha constituido la única fuente de sostenimiento familiar durante todo este tiempo.

Debido a la buena temporada de ventas por campaña navideña, su ganado ha disminuido y ella desea volver a comprar más animales para comenzar a criarlos de nuevo. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y respetada por los vecinos de la zona donde vive, ellos la consideran una mujer amable y muy entregada a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Irma is 48 and married. She lives with her family in the Insculas settlement, which is in the Olmos district two hours and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been raising sheep, pigs, and poultry for over 20 years. Her work consists of buying and raising the animals. She later sells them to the buyers who occasionally visit her settlement. She also sells the animals in the Moshoqueque Market in the city of Chiclayo (the wholesale market in the city). This business has been the only source of support for the family during all of this time. Due to the good period of sales during the Christmas season, her livestock has diminished. She wants to buy more animals again to start raising them once again. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 PEN to be able to meet her objective. Her biggest goal is to keep growing as a businesswoman in order to improve her family’s quality of life. She is a well-known and respected woman among her neighbors in the area where she lives. They consider her to be a likeable woman who is very committed to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata D. est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 25 août 2001, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle développe une activité de vente d'effets vestimentaires, elle s'approvisionne sur place à Ziguinchor pour aller revendre en Guinée Bissau. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Fatoumata D. has been a member of the Village Bank of Colobane Fass since August 25, 2001. She is married and the mother of three children. She is developing a business selling clothing items, which she buys locally in Ziguinchor to resell them in Guinea Bissau. She participates in the improvement of family living conditions.

Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce her business

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou K. est âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 16 mai 2007 et a eu une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour l'avoir contracté à 07 fois de suite. Elle vend dans son quartier des effets vestimentaires qu'elle achète au Mali (pays limitrophe). Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Oumou K. is 44 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Colobane Fass since May 16, 2007 and has had a good credit experience with seven consecutive loans. She sells in her neighborhood clothing items that she buys in Mali (a neighboring country). She helps take charge of family care.

Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her clothing retail business

loans.name: Cristo Es El Camino Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Cristo es el camino”, está conformado por 10 socios emprendedores quienes viven en la zona alta de Huaycán, distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desde hace 6 años.
Olga tiene 43 años, es separada, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 20 años, asume el cargo de presidenta desde que se formo la alcancía. 
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en el estudio de sus hijos.
Con el préstamo otorgado será  para destinarlo a la compra de mercadería, nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The Cristo Es El Camino Communal Bank is comprised of ten enterprising members. They live in the high area of Huaycán in the Ate district, Lima department. They have worked with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for six years. Olga is 43, separated, and has two children. They are 10 and 20 years old. She has been the president since the communal bank was formed. For 15 years she has been selling vegetables. With the effort in her work, she was able to improve her house and support her children’s education. The loan will be used to buy merchandise. Our members appreciate the support, and they promise to make their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana Pilar

texts.es: Ana tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera  vive en casa de sus padres. Ana se encuentra estudiando la carrera de enfermería en una universidad estatal de la ciudad de Ica, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella inicio el negocio hace algunos años atrás con dinero prestado por sus padres, el dinero que obtiene lo destina para costear sus estudios. Ana poco a poco ha ido incrementado su clientela de los cuales muchos son sus compañeros de estudios de la universidad, ya les entrega la mercadería a precios bajos. Ana tiene el anhelo de llegar a realizarle profesionalmente y así poder ayudar a sus padres. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería la cual venderá en la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Ana is 22 years old. She is a single woman who lives in her parents home. Ana is studying for a career of nursing in a state university of the city of Ica. She is dedicated to the sale of clothes. She started the business some years ago with money lent by her parents. The money that she earns is destined to pay for her studies. Little by little Ana has increased her clientele, of which many are her fellow students at the university. She already delivers the merchandise at low prices. Ana has a longing to become a professional and thus to be able to help her parents. She requests the loan for the purchase of merchandise which she will sell in the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: La Sra. Natalia vive en  la zona de coqueni en casa alquilada y cuenta con una tienda de barrio que tambien es alquilada ubicada en la laguna de cota cota actividad con la que mantiene a su hogar y a sus 2 hijas quienes la ayudan en la tienda en su tiempo libre ya que las dos tambien estudian,y el esposo es transportista y la ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ella es muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, se pudo notar que el negocio de la clente esta en constante crecimiento la Sra. Natalia esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Natalia lives in the Coqueni area in a rented house. She has a neighborhood store, which is also rented. It is located in Laguna de Cota Cota. The store supports her household and her two daughters. Her daughters help her in the store during their free time. Both of her daughters also go to school. Her husband is a driver, and he helps her with the household expenses. She is very responsible about making her payments. It can be noted that the client’s business is constantly growing. Natalia is very grateful to the institution for the help.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, el cual los ayuda en los gastos. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte hacia la parte de la sierra de nuestra ciudad, servicio el cual le brinda a mineros de la zona, ya tiene amplia experiencia brindando dicho servicio, debido al buen servicio y a lo amplio que es su vehiculo se han ido incrementando sus clientes a los cuales les realiza los viajes semanalmente, Jesús obtuvo su vehiculo a través de créditos, el cual lo pago muy bien, de ahí viene cuidando su unidad la cual le proporciona ingresos que le permite ayudar a sus padres. Jesús requiere el crédito para la compra de llantas y realizarle el mantenimiento
texts.en:
Jesús is 22 years of age, single and lives at the home of his parents, who he helps with expenses. He is dedicated to offering transportation services for the mountainous part of our city, a service which he offers to miners of the area. He already has extensive experience offering said service. Due to his good service and to the large size of his vehicle, he has increased the number of his clients who make the the trips weekly. Jesus obtained his vehicle through loans, which he paid very well. He has taken care of his unit, which provides him income that permits him to help his parents. Jesus requires the loan for the purchase of tires and to carry out the maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr: Ramatoulaye B. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Kandia1 depuis 02 ans et demi. Elle développe un petit restaurant où elle vend le petit déjeuné. Une activité qui lui procure des bénéfices lui permettant de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Ramatoulaye B. is a 41 year old woman. She is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Kandia for two and a half years. She is expanding her small restaurant where she sells breakfast, a business that provides enough profit to allow her to take responsibility for her family.

Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her restaurant business

loans.name: Lizbeth Rocio

texts.es:
Lisbeth Rocio H. P. de 27 años de edad vive en casa de su tìa desde hace 3 años, ella no tiene padres y por ello se vino a Ica junto con su familiar. 
Vive en Valle Hermoso – Subtanjalla, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Toledo - Cercado de Ica. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y tuberculos desde hace 2 años y medio.
La cliente se encuentra con 5 meses de gestación pero no vive con el padre de su hijo por motivos personales. Es bien trabajadora, goza de buenas referencias de los vecinos y de parte de sus compañeros de trabajo.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que desea mejorar sus ventas para obtener un mejor ingreso que le permita ahorrar para la venida de su bebé.
texts.en:
Lisbeth Rocio H. P., 27, has lived in her aunt’s house for the last three years. She does not have parents, so she came to Ica together with her relative. She lives in Valle Hermoso – Subtanjalla. Her business is located in the Toledo market in the area surrounding Ica. She has been selling groceries and tubers for two and a half years. She is five months pregnant, but she does not live with the father of her child for personal reasons. She is a hard-worker, and she has good references from her neighbors and colleagues at work. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business. She wants to improve her sales in order to get better earnings. This will allow her to save for the arrival of her baby.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Margot Andrea

texts.es:
Margot A. D. de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia junto con sus hijas; de las cuales una de ellas trabaja y le apoya tambien en su negocio de ropa.
Viven en Las Colinas – Subtanjalla, fueron afectadas por el terremoto y poco a poco han ido recuperando sus bienes.
Trabajaba como obrera de campo y tambien como trabajadora del hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que ha sacado adelante a sus hijas; ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa en forma recorredora de martes a domingos en el mercado toledo desde hace 8 meses.
Ella desea el crédito para invertir mas en su negocio con ropa de verano y asi poder obtener un mejor ingreso ya que ella desea brindarles a sus hijas una educación superior que les permita seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Margot A. D., 45, lives in her own house with her daughters. One of them works and also helps her in her clothing business. They live in Las Colinas – Subtanjalla. They were affected by the earthquake, and, little by little, they have been recovering their assets. She worked as a field worker, and she also did domestic work. This woman is a fighter, and she has gotten her daughters ahead. For eight months now she has been selling clothes from Tuesday through Sunday at the Toledo Market. She wants the loan to invest more in her business with summer clothes. That way she will be able to get more income. She wishes to give her children a university education that will allow them to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Madres Laboriosas se encuentra ubicada en el departamento D. Lima, está conformado por 9 socios, trabajan  con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desD. hace 16 meses.
Mirtha Elena tiene 55 años, madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos asume el cargo D. presidenta, DesD. hace 3 años Mirtha se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, y también realiza trabajo manual D. tejidos, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria asume los gastos D. la educación D. sus hijos, su gran anhelo es que sean profesionales.
El reciente préstamo Reyna lo utilizara en el techado D. su casa.
Todos los socios agradecemos el apoyo brindado y a la vez nos comprometemos a cumplir con el pago D. cuotas establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Madres Laboriosas” (Working Mothers) is located in the Department of Lima. The group consists of nine members and has been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the past 16 months. Mirtha Elena is 55 years old and a single mother with three dependent children.
