loans.name: Razia Sohaila Group

texts.en: Azizudin is the group leader of Razia Sohaila group. He is married.  Through hard work he made a four-member group, each member is busy with different tasks like.  For example, Azizudin has a carpentry shop; with this loan he wants to buy more wood for his shop. The second member of Razia Sohaila group is Razia, who works in tailoring; she wants to buy necessary materials for tailoring. The third member is A. Kabir, who has a retail shop; with this loan, he wants to buy some goods for his shop.  The last member is Nooria, who wants to take a loan out for her brother. He has an electric equipment shop; with this loan, he wants to buy some more tools for his shop. They would like to thank everybody helping with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy necessary supplies for their businesses.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela B. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao Mis. Occ. She is 35 years old. Rosela is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosela owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as milo (sachet), shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosela has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosela is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon Y. (pictured here), 46, and her husband, Mr. Ing Bin, 49, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons. The couple are farmers.

Pon is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorized hand tiller to use on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Salma Group

texts.en:
This is Salma Group. This group has three members: Mohammad Yasin, Pekay B. G., and Anes G.. They live in Sultan Pour village of Surkh Road District. Mohammad Yasin is the group leader. He is 27, single, and lives in a family of six members. He is a hard working man and supports his family through his job as a mechanic. The second member of this group is Pekay; she has a bead working business and through this income she supports her family. Anes G. is the last member of this group; she runs a business of quilt making through which she supports her husband and children.

They all have requested a group loan of 42,000 Afghani to expand their businesses and buy more stock for their businesses. They would like to give many thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more stock for their businesses.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de parentés et font le commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroître du jour en jour. Elles sont à leur septième  prêt  solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 60 casiers de boissons (sucreries), une dizaine de draps et des prêt à porter à Bamako, du riz sur place pour sa transformation en baignés, des têtes et pattes de bœufs avec les bouchers de la ville pour en faire de la sauce. La vente de ces produits s’effectue aux domiciles des femmes et dans  le marché de Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 45 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’élargir leur secteur d’activités en embrassant l’élevage des ovins et caprins.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women who are on average 41 years old with three children. With their husband and children they live in large traditional families in the town of Fana, in the Banankabougou district; this lies in the prefecture of Fana, in the region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. They met through neighbors and relatives and have a business selling various items. These women work together with the microfinance company, Soro Yiriwaso, with the objective of satisfying their customers, who are increasing day by day in number. They are on their seventh group loan and all the previous loans have been repaid without incident. With this loan they are planning to buy 60 crates of sweetened drinks, ten sheets and ready to wear clothes in Bamako, rice locally to make into fritters, beef heads and legs from the butchers in the town with which to make sauce. The sale of these products is carried out in the women's homes and in the market at Fana to a customer base made up of women and men. They are planning to make an average monthly profit of 45,000FCFA each. The profits will be partly reinvested in the business and partly used for the daily expenses of the family. Their ambition is to expand their field of activity to include the raising of sheep and goats.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophon S., age 34, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Phoung (pictured with his wife), age 36, have been married since 1996 and have one son and two daughters. They live approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophon has been selling fish for seven years. She buys fish from market near her house and transports them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Mr. Sophal Phoung assists his wife in the business.

Sophon is applying for a loan of $1,000 in order to build a concrete and brick room under her wooden house.

loans.use: To build a concrete and brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les  quatre membres du groupe Benkelema sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroître du jour en jour. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter,  8 sacs de petit mil pour la préparation de la bouillie à vendre, 3 sacs de savon  de 300 morceaux avec les fabricants de la place et beaucoup d’articles divers. Les marchandises sont achetées dans la ville de Fana. La vente de ces produits s’effectue aux domiciles des femmes et dans le marché de Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’élargir leur secteur d’activité en embrassant l’élevage des ovins et caprins.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkelema group are married women, who are on average 37 years of age and have three children. They live together with their husbands and children in traditional large families in the city of Fana, in the area of Banankabougou, Fana district, in the region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. They met through neighbors and relatives and have a business selling various items. These women work together with the microfinance insititution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to respond to the daily growing demand of their customers. This is their seventh group loan and all the previous ones have been fully repaid. With this loan they want to buy eight sacks of millet for the preparation of slurry to sell, three sacks of soap of 300 pieces each from the local manufacturers, as well as other different items. They buy their supplies in the city of Fana and they sell door to door as well as at the market place in Fana; their customers are men and women. They hope to achieve an average monthly revenue of 35000 FCFA each. They will invest part of the revenue in their business and use the rest for their families' daily expenses. Their ambition is to expand their field of activity to include the raising of sheep and goats.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Maria Tessie

texts.en:
Maria Tessie R. is from the village of Panta-on Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Maria Tessie is married and has one adult-aged children. To make a living, Maria Tessie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Maria Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Tessie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  cinq membres du groupe Dembagnouma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroître du jour en jour. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 30 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 50 sacs de charbon de bois, 2 sacs de sucre, 3 cartons de thé, 50 litres de lait et une grande quantité de cartes de crédit achetés à Bamako. Toutes les marchandises sont achetées à Bamako en gros. La vente de ces produits s’effectue aux domiciles des femmes et dans le marché de Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’élargir leur secteur d’activité en embrassant l’élevage des ovins et caprins.
texts.en:
The five members of the Dembagnouma group are married women of an average age of 44, and an average of 3 children. They live with their husband and children in large families in the town of Fana, in the Banankabougou district, which is in the sub-prefecture of Fana in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They met through family and community links. These women are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation in order to satisfy the demands of their ever-increasing customer base. They are now on their seventh loan and all previous loans have been successfully repaid. They intend to use this loan in order to buy 30 cartloads of firewood, 50 bags of coal, two bags of sugar, three packs of tea, 50 litres of milk and a large number of credit cards bought in Bamako. All the merchandise would be bought in bulk from Bamako . These goods are sold to women at home and in the Fana market to men and women. The women envisage generating an average monthly profit of 50 000 FCFA. These profits would be partly reinvested in the business and partly used to fund the family’s daily expenses. Their aim is eventually to broaden their area of work through raising sheep and goats.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various items

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les  sept membres du groupe Kotognontala sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues  à travers des liens de voisinage, de parentés et exercent le commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroître du jour en jour. Elles sont à leur septième  prêt  solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 5kg de petit mil pour la préparation de la bouillie, 2 sacs de 50kg de sucre, 10kg de beurre de karité et des tissus traditionnel pour dogon achetés au Bankass. La vente de ces produits s’effectue aux domiciles des femmes et dans le marché de Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
All seven members of the Kotognontala group are married women who are on average 36 years old and have 3 children. They live with their children and their large traditional families in the Banankabougou district in city of Fana, in Mali.

They know each other as neighbors and through family, and they all partake in sales of various types of merchandise.

The group is member of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution (Kiva Field Partner). Their goal is to be able to meet client demands that seem to increase more day after day. They are currently on their seventh loan, with all previous loans repaid as required.

This loan will be use to purchase 5kg of millet, 2 sacks of sugar, 10kg of shea butter, and traditional fabrics purchased in Bankass. The sale of these products is carried out in their home or in the market in Fana, to a client base made up of both women and men.

They forsee a monthly revenue of 40 000FCFA from their sales. The revenues will be in part reinvested in their business and will be used to cover the daily expenses of their family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various types of merchandise.

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun S., age 47, and her husband, Mr. Sas Hout, age 47, were married in 1987 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:

They were married in 1985 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. One son has full time employment and the other two children are in school.

Now, her husband continues to sell vegetables, while she has her own business selling groceries. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale in Korki market about five kilometers from her house. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase grocery items for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of rice, sugar, salt, vinegar, shampoo, and soap

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Mr. Robinson M. is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. He is 57 years old, married and blessed with 8 adult-aged children. He owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged on his business for more than 12 years and earns 4,000.00 monthly from the business. In 2009 Robinson joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the Co-op. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000.00 which will be used to purchase a motorcycle.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.\n\n*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a motor cycle

loans.name: Glean

texts.en:
Glean D. is from the village of Mitacas. He is 58 years old. Glean is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Glean owns & operates a rice production venture in the agriculture sector operating a specialized rice production activity. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the family comes primarily from the earnings of her rice crops. Glean has been engaged in this activity for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Glean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glean has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Glean is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Glean from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchse of fertilizers

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Mrs. Helen C. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married, and blessed with four adult children. She owns and operates a hog-raising business. Helen has been engaged in this business for more than three years and makes about $100 monthly.

In 2005, Helen joined PMPC, one of Kiva's field partners, to access their programs and services. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP which will be used for additional capital for her hog-raising business.

About PMPC (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative)

PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her hog raising

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala A. was born in 1976. She is married and has two children. Aliyev's family lives in the Fuzuli region. She has been in this business for two years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy necessary things for her cafe.

loans.use: to buy necessary things for her cafe.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Mohamad has owned a laundry for almost two years now, and he is well-known for his fine work. When he first started his business, he was successful because he was the only laundry in the neighborhood.

Mohamad decided to take up this occupation because it had been his family’s business. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a new dry cleaning machine for his shop. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

In the future, he plans to keep expanding his business by offering ironing services.

loans.use: To purchase a new dry cleaning machine for his shop.

loans.name: Douniah

texts.en:
Douniah is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Douniah has owned a grocery store since 1994. She sells canned food, beverages, candies, pasta and rice, oil, chewing gum, cakes and lots more.

Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Douniah is a very welcoming person, and each time a customer enters her store she likes talking to them and offers them something to drink.

She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase new merchandise for her store so that she can expand her stock. This is the first time that Douniah has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties. Douniah decided to open this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, but more importantly, she likes trading and likes her work. In the future, she plans to keep improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old and married with four children. Her youngest child is 29 years old. Her husband is a soldier and he also supports the family.

She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells cooking oil to make a living. She also has a machine that she uses to grind tomatoes and peppers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members.

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 36-year-old divorced woman who lives with her child in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Fadia has been working as a make-up artist since 1994. Her clients are her friends and neighbors.

She is a very dynamic and active person and she works very hard in order to make her living, but more importantly she likes her work. Sometimes, especially during festive seasons, she works late in order to be available for her clients.

She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase new makeup and to repair her car. Fadia doesn’t own her own shop and drives to her client’s homes. This is the first time that Fadia has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Fadia studied to be a beautician, so she already had experience when she first started her business, and she had no problems. In the future, she plans to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase new makeup and to repair her car.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 25-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He has owned a hairdressing salon for almost two years. He also sells beauty products and does makeup, tattoos and hair removal. Imad is valued for his work because he knows how to treat his customers, and because he offers a lot of services. His clients feel comfortable going to his salon, knowing that he is good at his job and is aware of the new hair style fashions.

When Imad first started his business, he had no problems because he already had faithful customers from his previous job. He decided to open this business because he learned the skills in an academy and wanted to have independent work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase beauty products and make some décor changes in his salon. This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and make some décor changes in his salon.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is 40 years old and married with four children. He sells building materials at retail prices to his customers. He is a focused, hard worker. He sells for long hours to enable him to meet the demands of his customers. His wife sells groceries to help make a living.

Dauda hopes to expand his business in the future. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Yassine

texts.en:
Yassine is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. Yassine has owned a barber shop since 1998. He decided to open this business because he learned the skills in an academy. He gained experience while working with his brother, so that he could open his own shop. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the necessary tools for his shop.

His clients are his family members, friends, neighbors and others. Yassine is exceptionA. because he does good work and offers quality hair products to his clients.

He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to change the décor of his shop. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, Yassine plans to improve his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 34-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Wissam owns a pickup truck that he has used for three years to transport construction materials or even furniture. He decided to start this business because he realized that he could improve his financial situation since this business allows him to increase his income.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to do some maintenance work on his truck. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His clients are people from his region and from the surrounding villages. In the future, he plans to keep expanding his business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his truck.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 30 year old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Abir has owned a hairdressing salon for six years already. Abir is special in her work because of her experience and because she keeps aware of hairstyle fashion. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Before opening her salon, she used to go to her clients house to do their hair; so, after making herself known in her neighborhood and having her own clients, she decided to open her salon. Her previous loans helped her purchase all the required tools and cover the expenses of her salon. She also offers beauty products; she does makeup, hair removal and more. Abir has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time.  Therefore, she requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for her salon. In the future, she plans to keep on attracting more clients in order to have a better income and keep on improving her work by offering the best to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 45 years old, and married with 4 children. Her eldest child is 23 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendly skills to attract more customers to her stall.  She is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She hopes to own a fashion home in the future.  She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 32 years old, and married with 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria.  She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She sells kerosene, water and juice at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more kerosene, water and juice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene, water and juice to sell.

loans.name: Joseph Maringi

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old and married to Jane; they have one son aged two years. Joseph has been operating a hotel business for the past five years. 

Joseph was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to purchase more stock and especially food stuffs for the hotel. He also plans to rent more space as his business has grown and he is not able to accommodate all his clients. With the extra profit he intends to purchase a piece of land.  

Joseph’s hopes and dreams are to expand his business and prepare a wider variety of food such as French fries, and even rent out more space for his clients. He describes himself as a hardworking business man and very focused.

loans.use: To purchase more food stock for his hotel.

loans.name: Julius Mwangi

texts.en:
Julius is 44 years old, married to Nancy they have two sons and two daughters aged 20, 17, 12 and 10 years old respectively.  Julius does transportation services with his pick-up. 

Julius was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to service his pick-up so that it does not delay his business. 

He intends to buy a bigger vehicle like a lorry for transport in future so that he can be able to transport more goods for his clients. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman.

loans.use: To service his pick-up which he uses for transport business.

loans.name: Taoheed

texts.en: Taoheed is 32 years old and married with 3 children. His youngest child is 3 years old. His children are still dependent on him and they attend school. He sells electronics at retail prices.  He is a hard working man. Taoheed is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Viginia

texts.en:
Viginia Wanja is 38 years old and married to Peter Gitau .They have two children; Owen and joy. Viginia sells movie and music CD’s and she started her business 10years ago.

Viginia was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. This is her first loan with Kadet and she has never borrowed from any other MFI before. She intends to increase her CD stock with the money and she also wants to bring in many varieties so that she can cater to her clients demand. Her business is doing well and she has many clients who are loyal.

Viginia describes herself as a hard working and determined lady whose hopes and desires are to expand her business and be a wholesale distributor for all kinds of CD’s.

loans.use: Add additional CD's and movies to her stock

loans.name: Esther Wamaitha

texts.en:
Esther is 36 years old and married to Samuel. They have two sons aged 14 years and 7 years respectively. Esther has been selling clothes and jewelry for the past two years. 

She was introduced to Kadet through an existing client who is her friend. Esther has applied for a loan which she plans to use to purchase more beauty products and ladies jewelry. She also intends to pay school fees for the son, who is in secondary school, with the extra profit she will generate from the business. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business, move to a more permanent premise and sell goods in wholesale. She describes herself as a hardworking business lady with a great vision for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: Saludeen

texts.en: Saludeen is 32 years old, married with 2 children. He is not a tailor but he sells tailoring materials at retail prices to his customers. He is a focused, hard worker. He is a LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) client.  LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Khasanov

texts.en: Khasanov D. lives in Baku city. He was born in 1989 and is single. He has worked as a mason for 2 years. He needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy materials to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve his business.

loans.name: Rasida

texts.en: Rasida is 42 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband sells tires to make a living. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs like elubo (yam or plantain flour). Elubo is made from dried yam or plantain. It is used in the preparation of amala, which is a local delicacy that is eaten with Nigerian soup. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old and is a widow with three children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Mary sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is a focused, hard worker. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Mary is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en: Kayode is 33 years old and married with 2 children. His children are still dependent on him and they attend school. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife sells shoes to help support the home. He is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. He is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Akeem

texts.en: Akeem is 35 years old and married with 2 children. His wife sells clothes to make a living. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria.  He sells building materials at retail prices to his customers. He is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa.  He is requesting for a loan amount of N120, 000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: El Alto Cenepa Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL EL ALTO CENEPA

Flora pertenece a la Alcancia Conumal EL ALTO CENEPA, ella es madre D. 3 pequeños hijos que aún dependen D. ella, sus inicios en su vida laboral fueron en una empresa D. costura, hasta que gracias a sus ahorros y al apoyo D. esposo y sus familiares pudo comprar una máquina D. costura entonces en su pequeña casa hizo un espacio donD. colocó un taller D. costura, ahora ya tiene 3 años con su negocio, tiempo en que gracias a el ha podido dar educación y alimentos a sus hijos, ella no piensa descansar hasta ver a sus hijos hechos unos profesionales, tambien espera y sueña tener su propia empresa D. costura.
texts.en:
El Alto Cenepa Communal Bank Flora belongs to the El Alto Cenepa communal bank. She is the mother of three small children who are still dependent on her. Her first experience in the labor force was with a clothing business. Then, thanks to her savings and the support of her husband and family, she was able to buy a sewing machine. In her small house, she maD. a space for a sewing workshop. Now, Flora has been in business for three years and has been able to proviD. food and education for her children. She will not rest until she sees her children become professionals. Also, she dreams of having her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Femi

texts.en: Femi is 35 years old and married with a child. He is a focused, hard worker. He sells machine parts to make a living. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa.  He is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more machine parts to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more machine parts to sell

loans.name: Oluwole

texts.en:
Oluwole is 42 years old and is married with three children, his youngest being 10 years old. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife sells groceries to make a living.

Oluwole sells generator parts at retail prices to his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more generator parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Oluwole is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more generator parts to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 31 years old and is married with two children, his youngest being 7 years old. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife sells groceries to make a living.

Ibrahim sells generators at retail prices to his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more generators to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Ibrahim is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more generators to sell

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke is 38 years old and is married with two children. Her husband sells engine oil to make a living.

Ronke sells nuts and bolts at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more nuts and bolts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Ronke is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more nuts and bolts to sell

loans.name: Shakirat

texts.en:
Shakirat is 28 years old and is married with two children. Her husband sells generators to make a living.

Shakirat lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells clothes and belts at retail prices to her customers and hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more clothes and belts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Shakirat is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and belts to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He is a LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He sells machine parts at retail prices to his customers. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more machine parts to sell. He hopes to expand his business. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more machine parts to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es:
Alcancia Comunal MUJERES EMPRESARIAS

Zulema pertenece a la Alcancia Comunal MUJERES EMPRESARIAS, llamada asi porque todas desean hacer crecer sus negocios hasta lograr su propia empresa.
Ella es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos a los cuales debe darles estudios, alimentos, y lo que necesiten, ya que ellos le dan fuerza y alegría, "cada día me llenan D. energía, todo lo hago por ellos, trato D. darle todo lo que puedo".
Con la idea D. comprar sus cosas, dar educación a sus hijos y entre otros gastos, inicio vendiendo tripitas D. pollo, luego caldos, combinados, ahora tienen un puesto D. comida donD. venD. menus y caldos.
Sueña con la idea D. sobresalir y crecer en su negocio, desea abrir un puesto D. salchipapa para la venta nocturna y asi tener mas ingresos y darle más a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mujeres Empresarias Communal Bank Zulema belongs to the Mujeres Empresarias [Enterprising Women] Communal Bank. They have this name because they all desire to grow their small businesses. Zulema is a single mother with five children for whom she provides food, education, and whatever else they need. In return, they give her strength and happiness. “Every day they fill me with energy. Everything I do is for them. I try to give them everything I can,” she says. With the idea of buying her necessities, educating her children, and other expenses, she started selling chicken tripe and later soups and combination plates. Now, she has a food stall where she sells set meals and soups. Zulema dreams of expanding her business. She would like to open a stand selling “salchipapas” [fried potatoes and hot dog] in the evenings. This would bring more income and allow her to give more to her children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Selling diesel has been very profitable for Ese. This is a business she has been conducting for the past three years. She buys her diesel in bulk and sells in retail. With the business she is able to assist her husband with household expenses. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. Ese is 37years old and married with a child who is just 6 years old. The child is still in primary school. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more diesel to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more diesel to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is thirty-five years old and has two children with his wife. Both of his kids attend school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in their community.

The majority of the people in the community are into trading activities and Michael is a trader, too. He deals in mobile phones and accessories. He buys his wares from the capital city and sells in a kiosk by the roadside in his community.

Michael has been trading for five years. He wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more phones and accessories

loans.name: Peter Mambo

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and is married to Margaret. They have two daughters and one son aged 13, 7 and 6 years respectively.

Peter, together with his wife, has been operating a general retail shop business for the past year. He also operates a motorcycle transport business as his other source of income.

Peter was introduced to KADET by a KADET credit officer through marketing outreach. Peter plans to add more stock, i.e. handkerchiefs, tomatoes, bread, etc., to his retail business with the amount he has applied for. He intends to save the profit generated from the business.

Peter’s future hopes are to start a large-scale poultry farm. He describes himself as an ambitious and hardworking businessman.

loans.use: To add stock to his retail business such as tomatoes, bread and handkerchiefs

loans.name: Victoria Ridina

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Victoria es soltera, tiene 59 años y 6 hijos, Victoria vende comida típica en su casa ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos con la ayuda de su hija.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, papa, carne.
Los sueños de Victoria son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, aumentar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. She is 59, single, and has six children. Victoria sells typical foods in her house, which is in the center of the city. She does this on Saturdays and Sundays with help from her daughter. Victoria needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy corn, potatoes, and meat. Victoria’s dreams are to educate her children so that they become professionals and to increase and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, potatoes, and meat

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 40 years old and married to a commercial driver. She is the mother of seven children and they are doing well in School.

Ruth has a business selling foodstuffs. She is happy with her business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. With the business she has been assisting her family in making a living.

Ruth needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs. It will help her in contributing to the family income and will also improve her business. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Noemí es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Noemí tiene un puesto en el Mercado Grau, donde vende lencería, además Noemí vende diversos productos dependiendo de las campañas, como juguetes, útiles, etc.
Noemí necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares y medias.
Los sueños de Noemí son salir adelante, incrementar su mercadería y que sus hijos sean buenas personas.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. She is 30, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She has a stand in the Grau Market where she sells dry goods. Noemí also sells diverse products, depending on the season, like toys and supplies, etc. Noemí needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy school supplies and socks. Noemí’s dreams are to get ahead, increase her merchandise, and to see her children become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies and socks

loans.name: Eudelia Mercedes

texts.es:
Eudelia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Eudelia es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Eudelia tiene un puesto en el Mercado "12 de abril", donde vende choclo (maiz sancochado), y en las épocas en donde no hay maíz vende papa y huevo sancochado.
Eudelia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas.
Los sueños de Eudelia son seguir trabajando, aumentar su mercadería y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eudelia is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. Eudelia is 45, married, and has three children. Eudelia has a stand at the 12 de Abril Market, where she sells “choclo” (parboiled corn). During the times that there is no corn she sells potatoes and parboiled eggs. Eudelia needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy gas. Eudelia’s dreams are to keep working, to increase her merchandise, and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas

loans.name: Julia Benedicta

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Julia es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Julia tiene un puesto en el Mercado "Grau", donde vende calzados, mochilas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su hijo.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una asociación de taxis y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. She is 33, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Julia has a stand at the Grau Market where she sells footwear and backpacks. She does this everyday with occasional help of her son. Julia needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy shoes. Julia’s dreams are to have a taxi association and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Maria es viuda, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Maria se dedica a la siembra de verduras en sus tierras, además compra verduras de los productores y los comercializa en su puesto del mercado de abastos, además tiene una tienda en su casa, negocio que esta a cargo de su hija.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapallo, tomate, ajo.
Los sueños de Maria son implementar un restaurante para su hija y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. Maria is a 49 year old widow, and she has two children. Maria plants vegetables on her land. She also buys vegetables from growers and sells them at her stand in the Abastos Market. She also has a store in her house, which her daughter runs. Maria needs a loan for 2,100 PEN to buy zucchini, tomatoes, and garlic. Maria’s dreams are to set up a restaurant for her daughter and to buy a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zucchini, tomatoes, and garlic

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Diana es conviviente, tiene 19 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Diana vende cosméticos por catálogos, también vende ropa a pedido, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, Diana por las tardes estudia contabilidad en la Universidad.
Diana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos y ropas interiores.
Los sueños de Diana son tener una tienda de ropa y culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank.

She is 19 years old, in a stable relationship, and expecting her first child. Diana sells cosmetics from a catalog. She also sells, upon request, clothing items which she offers her friends and family members. Afternoons, she studies accounting at the University.

Diana needs a loan of 600 New Sols to invest in purchasing polo shirts and underwear. Diana's dreams are to have a clothing store and to complete her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY POLO SHIRTS AND UNDERWEAR TO SELL

loans.name: Mahanaim Group

texts.es:
Beatriz  O. C. tiene 42 años de edad (en la foto tiene sueter cafe), ella vive la comunidad de san Miguel Xico 2da sección de valle de Chalco Solidaridad, Estado de México es acreditado activa de la Ude  Mahanaim.
La señora Beatriz se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas desde hace seis años, tenia la inquietud de emprender un negoció, por lo que una amiga le ofreció a enseñarle a elaborar piñatas, y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la escuela de sus tres hijos  y  con los ingresos de su esposo que  se dedica  a la albañilería  solo cubre los gastos de alimentación, fue de ahí, que le pareció la idea e improviso herramientas que le fueran útil para la elaboración de piñatas porque sus pedidos cada vez son mas grandes por esa razón se unio con otras personas que tenian las mismas necesidades  y formaron un grupo y solicitar un crédito a travez de fundación realidad porque su negocio a prosperado y todo el al año se tiene que dedicar, para que en temporada pueda surtir todos sus pedidos a tiempo y entregarlos  en mercados de su localidad, logrando esto con la ayuda de su familia y pretendiendo crecer el negocio  y contar con su propio medio de transporte el cual tendría mayores ganancias que le permitirían tener una fuente de empleo para otra persona.

Los miembros de grupo son:

Víctor Fidel R. C.                           Taxi
Beatriz O. C.                                   Manualidades ( elaboración de piñatas)
Raquel C. Álvarez                                Agua de garrafón
Leticia  García C.                                  Venta de catalogo ( cosméticos)
Aquilina Z. Hernández                            Venta de catalogo ( cosméticos)
Lidia Janette López López                             Venta de ropa ( interior)
Paula López López                                     Dulcería
Olivia García C.                                    Albañilería
Alejandra Sánchez O.                              Venta de catalogo ( cosméticos y joyería)
Guadalupe María Guzmán C.                         peletería
Zeferina Hernández Hernández                          Florería
Rosa María B. Juárez                          Manualidades  ( elaboración de piñatas
María Magdalena Juárez L.                           Carnicería
Sara Z. Hernández                                Florería
texts.en:
Beatriz O. C. is 42 years old (she's wearing a brown sweatshirt in the photo). She lives in the community of San Miguel Xico, in the second section of the Chalco Solidaridad valley in the Ude Mahanaim State of Mexico.

Beatriz has been working making piñatas for six years. As her husband's salary from brick laing only covered their food costs, Beatriz was anxious to learn a trade in order to help him out with their kids' school fees; so a friend of hers offered to teach her how to make piñatas. From there she thought it was a good idea, and so improvised some tools to help her make the piñatas. As her orders grew larger she decided to get together with other people who had the same needs as her to form a group that would ask for credit through the Realidad Foundations. Her business has prospered & throughout the year she works very hard so that when the high season arrives she has enough stock to offer in local markets. She has achieved all this with the help of her family. She wants her business to grow & to get her own mode of transport which would help to increase her earnings & allow her to be a source of employment for someone else. The members of the group are: Víctor Fidel R. C. Taxi driver Beatriz O. C. Crafts (making piñatas) Raquel C. Álvarez Water cooler bottles Leticia García C. Sales from a catalogue (cosmetics) Aquilina Z. Hernández Sales from a catalogue (cosmetics) Lidia Janette López López Selling clothes (underwear) Paula López López Sweet shop Olivia García C. Brick layer Alejandra Sánchez O. Sales from a catalogue (cosmetics & jewellery) Guadalupe María Guzmán C. Fur trade Zeferina Hernández Hernández Florest Rosa María B. Juárez Crafts (making piñatas) María Magdalena Juárez L. Butcher Sara Z. Hernández Florest

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make piñatas, as well as to buy products from catalogues/Compra de Material para la elaboracion de piñatas así como productos de catalogo

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Gina Del Rocio

texts.es:
Gina C. de 30 años de edad, su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene agua y luz como servicio básicos, no esta casada pero tiene 4 hijos uno de 3 años, 7 años, 8 años y de 9 años estudian en una escuela fiscal. 

Gina comenzó hace ya unos años atrás cuando algunos conocidos de ella trabajaban elaborando figuras para fiestas con fomix, espuma y pirograbadores ella así poco a poco aprendió este oficio y pudo comenzar con su negocio de fabricación de figuras para fiestas, ella trabaja desde las 08h30 hasta las 12h30.

Gina con el préstamo quiere comprar fomix, pirograbador para poder adecuar mas el negocio haciendo más manualidades, en el futuro quiere agrandar mas el negocio para poderles dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gina C. is 30 years old and she lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has water & a basic electricity service. She is not married but had 4 kids who are three, seven, eight & nine years old and go to state school.

A few years ago some of Gina's friends were working making figurines for parties using shaped moulds, foam & etching machines. Bit by bit she started to learn this trade & was able to start her business making these figurines for parties. She works from 8.30am - 12.30pm.

With the loan Gina wants to buy moulds and an etching machine so she can stock her business better & make more handcrafts. In the future she would like to enlarge her business to give her kids a better future.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Moulds, paint & an etching machine/FOMIX, PINTURAS, PIROGRABADOR

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity sells kerosene. She buys her kerosene from other petrol (gasoline) stations and comes home to sell retail. She has been doing the business for the past eighteen years. This one business has been her source of finance.

Charity lives in Delta State. She is 35 years old and has six children, all in school. She wants her children to have a good education in the future.

Charity needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. It will help to boost her business and income. She says thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is thirty-nine years old. He is a married man and has three children who are all in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community.

Patrick is a hardworking young man. He trades in all types and sizes of wood. He says he buys from sawmills in surrounding communities and supplies to retailers. He also treks to supply.

Patrick has been in business for fifteen years and desires to buy wood in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. Hence the need for the loan.

loans.use: To buy wood in bulk

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is excited to take her first loan with Kiva. She sells hair extensions and has been in the business for more than four years.

With the income, Bridget has been able to help sustain her family and also improve her business. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Bridget wants the standard of her business to improve. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is forty-five. He is married and has five children who are all attending school. Together with his family, he lives in a rented apartment in their community where the major occupation is trading.

Peter is a trader. He runs a provision store. He has his store by the roadside in his community. He procures his goods from Accra. Peter has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi is fifty-two years old. He is a married man and has six children, all of whom are in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Idi is a hard working man. He trades in all types and sizes of wood. He buys sawn wood from sawmills in surrounding communities and supplies it to retailers and other communities. Idi has been in business for ten years and requests the loan in order to buy wood in bulk to be able to supply more customers.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a forty-two year old married woman.  She has four children, all of whom are in school. Elizabeth lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She is a merchant, selling cereals (maize). Elizabeth procures bags of maize from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell cereal. Elizabeth has been in business for two years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Ohene Ba Group

texts.en: Mary is a thirty-six year old married mother of four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Mary is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice porridge. Mary is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ohene ba’, literally meaning "prince/princess". The members of the group are mainly merchants. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Mary, the group leader, is seated.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and perfume

loans.name: Anthanasios

texts.en: After arriving in the United States thirty years ago from the western coast of Greece, Athanasios quickly applied his entrepreneurial spirit to start his own hotdog food cart. For the past twenty-six years, Athanasios has built a regular clientele of diverse Manhattan clients. He says that people appreciate his clean and friendly service. Athanasios is a longtime ACCION USA client who has always paid on time. He chooses to borrow from ACCION USA because of the trusting relationship that he has built over the years. With his current loan he will be purchasing food inventory that includes hotdogs, sausages, and buns. Athanasios says that his business is very dependent upon the weather. Since his business is based outdoors, he is busiest in the summer months but he operates year-round in almost all types of weather. Watch a short interview with Athanasios from ACCION USA on Vimeo here. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy hotdogs, sausages, buns and other food inventory

loans.name: St. Mary's Group

texts.en: Comfort is a forty-nine year old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Comfort is a food vendor. She sells pastries, preparing them and supplying them to other retailers. Comfort is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Mary’s. The members of the group are mainly merchants. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Comfort, the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia es casada tiene tres hijos, es oriunda de Chone al norte de Manabí y vive en Montecristi una bella localidad rodeada de mucha artesanía, se radicó hace cuatro años y  actualmente viven en casa de sus suegros pero espera poder llegar a tener su propia vivienda ese es uno de los sueños. 

Nuestra socia esta muy contenta trabajando con la Fundación pues gracias  los prestamos ha podido superarse en el aspecto personal y laboral y aspira seguir haciéndolo para el bienestar de su familia.
Ella vende en el bar de una escuela a la hora de recreo de 21H00 a 21H30  de lunes a viernes, además se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa, con los préstamo obtenidos de la Fundación ha logrado incrementar sus negocios por lo que ya tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes principalmente de Montecristi y Manta,  la mayoría de ellos son sus familiares y vecinos; nuestra socia viaja cada dos meses a Guayaquil para adquirir la mercaderia directamente de los distribuidores y obtener un poco mas de ganancia, una vez que entrega los pedidos espera reunir el dinero y seguir comprando para satisfacer los pedidos de su selecta clientela.

Ahora invertirá todo el crédito en sus dos negocios, comprará pan, papas, confitería, colas y más para abastecer su bar y además adquirirá  pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa interior de mujer para su negocio de ropa.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is married and has 3 children. She is a native of Chone, to the north of Manabí, and currently lives in Montechristi, a beautiful area where many handicrafts are produced. She settled there 4 years ago, and now lives in the home of her in-laws, but she hopes to eventually have her own house; this is one of her dreams. She is very pleased to work with the Foundation; thanks to the loans she has taken she has been able to improve herself both personally and in her work. She hopes to continue working for the welfare of her family. She sells at a snack bar during school recess from 12 to 12:30 from Mondays to Fridays. In addition, she sells clothing in the streets. With the loan she obtained through the Foundation she has managed to increase her business. Now she has various orders from her customers, principally from Montechristi and Manta; the majority of them are her relatives and neighbors. She travels every 2 months to Guayaquil to acquire merchandise directly from the distributors to increase her earnings. Once she collects the orders she hopes to gather the money and continue buying to satisfy the orders of her select clientele. Now she will invest the loan in her 2 businesses; she will buy bread, potatoes, candy, and soft drinks to supply her snack bar, and in addition she will acquire pants, shirts, blouses and women's underwear for her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bread, potatoes, candy, and soft drinks, pants, shirts, blouses and women's underwear

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a forty-nine year old married mother of seven children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Sophia works to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a merchant, selling fried fish. She fries the fish and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Sophia procures fresh fish from nearby fishing communities. She has been in business for thirty years and wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is thirty-nine. She is married and has two children who are both attending school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community where the major occupation is trading.

Georgina is a trader: she runs a provision store. She has her store by the roadside in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a fifty-four-year-old married mother of eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Ama is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves). She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell and also sells by the roadside in her community. She procures her ingredients from nearby communities.

Ama has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
El señor Joaquín T. tiene ya más de siete años dedicándose a la venta de artículos de piel. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y desea vendré juguetes y ropa por la temporada navideña, ya que es muy buena inversión por que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga estos productos a la venta.  
Con las ganancias de la inversión planea pagar el crédito ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá su esposa con el ingreso de otro local que tiene ella.
texts.en:
Joaquín T. has had a business selling items made of leather for more than 7 years. His business needs a greater variety of merchandise. He would like to sell toys and clothing for the Christmas season, since this makes a very good investment as his customers are requesting that he have these items for sale. With the earnings from the investment, he plans to pay off the loan as his household expenses will be covered by his wife with income that she earns in another place.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the business: to buy toys and clothing

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 44 years old and is a wife and the mother of four kids. Two of her children are in school while the others are learning a trade. She lives together with her family in a community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Theresa is a very hardworking woman who supports her husband in taking care of the children.

Theresa enjoys selling goods in the business where she makes a living. She has been selling foodstuffs like tubers of yam, cassava, vegetables and plantains for ten years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of goods from the farmers, which saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price.

Theresa wants to use the loan to buy yam, cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc., in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and would be grateful for your assistance.

In this year, 2010, Theresa has set a goal of increasing her savings for future eventualities.

loans.use: To buy yam, cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en: Hagar is a 55-year-old widowed and committed mother of ten children. Her husband died after a prolonged sickness, making life very difficult for Hagar in taking care of her children. Among the ten children only two are in school. Hagar is a merchant. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidotes to minimizing poverty and is very serious regarding her business. She sells foodstuffs such as plantain and cassava. She started this business eighteen years ago to help take care of the children. She wants to use this loan to buy a larger supply of plantains and cassava to serve her customers throughout the season and to take stock directly from the farmers rather the intermediaries who sell to her at a higher price. Hagar believes and hopes that 2010 is a year of growth as she wants to increase her output, hence her family's well-being.  She would be glad for the loan assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of plantain and cassava

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is forty-three years old. He is a married man and has three children who are all in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community.

Paul is a hardworking man dealing in all types of motor spare-parts. He sells the spare-parts in a shop very close to fitting mechanics by the roadside in his community.

Paul has been in business for five years and desires to procure motor spare-parts in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy motor spare-parts in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace declared openly and joyfully that she foresees 2010 as a year of God’s abundance and blessing. Grace is 50 years old, is married, and has two children. Her firstborn is currently independent while her last-born is in school.

Grace owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood selling items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits (cookies), etc. Grace has twenty-two years experience in retailing and has good customer care.

It has been Grace’s dream to make an expansion by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. She wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc., to increase her inventory.

Grace hopes to improve her savings to support herself in her old age. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is the thirty-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community.

Grace works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader, running a cold-store in which she sells fresh fish. She procures the fresh fish from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community.

Grace has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Sawura

texts.en:
Sawura is a 30-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. Three of her children are in school while her last-born is breastfeeding.

Sawura operates a local food restaurant and has been in business for fifteen years now. She serves different kinds of local dishes such as banku, waakye and tuozafi. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot soup, waakye is prepared from local rice with beans, and tuozafi is prepared from milled cassava and maize and is taken with okra like soup. She has two assistants that assist in serving her customers with food and she pays them by the close of the work.

Sawura has many customers since her food is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, cassava, rice, beans, cowhide, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

Sawura hopes to raise increased income to support her business and to include the sale of cereals in bags to her customers and to support her children’s education. She always saves parts of her profit for unforeseen occurrences. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Power And Might Group

texts.en: Lydia is a thirty-six year old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Lydia is a merchant who sells jewels. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Power and Might. The members of the group are mainly merchants. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Lydia, the group leader, is on the right in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married mother of three children. Her husband has been supportive but his business has slowed down, pushing most burdens on her. Esther is a 44-year-old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty. She is very serious about her business. She trades in food items, such as plantain. Plantains can be used for fufu (thick porridge) and a local food called “ampesie”(plantain stew), served with sauce. She started her business twenty-five years ago, to bring in more income to take care of her children. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season. She hopes to use the loan to take direct stock from the farmers, rather than the intermediaries who sell to her at a higher price. She would be glad for the loan assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of plantain and cassava.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is a twenty-six year old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Gifty works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Gifty sells door-to-door and by the roadside in her community. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. Gifty has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Francesca

texts.en: Francesca is a 31-year-old married woman with two children who are currently in school. She lives with her family at Effiduase in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a food vendor, serving food such as rice and stew. She says demand for her food is high but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She has been in food production for eight years now. She works all day but still she can’t do more to increase her output. She wants to use this loan to buy meat and bags of rice to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband in providing for her family and their education. She also wants to roof her tent to make her place of business more conducive for her customers.

loans.use: To buy more rice, vegetables, meat, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is fifty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has six children. All of her children are in school. Abena lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She is a trader. She trades in cereals (maize).
