Abena purchases bags of maize from nearby communities and supplies the product to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to supply. Abena has been in business for six years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is 54 years old. She is a married mother of six kids. One of her children is in school while the rest are learning a trade. She lives, together with her family, in a community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Agatha is a very hard working woman who supports her husband in taking care of their children. She enjoys selling goods in a business where she makes her living. She has been selling food items, like tubers of yam, cassava, vegetables and plantains, for five years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of goods from the farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of cassava, plantain and vegetables, etc. to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of yam, cassava, plantain and vegetables etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is 37years old. She is married and mother of three children, who are in schooling. She is determined to provide for her children through hard work and commitment. To support her children, she has been selling cosmetics products like spray, powder, body cream, blouses, lip stick, etc. for two years now. She sells through hawking. She sells these cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi, which is a nearby city. She says selling  cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory. This, she believes, will enable her to a make good income to sponsor her children's education and business progress. She is so sure that your loan support will bring her the desired results, she expects and hopes to repay back within a stipulated time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata G. est couturière depuis 1980.Elle a 49 ans, elle habite dans la cite Apecsy a Yoff. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse d’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis juin 2000.Elle est marie et mère de 4 enfants  dont l’âge varie entre 19 et 28 ans. Elle a aussi 4 personnes à sa charge. En même temps Madame G. s’adonne au commerce d’habits confectionnes.
Elle a héritai l’activiste de couturière de ses parents, sa maman était une grande couturière et c’était presque un don chez elles. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est la satisfaction des clients de par son esprit créatif. C’est une grande styliste.  Elle a déjà rembourse 2 crédits dans l’institution. Maintenant elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des tissus bazin, voile et aussi des garnitures pour la confection d’autres habits a vendre. Ainsi elle pourra renouveler son exposition. Les bénéfices réalises lui  permettent de maintenir et d’augmenter sa participation dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata G. has been a seamstress since 1980. She's 49 years old, and lives in Apecsy city in Yoff. She's been a member of the U-IMCEC savings group since June 2000. She's married and the mother of four children, age 19 to 28. She also has four persons to support. At the same time, Mrs. G. also sells clothing. She inherited this activity from her parents, her mother was a great seamstress and it's almost a gift to them. What she finds most interesting in her business is satisfying her clients through her creative mind. She's a great stylist.

She already repaid two loans from U-IMCEC and she's now seeking a loan to buy Bazin and veil fabrics, as well as accessories for other clothing she sells. This will enable her to renew her display. The profits enable her to maintain and increase her participation to the daily expenses.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the support of lenders, succeeds in supporting populations in revenue-generating activities, which promotes valuable socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Bazin and veil fabrics, and clothing accessories

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is fifty years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children. All of her children are in school. Akua lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies her product to retailers and beverage sellers. She purchases bags of flour from nearby communities. Akua has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a 55 year old woman. She is widowed and has seven children. Two of her children are still in school and the rest are now adults. Naomi is an achiever and a resourceful mother to the home. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. She trades in food items, like plantains and cassava, in the community market square where she lives. She treks to surrounding villages in the community to purchase bulk stock of cassava and plantains from the farmers and retails these products to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.  With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supply of cassava and plantains to enable her to scale up her business growth. She has been in business for the last twenty three (23) years. With her business experience, she hopes to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supply of cassava and plantains.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 28 years old. He is married and father of one child. Micky, as he is popularly called by his peers, is an achiever. He is a creative and hard working, talented young man who does not play with his work. He is a cobbler and slippers manufacturer. He manufactures slippers for both sexes and treks them through his apprentices. He has won the hearts of many through his work and commitment towards the community. He started this business as a cobbler and he was sewing torn flip-flops and polishing shoes. Now, he says, through hard work and the favor of God he manufactures Ghana-made slippers and sells them across Ghana. He has been in business for six years now, with three apprentices who are learning skills for their future dependency. His major problem has to do with funds to buy raw materials in bulk. He says that the price increase of materials, due to the dollar difference to the Ghana cedi has made business difficult. He therefore requests for the loan assistance to buy raw materials like leather, glue, nails and thread, etc. This will enable him to meet targets set by his customers. He would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy tools and working materials like leathers, glue, nails and thread etc.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is twenty-nine years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Although she has no children herself, Dorcas caters for two nieces who are in school. She is a hair dresser by profession. She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. She has two apprentices under training. Dorcas has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy artificial hair, pomade, and other working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair.

loans.name: Real Atahuallpa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “REAL ATAHUALLPA y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. El banco comunal empezó un nuevo ciclo y tenían que cambiar la junta directiva. En el video se muestra la juramentación D. la nueva junta directiva donD. la asesora Carmen hace juramentar al presidente, a la secretaria, tesorera y al fiscal. Ahora el nuevo presidente del banco comunal es el socio Esteban.       

Nuestras socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta D. comida, productos D. belleza, verduras, frutas, comestibles. El socio Patricio es chofer en la empresa “Illary Qosqo”. El socio Santos trabaja para un restaurante turístico donD. su especialidad es la elaboración D. pizza. El socio Estaban se dedica a la compra y venta D. terrenos. 

La socia Mónica tiene 33 años y se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus dos hijos. La socia saca adelante a su familia pues no cuenta con el apoyo D. su pareja, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en especial el “Ceviche” (Ceviche D. pescado es el tipo más común D. ceviche que consiste en cortar trozos D. pescado en forma D. cuadrado mezclarlos con limón y sal.). Ya son tres años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. La socia Mónica requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como pescado y limón.      

Los socios requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos como frutas, verduras, productos D. belleza y comestibles, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(El socio Patricio pidió permiso a la junta directiva por motivos D. salud y no aparece en el video)
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “Real Atahuallpa” comunal bank and they live in the city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. The communal bank began a new cycle and they had to change the leadership group. The video shows the swearing in of the new executive board, where the advisor, Carmen, is swearing in the president, the secretary, the treasurer, and the finance officer. The new president of the communal bank is Esteban. Our members alternate their diverse household activities with selling food, beauty products, vegetables, fruits, and groceries. Patricio is a driver for a business called “Illary Qosqo.” Santos works for a tourist restaurant where his specialty is making pizza. Esteban buys and sells pieces of land. Mónica is 33 years old and she gets up very early to take care of her two children. She earns the living for her family because she doesn’t have the support of her partner. She sells food, specifically ceviche. (Fish ceviche is the most common type of ceviche and it consists of square pieces of fish in lemon juice and salt.) Monica needs this loan to buy more ingredients, like fish and lemons. The members need the loan to purchase more products such as fruit, vegetables, beauty products, and groceries. In this way they can increase their working capital and have improved incomes and give their children a better quality of life. The members value and appreciate the loan granted through this program and so they are committed to making their repayments in the established time frame. (One of the members, Patricio, requested permission from the executive board to be absent for health reasons and he doesn’t appear in the video.)

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products such as fruit, vegetables, beauty products, and groceries

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is forty-six years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She is a food vendor. Hawa trades in plantain chips. She fries the plantain and supplies them to retailers. She says her children also sell by hawking in the community. She purchases plantain from nearby communities. Hawa has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy plantain and other ingredients, in bulk, to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plantain.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a forty-year-old, widowed, mother of three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. Margaret works very hard to be able to provide for her family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called ‘banku’. It is served hot, with soup. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. Margaret procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to purchase maize, in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is thirty-six years old. She is a married mother of six children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. Adwoa works hard to help her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. She trades in second hand clothes. Adwoa sells by hawking in her community. She also treks to nearby towns to sell, especially on their market days. She purchases bales of textiles from nearby towns. Adwoa has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Placida, elabora mantas, polleras y centros para polleras, trabaja a pedido.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en villa concepción de la zona de Bolognia de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, Forro, Hilos y otros).
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito ya que se gano la confianza financiera.
texts.en:
Placida makes shawls,”polleras” (a traditional long skirt worn by women in some regions of Bolivia), and pollera underskirts. She works by order. Her home is located in the Villa Concepción area of Bolognia in the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy raw material (fabric, lining, thread, and others). This is the fourth time she has asked for a loan with Impro. Her history qualifies her as client 1, which means good completion of her payments. This allows her to access this loan because she has won the confidence of the financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía R. y su esposa el señor Alfredo H. son padres de tres pequeños hijos a quines les quieren dar lo mejor. 
Actualmente están vivienda en una casa que le prestaron, pero les acaban de informar que tiene que desocupar la vivienda, pero ellos desea mejor tener su propia patrimonio. Es por eso que están aplicando para adquirir una vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero les está haciendo falta una diferencia para que le puedan entregar a tiempo.
Es por eso que solicitan el préstamo y así pagar la diferencia y les puedan entregar su vivienda, para que sus tres niños puedan recibir el mejor regalo esta navidad que es su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosalía Rodríguez and her husband, Alfredo H., are the parents of three small children. They love their children and want to give them the best. They are currently living in a house that was lent to them. But, they were just informed that they need to vacate the house. They wish to have their own home. That is why they are applying to get their own home through a government loan. However, they are lacking the difference to be able to get it on time. That is why they are asking for the loan to pay the difference and be able to get their home. They want this so that they three children can receive the best present this Christmas, which is their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the difference for their home through a loan from Infonavit

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José  tiene una movilidad tipo vagoneta que trabaja como trufi en la ciudad de La Paz en la zona sur el trufi le ayuda para poder tener ingresos  y solventar las gastos familiares.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pedregal de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la reparación completa del vehiculo
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito ya que se gano la confianza financiera.
texts.en:
José has a station wagon, which he uses as a taxi with a fixed route in the southern area of the city of La Paz. The station wagon helps him be able to have an income and pay the family expenses. His home is located in the Pedregal area in the city of La Paz. The loan is to do complete repairs on his vehicle. It is the third time that he has asked for a loan with Impro. His history classifies him as client 1, which means good completion of his payments. This permits him to access this loan because he has gained the confidence of the financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs on his vehicle

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel, es carpintero y elabora muebles de todo tipo como también arreglos en general, trabaja en una carpintería como empleado asalariado
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicados en la zona de Villa El carmen de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra Herramientas para realizar arreglos y trabajos independientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a carpenter. He makes all types of furniture, and he also does general repairs. He works in a carpentry shop as a salaried employee. His home is located in the Villa El Carmen area in the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy tools to make repairs and to do independent work to improve his income. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carmen Gabriela

texts.es:
Carmen, es empleada y trabaja en un punto de llamadas, para solventar los gastos de alimentación y estudios ya que es soltera e independiente.
Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Sopocachi bajo de la ciudad de La Paz,  vive en la casa de sus abuelos.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora para reducir sus gastos de estudios ya que la mayor parte de sus trabajos en su instituto es a computadora porque esta estudiando auxiliar en contabilidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro
texts.en:
Carmen is an employee, and she works for a phone center in order to pay her food and educational expenses. She is single and independent. Her home is located in the Sopocachi area below the city of La Paz. She lives in her grandparents’ house. The loan is to buy a computer to reduce her educational costs. The major part of her work in her institution is on a computer because she is studying to be an accounting assistant. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro trabajo como carpintero donde elabora muebles y todo arreglo en general, en madera como ser: puertas, ventanas, roperos, vitrinas, estantes y otros.
Su domicilio se encuentran ubicados en la zona de obrajes de la ciudad de la Paz vive en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de madera, venesta y cola)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Alejandro works as a carpenter. He makes wood furniture and does general repairs like doors, windows, dressers, cabinets, shelves, and others. His home is in the Obrajes area of the city of La Paz. He lives in his parents’ house. The loan is for working capital to buy wood, plywood, and glue. It is the first time that he has asked for a loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood, plywood, and glue

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta, realiza mantas D. vicuña y alpaca y su esposo es arenero.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. callapa D. la ciudad D. La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital D. trabajo (Compra D. lana D. alpaca y lana D. vicuña)
Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago D. sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Modesta makes blankets out of vicuña (an animal similar to a llama) and alpaca wool, and her husband is a sand merchant. Her home is located in the Callapa area of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used as working capital (to buy alpaca and vicuña wool.) This is the 7th time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO, her history qualifies her as a "client 1," which is to say that she has maD. her payments well and for this reason she will be permitted to take out this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy wool

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina, se dedica a la venta D. comida es V. y la única que solventa los gastos D. alimentación, ropa y estudios D. su hija. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. Achumani D. la urbanización concepción D. la ciudad D. La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra insumos (papa, arroz, fideo, aceite).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Sabina sells meals. She is a widow and must cover her own expenses for food, clothing and the education of her daughter. Her home is located in the Concepción housing development in the Achumani area of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used to buy supplies (potatoes, rice, noodles and cooking oil.) This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital (to purchase potatoes, rice, noodles and cooking oil)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita trabaja con nosotros desde año 2001 y fue progresando poco a poco con la ayuda de nuestros creditos, la Sra. Margarita vive con el esposo y con su hija mayor quien es madre soltera y a la que ayuda con los gastos de su hijo ya que la hija se separo del esposo, tambien podemos indicar que la cliente es bastante trabajadora y responsable pese a la avanzada edad de 62 años y aun se la ve con bastante dinamismo y un buen semblante, por todo lo mencionado se escogio a la cliente para el credito kiva.
texts.en:
Margarita has worked with us since 2001 and she has progressed little by little with the help of our loans. Margarita lives with her husband and older daughter, who is a single mother. She helps her with her son's expenses since her daughter is separated from her husband. We can also say that the client is very hardworking and responsible. Despite being 62 years old, her dynamism and good outlook are evident. Because of all of this, this client was chosen for the Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, tiene un puesto donde vende refrescos, dulces y sándwich de pollo, carnes frías, y carne.
Vive en la zona de Achumani de la urbanización concepción en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado la compra de mercadería ( carne, aceite, verduras y refrescos).
Es primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Graciela has a location where she sells soft drinks, sweets, chicken sandwiches, cold meats, and meat. She lives in her parents house in the Achumani zone of the Concepción urban area.

The loan will be used for the purchase of supplies (meat, oil, vegetables, and soft drinks). This is the first time that Graciela has applied for a loan from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “El Progreso” (The Progress) is comprised of fifteen male and female members dedicated to their respective small businesses. The members sell items such as used clothing, cosmetics, lingerie, perfumes, toys, and hair accessories.

The members of “El Progreso” are from Linares, a city in the Maule region of central Chile. Linares is a city of vibrant commercial activity and has developed as an important center of exports, particularly because of their wine production. Nevertheless, the region is one of the poorest in Chile.

This loan will be invested in merchandise by the “El Progreso” group, in order to increase their supplies and earnings.

Marcela, a representative of the group, is pictured in the front row in a black athletic suit with a fuchsia colored T-shirt. She sells underwear and socks for men, and like the other members of the group, she sells them from a stall on one of the main streets in the city of Linares. These stalls are free to use, as they have been constructed by the government for the use of small business owners.

Marcela’s dream is to achieve economic stability for her family and to continue funding her children’s education, while also caring for her two-year-old nephew.

For Marcela, Fondo Esperanza has been the motivating force behind her business’s growth because, before the loans, Marcela never had the funding to grow her business. Also, Marcela believes she has benefitted greatly from the training courses that are taught at their weekly communal bank meetings.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, trabaja en la Policía Nacional desempeñando el cargo de policía en seguridad Ciudadana.
Su domicilio se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz vive en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para educación (pago de un curso de actualización para policías). Con este curso la señora tendrá la posibilidad de mejorar sus ingresos ya que le ascenderán de cargo.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martha works for the National Police, fulfilling the obligations of the police in city security. Her home is located in the Tembladerani district of the city of La Paz. She lives in the house of her parents. The loan will be used for education, to pay for a continuing education course for police officers. With this course, she will have the possibility of improving her income, since she will rise to a higher position. This is the fourth time that she has asked for a loan from IMPRO. Her record qualifies her as a good client in the payment of her debts.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Celia Lidia

texts.es: La señora Celia es una cliente nueva que llego a la institucion por recomendación de su hermana Rosmery, la señora vive en codavisa y es vecina de su hermana Rosmery, ella se dedica a la venta al por mayor de varios articulos que trae del desaguadero, entre estos se destacan poleras, juegos de cama, juegos de olla, tunta y ajies del Peru. La señora y su esposo don Simon son una pareja muy trabajadora que viven bien y tenian planeado comprar un auto mas a parte del que tienen, el credito o solicitaron en otra institucion financiera por un monto de $us 6000, el credito fue desembolsado y a las pocas horas mientras don simon trabajaba con el auto sufrio un grave aacidente, por lo tanto el total del monto desembolsado fue gastado en la operacion del señor, despues de un año de fisioterapia y trabajo duro por parte de doña Celia han salido de este mal momento y estan invirtiendo mas dinero por la cantidad de pedidos que tiene la señora por fin de año, es por eso que el destino de su credito sera para incrementar su capital y poder traer maa mercaderia del Peru
texts.en:
Señora Celia is a new client that arrived at the institution through the recommendation of her sister Rosmery. Celia lives in Codavisa and is her sister's neighbour. She works selling a variety of articles she brings from Desaguadero, including jumpers, bedding, cookware, white potato flour and chillies from Peru. Celia and her husband Simon are a very hard-working couple that live well and planned to buy a car in addition to the one they have. They sought a loan from another financial institution for an amount of US $600. The loan was paid out and a few hours after Simon was working with the car he suffered a grave accident, because of which the entire amount of the loan was spent on his operation. After 1 year of physiotherapy and hard work on Celia's part, they have left this bad period and are investing more money because of the amount of orders Celia has at the end of the year. The loan is destined to be used to increased her capital and to bring more merchandise from Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Rosmeri Jannete

texts.es:
Rosmeri es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de seis años de edad en el sector San Salvador del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo trabaja como mototaxista y debido a que los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar la economía de su hogar, hace un año instaló en su vivienda una bodega con la intensión de apoyar al sostenimiento de la familia. Usalmente ofrece a sus clientes y vecinos productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y verduras.

Su negocio tiene buena acogida debido a que es el único que existe por la zona. Rosmeri desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo. 

Su más grande anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio para hacer mejoras en su vivienda y asegurarle a su hijo una educación de calidad. Ella es una mujer responsable y entregada a su familia y a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosmeri is the mother of a family. She is 26 years old and lives together with her husband and her 6 year old son in San Salvador sector, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located 3 horas from the city of Chiclayo. Her husband works as a taxi driver and the income he receives is not sufficient to cover the household economies. So, one year ago Rosmeri installed a grocery store in their house with the intention to help support her family. Normally she offers her customers and neighbours essential products such as rice, sugar, oil, groceries and vegetables. Her business has been received well, owing to the fact that it is the only one that exists in the zone. Rosmeri wants to increase her business with the purchase of more groceries and essential products but doesn't have the necessary capital to realise this action. For this reason for the first time she is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 nuevos soles which she thinks of using to achieve her objective. Her greatest desire is to be able to expand her business to make improvements to her house and assure her son a quality education. She is a responsible woman and devoted to her family and her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy essential items and grocery items to expand her business

loans.name: Sayra Esther

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, la señora Saira A. con mucha dedicación atiende su propia pulpería que ella misma formó desde hace tres años y es la que le permite tener el sustento para el mantenimiento de su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en edades escolares.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora en su municipio y hoy en día solicita un crédito para la compra de los productos tales como los comestibles y los productos perecederos para surtir su pulpería y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida tanto de ella como de su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, señora Saira A. attends with much dedication to her own local store which she started 3 years ago. It is this which permits her to have the support to maintain her family, composed of her 3 children, 2 of which are school age. She has strived to be a very hard-working woman in her municipality and today she seeks a loan for the purchase of products such as comestibles and perishable products to supply her local store and in this way improve living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for local store

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario A. es una señora  que junto con su esposo hace 8 años iniciaron con un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Granito de Arena”, donde venden de todo como galletas, botanas, refrescos, comida enlatada, algunos artículos para cabello, dulces y más.
Del negocio ellos se mantienen económicamente y con la ayuda de su hijo que los apoya.  Al cargo de ello están 2 nietos que cuidan cuando los papas salen a trabajar.
La señora ahora quiere surtir el negocio para empezar bien el año con mejor mercancía nueva y así obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario A. is a woman who, together with her husband, started a small grocery store 8 years ago called “Granito de Arena”. There she sells items such as cookies, snacks, soft drinks, canned goods, and some items for the hair, candy, and more. With this business and with help from their son they are able to sustain themselves economically. They also care for 2 of their grandchildren when their parents go to work. Maria now wants to stock her store to begin the new year with new and better merchandise and in this way obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Express De Xico Group

texts.es:
Álvaro C. G. tiene 37 años de edad, es casado tiene 6 hijos  y vive en la comunidad de San Miguel Xico 1ª. Sección, Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, Estado de México.
El señor Álvaro anteriormente trabajaba como tablajero en una carnicería ganando un sueldo base con el cual solventaba mas o menos sus gastos pero esto no cubría todas sus necesidades por tal motivo se hizo el propósito de abrir su propio negocio de venta de carne de res, el cual atiende desde hace aproximadamente año tres meses, aunque su negocio a prosperado, pero le gustaría incrementar sus ganancias metiendo la venta de carne de cerdo, solo que no le alcanza para su inversión; hace poco se unio con otros conocidos que tienen la misma necesidad y la cual acuden a fundacion realidad para solicitar un crédito y podría serle se mucha ayuda para lo que deseaba meter en su negocio  y le agradó la idea es por ello que ahora esta solicitando el crédito los cuales tiene contemplados invertir en su carnicería ya que quiere agrandar su negocio con la única finalidad de poder sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos con sus estudios, el señor Álvaro agradece de antemano a Fundación Realidad por el crédito solicitado que esta de pueda otorgar.
El grupo se a de llamar Express de Xico y los integrantes serán los siguientes:

Álvaro C. G.                            Carnicería
Claudia O. H.                           Venta de catalogo (edredones y sabanas)
Ma. De Lourdes Rodríguez P.                   Venta de catalogo (cobertores)
Catalina  Beltrán M.                          Fabricación de ropa (elaboración de suéteres)
Lilia Rodríguez Rodríguez                          Farmacia
Blanca Flor V. Suárez                         Venta de catalogo (zapatos)
Ada V. G.                                 Venta por catalogo (lencería)
Yolanda M. Sánchez                            Artículos domésticos (clarasol)
Erick R. Márquez                                 Café Internet
Aldo Martín Martínez Beltrán                       Acuario (venta de peces)
Silvia Beltrán M.                             Abarrotes
texts.en:
Alvaro is 37 years old, married, and has 6 children. He lives in the community of San Miguel Xico, 1st section, Valley of Chalco Solidaridad, in the State of Mexico. Alvaro used to work as a butcher in a meat shop, earning a salary which more or less provided for basic expenses. But it didn't cover all of his necessities. For that reason, he decided to open his own business selling beef. He has been attending this business for about 1 year and 3 months. Although his business has prospered, he would like to increase his earnings by selling pork. But he lacks the money to invest. Recently, he joined others he knew who have similar needs in approaching Fundacion Realidad to solicit a loan to help obtain the funds he needed to invest in his business. They accepted him and, for that reason, Alvaro is requesting a loan to invest in expanding his butcher shop. His major motive is to advance his 6 children in their studies. Alvaro thanks Fundacion Realidad in advance for the credit he is soliciting. His group is called Express de Xico and the members (and their activities) are as follows: Claudia Catalog sales of eiderdowns and sheets Ma. de Lourdes Coverlets Catalina Making clothing and sweaters Lilia Pharmacy Blanca Flor Catalog shoe sales Ada Linen goods Alvaro Butcher shop Yolanda Domestic articles Erick Internet café Aldo Aquarium fish Silvia Groceries

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MEAT AND DIVERSE PRODUCTS BY CATALOG

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan García Cárdenas  es un señor que ha demostrado ser buen cliente y cumplidor en sus pagos. Los préstamos anteriores eran para mejorar su vivienda donde anteriormente vivía y que pasó a una de sus hijas, el construyo el cuarto de madera, lamina y cartón con dinero propio pero ahora quiere construir su casa con block para que este mejor reforzada y no sufra alguna enfermedad en estos cambios climatológicos.
texts.en:
Juan García Cárdenas is a man who has proven to be a good client and compliant with his payments. The previous loans were to improve his home, where he used to live and has now passed to one of his daughters. He constructed a room of wood, laminate and cardboard with his own money but now wants to construct his house with concrete blocks so it can be better reinforced and so that he doesn't suffer any illness during these climate changes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: J Trinidad

texts.es: El señor J Trinidad  M. tiene poco de estar pensionado aunque el recibe dinero por esto, el quiere sentirse una persona útil; que a pesar de su edad puede trabajar para seguir ofreciéndole una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa. La señora siempre lo apoya en los proyectos de su marido en el que desde hace 8 meses instalaron un negocio de comida en una avenida muy transitada de la ciudad donde venden tacos de barbacoa y menudo por las mañanas. Ahora ellos quieren mejorar el puesto para que se vea bien y les agrade a los clientes.
texts.en:
Señor J Trinidad M. has little to be a pensioner. Although he receives money for this, he wants to feel a useful person, and notwithstanding his age he can work to continue offering a better quality of life to his wife. His wife always supports him in his projects and 8 months ago he installed a food business in a very busy avenue of the city where they sell barbecued tacos and food in the mornings. Now they want to improve their stand so that it looks good and pleases their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of food stand

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ROSARIO, TIENE 42 AÑOS, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 5 HIJOS, POR LO QUE ELLA SE VE MUCHAS VECES EN LA NECESIDAD D. APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES, ELLA ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y SE DEDICA A LAS VENTAS, COMO PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA QUE OFRECE A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS, ANTICUCHOS EN LA PUERTA D. SU CASA PÒR LAS NOCHES Y VENTA D. GAS.
LA SRA.ROSARIO INTEGRA EL GRUPO "MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS" HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS 6 COMPAÑERAS COMO LA TESORERA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO. LA MAYORÍA D. LOS INTEGRANTES RESIDEN EN LA ZONA D. SAN JUAN BAUTISTA EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ PARA INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. GAS.
texts.en:
Senora Rosario is 42 years old, is married and has 5 children, for which reason many times she finds it necessary to support her husband with the household costs. She is very hard-working and works selling beauty products which she offers to her family and friends; anticuchos (kebabs) in the doorway of her house at night; and also sells gas. Senora Rosario is part of the group 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' and has been elected by her 6 colleagues as the treasurer of the joint directive of the group. The majority of the members live in San Juan Bautista zone in the Comas district. The loan being sought will be invested to increase her gas sale business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of gas bottles

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea B. y su esposo se dedican desde hace 14 años a la venta de comida casera y carnitas aun muy bajo precio este negocio es llamado “Carnitas Juan”, esta pareja viven solos ya que sus hijos son grandesy se mantienen solos. Por el momento necesita el crédito para comprar mercancía para el negocio para estar preparados y no les haga falta nada para seguir trabajando en el puesto.
texts.en:
For 14 years Andrea B. and her husband have sold home-cooked food and meat, although at a very low price. The business is called 'Carnitas Juan'. The couple lives alone now that their children are grown up and look after themselves. They require a loan to buy products for the business so that they are prepared and don't lack anything to continue working at their stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for their business

loans.name: Wssias Joyarib

texts.es: Wssias A. L. es una persona que piensa en bienestar de la familia y darles mejor comodidad; es por ello que desde hace 13 años se dedica  al corte de cabello, profesión que desde pequeño se le inculco ya que su padre hacia lo mismo. El tiene un salón de corte de cabello llamada “Peluquería Hollywood”  que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad a unos minutos de su casa, ahora el automóvil se le descompuso y esta batallando para el traslado a su trabajo. Ahora el requiere un préstamo para reparar el automóvil ya que para el es una herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Wssias A. L. is a person that thinks of the well-being of his family and of giving them better comfort; and it is for this reason that for 13 years he has worked cutting hair, a profession instilled in him from an early age as his father did the same thing. Wssias has a hairdressing salon called 'Peluquería Hollywood' which can be found in the city centre, a few minutes from his house. His car is broken and he is battling to get to work. He requires a loan to repair his car as for him it is a tool of his work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair vehicle

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel M. Ramírez  quedo viuda desde hace tiempo en el cual ella recibió un concesión de trasporte urbano, con este negocio ya tiene 16 años.
Ella recibe ingresos rentando el camión, solo que ahora le quiere dar mantenimiento de el para que la gente que se suba vaya segura en el traslado a su destino.
Ella ha demostrado ser una buena cliente donde a realizado sus pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel M. Ramírez has been a widow for some time, because of which she received a transport franchise which she has had for 16 years. She receives earnings from her truck rental, which she only wants to put towards maintaining the truck so that people who rent it travel safely to their destination. She has proved to be a good client and has made her payments punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair truck
